raw_text:
Negotiators of Russian, Ukrainian and US dey go Abu Dhabi wia di first tok-tok between dis three kontris go hold since Russia full-scale invasion of Ukraine for February 2022.

Dis tok-tok dey important well-well for Ukraine and na chance to see weda Moscow dey really serious about peace or dem just dey play games.

Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky say dia meeting na "a step - hopefully towards ending di war", im add say di meeting go focus on di status of Ukraine eastern Donbas region

For di World Economic Forum for Davos on Thursday, im tok say im bin don  reach  agreement wit Trump on future US security guarantee for Ukraine in any deal happun.

Dis dey come afta Russia President Vladimir Putin and Donald Trump envoy bin  hold wetin di Kremlin call "useful" but "very frank" tok for Moscow.

For di Air Force One last night, Trump say im believe say Putin and Zelensky "both of dem wan to make deal", im add say "we go find out"

As dem dey plan for dis meetimg, Overnight, both Ukraine and Russia don report drone attacks.

For messages wey dem post on Telegram, Penza Oblast govnor Oleg Melnichenko claim say drone attack bin cause fire for one oil depot for Penza, di area  dey for south east of Moscow.

While for Ukraine, di general staff of di armed forces don also report air attack as drones hit 12 locations overnight.

Di recent Russian strikes ontop key infrastructure dey target many pipo for Ukraine so dat dem go face freezing temperatures without light to on heater.

For one update on Telegram Friday morning, as temperatures dey between -10C, di mayor of Kyiv say currently na 1,940 multi-story buildings dey without heating. Im say na sake of attacks wey happun early dis month.

Ukraine dey face serious acute energy crisis afta months of relentless Russian attacks ontop dia infrastructure.

Zelensky say Moscow dey deliberately exploit dis cold winter and e don leave tens of thousands of pipo across Ukraine without lifght, heating or running water.

Most of di conventional power plants  for di kontri don dey hit or damaged by Russian air strikes, and Zaporizhzhia - Ukraine biggest power plant - na Russia dey  control am since di war start.

The future of di site na one of di most critical points of any possible future peace deal between Ukraine and Russia.

Plenti tok-tok an dmeetings bin don happun before, some some of dem here:

Ukraine and Russia bin agreed to naval ceasefire for di Black Sea for separate deals with di US afta three days of tok-tok for Saudi Arabia.

Delegations from Ukraine and Russia bin agree to swap 1,000 prisoners of war each afta dem bin hold di first face-to-face tok-tok with each oda since Moscow full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

Di first meeting since 2018 wey Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin shake hands for Alaska - though dem bin make small progress towards peace.

Putin tell tori pipo afta di meeting say dem bin reach unspecified "agreement" but stress say dem need to remove di "root causes" of di conflict before peace go come.

American and Ukrainian negotiators bin meet for Switzerland for tok-tok with one 28-point US-backed peace plan.

Afta some pipo bin criticise di original draft say e favour di Kremlin pass, dem bin update di peace framework.. Zelensky bin tok say e bin include "signals say di President [Donald] Trump team dey hear us".

Di Kremlin bin say na five hours of tok-tok between Putin and Trump top negotiator - Steve Witkoff - and e bin fail to produce any breakthrough, as Moscow bin no gree  accept part of di new peace plan wey include over territory.

One meeting wey bin happun between European officials and Kyiv delegation bin lead to di US offering Nato-like security guarantee, while Zelensky bin signal for di first time say im fit "compromise" on ambitions to join Nato in exchange for strong guarantees.

Shortly before Christmas, US and Ukrainian envoy bin focuse on aligning positions on one US-backed 20-point plan for Miami tok-tok, while US officials bin also meet Russian envoy Kirill Dmitriev.

Zelensky and Trump bin meet for di president resort for Florida, where di Ukrainian leader say tok-tok about di revised peace plan bin dey "close to 95%" done.

Zelensky bin declare say peace tok-tok don reach "di last mile" afta im bin meet Trump on di sidelines of di World Economic Forum, wia im bin tok say dem bin reach agreement on post-war security guarantee.
title: Russian-Ukraine war: Negotiators of Russia, Ukrainia and US dey go Abu Dhabi

raw_text:
President Yoweri Museveni don dey declared as di winner of kontri election wey happun on Thurssday. Dis go mean say di president wey don alreadi dey office for foty years, get anoda five years.

According to di election commission, e win with 72% of di vote as against im closest challenger Bobi Wine wey get only 25%. Wine don call out di statements say na "fake results".

Wine also don call on Ugandans say make dem do non-violent protests.

Museveni na 81 years old man wey enta power as rebel leader for 1986 and since dat time im don win seven elections.

Dem kill at least seven Ugandan opposition supporters overnight for circumstances, wey no clear as President Yoweri Museveni bin dey take a strong lead inside results from Thursday presidential election.

Di opposition say security forces attack dem for di house of one MP for Butambala, about 55km (35 miles) south-west of di capital, Kampala, while police blame di violence on di opposition.

Di 43 year old former popstar, Bobi Wine say dem kill at least 21 pipo for di elections process wey bin get plenti kasala by authorities don confam seven deaths.

Im home for Kampala don dey surrounded by security forces "wey put im and im wife under house arrest", Wine National Unity Platform (NUP) tok.

Di internet shutdown wey dem impose earlier in di week mean say news of di violence just dey come out on Friday for Uganda.

Opposition MP Muwanga Kivumbi tell AFP news agency say soldiers and police fire tear gas and den live bullets give hundreds of people were dey follow early results  for im house.

"Dem kill ten were inside my house," e tok.

Human rights activist Agather Atuhaire confam am give Reuters news agency.

However, local police tok-tok pesin Lydia Tumushabe deny am, e maintain say police fire in self defence after one "group of NUP goons" bin attack one police station and plan to overrun one tallying centre.

She tell Reuters say dem bin carrying machete, axe and box of matches and say at least seven people die.

Meanwhile, some local journalists say security forces don block dem from accessing di opposition leader house for Kampala Magere area.

"Security officers don unlawfully jump over di perimeter fence and now dey set up tents within im compound," NUP post on X late on Thursday.

Police spokesman Kituuma Rusoke tell local broadcaster NBS say as a presidential contestant, Wine na "a person of interest",  adding say di heavy security deployment around im house na for im own security.
title: President Yoweri Museveni win Uganda election to extend im 40 year rule

raw_text:
Chelsea don confam Liam Rosenior as new manager and na six years contract dem give am.

For statement, di club say dem go 'continue to focus on player development' and 'expectations and ambitions remain high'.

Rosenior say 'to get dis ogbonge role mean di world to me' and 'I go give evritin' to bring success to di club.

Rosenior first match go be against Charlton for di FA Cup on Saturday

Interim manager Calum McFarlane wey tok say im don already speak wit Rosenior last night say im go take charge of di match wit Fulham.

Rosenior dey replace Enzo Maresca wey comot from Chelsea on New Year Day and three members of im staff; Khalifa Cisse, Ben Warner and Justin Walker follow am comot.

Liam Rosenior, na former coach of RC Strasbourg for France, im bin fly into London on Sunday evening to finalise agreement wit Chelsea management.

Strasbourg bin don already start di process to pick candidates wey fit replace Rosenior.

Di 41-year-old Englishman Liam Rosenior bin start im coaching career for Brighton and Hoves Albion as dia unda 21 coach.

E later move to Derby County wia e first work as assistant to Phillip Cocu, and later Wayne Rooney 2021 and 2022, and afta Rooney comot, e bicom di interim manager.

Rosenoir also coach Hull City but dem later sack am, despite say e narrowly miss out for di Championship play-off position.

E move to Strasbourg in 2024 and afta 63 matches e don win 31, draw 15 and lose 17.

"Liam bi dey very important for me," Wayne Rooney tell BBC. "E dey incredible for im coaching ability. I bin work more as di manager and dealing wit players and evritin. So I bin learn a lot from am from dat point of view and den I tink say e don do a great job as a whole."

As a player, Rosenoir play almost all im career as full-back or winger for di English Championship. E bin play for clubs like Bristol City, Reading, Ipswich Town, Hull City and Brighton & Hove Albion.

Im time for di English Premier League na wen e join Fulham in 2003. E play im first EPL match against Manchester United and di match end 1-1 wit Rosenior winning di man of di match.

E also play for Reading FC for di EPL, scoring im first goal for di club for di 7-4 defeat against Portsmoth on 30 October, 2007.

Internationally, e don represent England for di U20 and U21 level, playing 11 times for im kontri and scoring just one goal.

Liam papa, Leroy Rosenior, na also football coach and e bin play under im papa wen Fulham bin send am on loan to Torquay United for di English third division in 2004.

Rosenior also get African heritage. Im papa Leroy na from Sierra Leone and e bin also represent di West African kontri for international football.

Di appointment of Rosenior as Chelsea coach wen e dey finalised go dey massive for young English coaches, Wayne Rooney bin tell BBC Sport.

"We no too dey see English managers for big clubs. So e go dey lead di way for us," e tok.

Di only English managers wey dey currently work for di Premier League na Eddie Howe for Newcastle, Scott Parker for Burnley and Sean Dyche for Nottingham Forest.
title: Liam Rosenior: Who be di young coach wey take over as Chelsea new manager

raw_text:
Discova some ogbonge facts about cashew nuts, including weda dis nuts dey good for your nor not.

Na nuts dem dey call cashew, but botanically dem dey classified as seeds becos dem come from di fruit of di cashew tree (also known as drupe). Drupes na fruits wey get flesh on di outside but contain shell wit seed inside. Cashew trees belong to one group of plants called Anacardiaceae, wey include mango, sumac, and poison ivy.

Cashew trees dey grow for warmer climates, such as India and Vietnam, wey dey among di world largest producers of cashew nuts.

Cashews na small, kidney-shaped, pale yellow, and get rich, nutty flavour wey dey slightly sweeter dan peanuts. You fit chop am raw, roasted, as nut butter, or cooked in curries, stir-fries, and pastries.

From nutritional standpoint, cashews na good source of protein and unsaturated fats. A 30g serving contain approximately 160 calories, but becos dem dey rich in protein and unsaturated fats, dem dey provide greater feeling of fullness.

Dis portion also provide about 20% of your daily magnesium intake, wey dey important for hormonal health, and also contain manganese, selenium, iron, and zinc.

1. Dem dey help protect against atherosclerosis and fit lower cholesterol levels

Cashews contain folate and vitamin E, wey dey help protect against blocked or narrowed arteries (atherosclerosis). One 2019 study also find say daily cashew consumption fit help improve cholesterol levels in pipo wit type 2 diabetes.

2. Dem fit help you live longer

Research don show say diets wey dey rich in unsaturated fats, such as dose found in cashew nuts, dey reduce di risk of overall and disease-specific mortality.

3. Dem dey help protect di bodi against oxidative stress

Ova time, oxidative stress fit damage organs, tissues, and even cells, potentially leading to various diseases such as Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, and multiple sclerosis. Antioxidants dey help to neutralise oxidative stress, and cashews na excellent source of antioxidants, particularly polyphenols and carotenoids.

4. Dem dey help reduce di risk of heart disease and stroke

Homocysteine ​​na amino acid, but if levels become too high for bodi, e dey increase inflammation and therefore di risk of heart disease or stroke. Consuming cashew nuts don dey associated wit reduction in homocysteine ​​levels for bodi.

5. Dem fit help reduce degeneration due to osteoarthritis

One 2020 study demonstrate say di combined benefits of antioxidants and anti-inflammatories from cashew nut consumption dey help combat di negative effects of osteoarthritis.

Colitis na inflammatory bowel disease, and research suggest say cashew nuts fit help reduce inflammation and manage colitis.

7. Dem fit help wit healthy weight loss

Research indicate say diets wey include higher intake of nuts, such as cashews, dey associated wit reduced weight gain and lower risk of obesity.

8. Dem fit help manage blood sugar

One 2019 study find say daily consumption of cashew nuts bin help improve insulin sensitivity, and therefore blood sugar management, in pipo wit diabetes. Dis na likely due to dia high protein and unsaturated fat content, wey contribute to healthy blood sugar regulation.

9. Dem fit help reduce di risk of stroke

Cashews na good source of magnesium, and research don show say higher blood levels of magnesium dey associated wit reduced risk of stroke.

10. Dem fit help protect against memory loss

Di good nutritional profile of cashew nuts – proteins, essential fats, vitamins and minerals – dey work togeda to help offer potential benefits against memory loss.

E dey possible to dey allergic to cashew nuts, and if you get any sign of allergic reaction such as difficult breathing, swelling of di face, tongue or lips, contact emergency services, as e fit dey life-threatening.

Pipo wey dey allergic to nuts dey more likely to dey allergic to cashew nuts.

Wen e come to vegan cheese, cashew cheese na one of di best choices becos e dey minimally processed and typically contain only cashew nuts and water, or perhaps a little lemon juice and yeast flakes.

Check di label wen you buy cashew cheese to make sure say e no contain lots of added extras like sugar or extra oil.

Cashew nuts dey offer many health benefits and na good source of nutrients, including protein and unsaturated fats, as well as many vitamins and minerals.

Wit all nuts, you gatz consume dem in moderation as part of balanced diet, and e dey always preferable to eat dem raw instead of make you put salt or roast dem wit honey, wey fit no make you get dia natural health benefits.
title: Reduce risk of heart disease and stroke, help wit healthy weight loss and oda health benefits cashew nuts

raw_text:
Ugandans under di age of 40 - and wey be more dan three-quarters of di population – don only see one president.

Yoweri Museveni seize di top job for 1986 afta one armed revolution and for di age of 81, e no dey show sign of stepping down.

Im time as leader follow long period of peace and significant development, for which many dey grateful. But im critics tok say e maintain im grip on power through mixture of sidelining opponents and compromising independent institutions.

"We no believe in [presidential] term limits," e bin once tell BBC, secure in his role afta e win di election for di fifth time.

A year later, e remove di age limit for presidential candidate – wey make way, many believe, for Museveni to bicom president for life.

Museveni journey start for 1944, wen dem born am into a family of cattle keepers for Ankole, western Uganda.

E grow up during Uganda struggle for independence from UK, wey bin follow a period of brutality and turbulence under Milton Obote and Idi Amin.

For many years, Museveni no sabi di date dem born am, e write for inside im memoir: "We bin get real life-threatening challenges like extra-judicial killings and looting… we no get time to worry about details like dates of birth."

For 1967, Museveni comot Uganda to attend di University of Dar es Salaam for neighbouring Tanzania. For there, e study economics and political science and e forge alliances wit politically active students from around di region.

Museveni name gain prominence for 1970s, afta one coup by di notorious Idi Amin.

Museveni bin help form di Front for National Salvation - one of di rebel groups wey wit di help of Tanzania remove Oga Amin.

Oga Amin bin dey popular for crushing dissent and expelling di kontri Asian community. Under im eight-year rule, dem kill about 400,000 pipo.

"E bin dey part of di colonial system," Museveni tell di Global Indian Network for one recent interview. "Idi Amin dey ignorant... a bit chauvinistic".

Following Amin fall, former President Milton Obote return to power through general election. However, Museveni refuse to accept Obote leadership, e claim say dem rig di vote.

E launch one rebel struggle for 1981 and five years later, im rebel group, di National Resistance Movement (NRM), seize power and Museveni bicom leader.

Uganda economy begin to grow steadily and ova 10 years, di kontri see an average annual growth of more dan 6%.

Primary school enrolment double and HIV levels drop bicos of one anti-Aids campaign wey di president spearhead.

Museveni bicom di darling of di West, but im reputation drop for 1998, wen Uganda and Rwanda attack neighbouring Democratic Republic of Congo in support of rebels wey dey fight to overthrow di govment.

Around dis time, critics also complain say di president dey grow less tolerant of opposing views. E also bicom clear say im no get plans to leave power.

Museveni bin tok for one 1986 collection of writing: "Di problem of Africa in general, and Uganda in particular, no be dat of di pipo but leaders wey wan overstay for power."

But by 2005, e be like say im view don change and Uganda constitution dey amended, wey remove di limitation on how many terms a president fit serve.

For 2017, dem also remove di age limit for presidential candidates - a move wey bin lead to MPs throwing chairs for one chaotic parliamentary brawl.

Museveni don also face allegations say e weaken di independence of key institutions.

In particular, Uganda judiciary chop accuse say dem dey employ so-called "cadre judges" wey dia loyalty lie wit di govment.

Wen judges go against di govment, dem sometimes dey see themselves at loggerheads wit di authorities.

For example, for December 2005, armed security personnel bin raid di High Court for di capital, Kampala, dem rearrest members of one suspected rebel group wey dem free from treason charges.

Di media independence also dey threatened. On di surface, Uganda get lively media industry, but dem don raid plenty organizations and detain several journalists.

Perhaps di most significant factor for Museveni longevity na di way e take subdue potential opposition forces.

Wen e bicom clear say Museveni no get plans to leave power, some of im former associates start to break away. As dem comot, security agencies turn dia attention on dem.

For instance, Kizza Besigye of di opposition Forum for Democratic Change, na Museveni doctor bifor.

E run against di president for 2001. Since then, dem don arrest and prosecute am plenty times.

For 2024, e mysteriously disappear from Nairobi, only to appear four days later for one Ugandan military court. E still dey for jail on treason charges, wey e don deny.

Di Pop star wey turn politician, Bobi Wine, na di latest Museveni critic to face di wrath of di state.

Di 43-year-old opposition leader, wey im star power draw huge crowds of youngsters, bin chop arrest, dem put am for prison and charge am wit crimes wey include treason. Dem later drop all di charges.

For 2021, police tear-gas and even shoot Bobi Wine plus im supporters. Di police say e disobey coronavirus restrictions on large gatherings.

During di current campaign period, security forces don use "firearms and live ammunition to scata peaceful assemblies" and abduct opposition party members in unmarked vans, one UN report tok.

For di middle of dis, Museveni tell kontri pipo say "one soja dey carry 120 bullets". However, e bin order police say make dem no beat opposition supporters but make dem use tear gas instead.

Museveni supporters point to di relative stability wey Uganda don enjoy for decades since e dey power.

Emmanuel Lumala Dombo, one tok-tok pesin for di NRM, tok say more dan 1.7 million pipo bin japa to Uganda afta dem run from di kasala wey dey happun for dia own countries.

"Forty years ago, we bin dey among di biggest exporters of refugees among di neighbouring countries wey surround us," Dombo tell BBC. "Right now Uganda na di biggest host of refugees for Africa."

One Museveni supporter wey bin surprisingly, turn up for one Bobi Wine rally tok di same thing.

Ndyasima Patrick tell BBC say im go vote for Museveni becos "na im keep us alive for all these years".

E also dey respect Museveni age and e feel say Bobi Wine go only dey ready to lead Uganda wen e reach im 50s.

Museveni govment recently begin encourage foreign investment, as dem don strike deals wit di likes of China, di United Kingdom plus di United Arab Emirates. E say im want make Uganda bicom a middle-income country by 2040.

Museveni see imsef no be only as a stable, ambitious presence, but also as a nurturing figure for Uganda youth. E dey fondly call im young followers Bazukulu (wey mean grandchildren for di Luganda language) and dem dey call am wir nicknames M7 or Sevo.

But wit eye on Bobi Wine, wey roughly be half of Museveni age, di president dey always show im vitality.

For 2020, to encourage exercise during lockdown, dem feem am as e dey do press-ups, and e repeat di trick several times dat year, plus in front of cheering students.

E don tok about im health on numerous occasions, late last year e say: "I don dey hia wit you for 40 years now. You don ever hear say I go hospital? Except wen I get [coronavirus] for 21 days."

As Museveni ages, critics worry say e dey turn di kontri into im family affairs.

Dem note say di president wife, Janet, na di education minister and im son, Gen Muhoozi Kainerugaba na di head of di army.

Museveni grandson bin also enrol for di army for July, one move pipo see as say e dey extend di family dynasty.

Di NRM neva tok much on how dem plan to manage Museveni succession, but speculation full ground say im 51-year-old son, Gen Kainerugaba go take im place.

Should dis come to pass, e fit jeopardise Museveni legacy of stability. Pipo sabi Gen Kainerugaba as pesin wey dey unpredictable and provocative, especially on social media.

E bin use X to joke about invading Kenya, rile Ethiopia by backing Egypt during one kwanta between di two countries, e also admit say e detain Bobi Wine bodyguard for im basement.

At di moment, however, wit almost four decades of experience behind him, Museveni dey confident say im go win di election for di seventh time.

"Uganda dey secure. Go out and vote," e tell di public during one New Year Eve address. "Di Ugandan NRM dey unstoppable."

Additional reporting by Sammy Awami
title: E once condemn African leaders wey hold on to power. Now e wan run for seventh term

raw_text:
One go wonder why pesin wey predict say di world go end on 25 December now dey inside police cooler dis new year for Ghana.

Because di 33-year-old wey become popular towards di end of 2025 wit im doomsday prophecy say God go destroy di world wit flood, dey face charge of "false publication wit di intention to cause fear and panic".

Ebo Noah wey im real name be Evans Eshun cause drama for social media wen he tok say he dey build ark like di one Noah inside di bible build, to accommodate millions of pipo from around di world when God decide to use flood to destroy di world on Christmas day.

From dat time, many tins happen, God no destroy di world wit flood on 25 December and now Ebo Noah dey inside serious trouble wit police. But how he start dis whole circus?

For im social media account for TikTok, Instagram and Facebook, Ebo Noah tok say he get revelation from God to build ark to save pipo of di world from destruction on 25 December.

Even though he no ever mention di year of dis revelation, Ebo Noah use jute sack as im official costume wey he dey carry big Bible dey move around.

Inside many of im viral videos, he wear di jute sack wey he go dey on top of some mountain or by some river to record di message of di '25 December flood'.

End of Di one wey oda users dey read well well

"My name be Ebo Noah wey I get revelation through dream say make I build ark, sake of God say he go destroy di world. Very soon, I go call everybody in pairs by 25 December, I go finish building di ark," Ebo Noah tok inside one of im first videos on 21 August 2025 as he dey stand in front of one boat wey dem dey construct.

He end dat video by asking pipo to comment "I wan go" if dem wan enta dis ark. Since then, Ebo Noah post series of videos to remind pipo for social media to "repent and accept Jesus" bifor di flood on 25 December.

As time dey go, Ebo Noah begi grab attention, Some compare am to di Bible story of Noah when God save im and only seven oda pipo from im family during di flood when he decide to destroy di world.

Even though di Bible later tok say God promise Noah and all living tins afta dat flood say he no go ever destroy di earth wit flood again, many pipo believe say anytin still dey possible.

Ebo Noah begin get plenty followers, afta im videos begin to go viral.

Currently, Ebo Noah get more than 1.3 million followers across social media. Inside public transport, for pubs, streets and offices, many pipo discuss Ebo Noah and im doomsday prophecy.

Until one popular content creator Frederick Mattey alias "Headless Youtuber" eventually find say di pictures and videos wey Ebo Noah dey post for social media no br be ark he dey build.

Frederick Mattey visit di Elmina fishing harbour where he interview fishermen and pipo wey dey build some boats for di harbour wey confam say Ebo Noah take photos for there.

"Ebo Noah come here come take pictures and videos of dis boats we dey build for here. In fact, one day dem even wan beat am as dem see say he dey use di pictures to create content for social media say he dey build ark," one of di fisherman tell "headless youtuber".

"Di time we see di video, we dey laugh sake of we dey here wey we see am when he dey capture everytin, so all be lie. He no dey build any ark anywhere," di fishermen tok.

Despite di gist from di fishermen and oda pipo for di Elmina Fishing Harbour wia he go take pictures and videos of dia boats, e get chance say some pipo still believe say God go destroy di world.

According to social media reports, di tori grab attention of not only pipo for Ghana but from outside Ghana.

Ebo Noah continue to post more videos where he go warn pipo say if dem no enta di ark, make dem blame diaserf for whatever go hapun to dem.

Across social media pipo create content about him and his doomsday prophecy.

But on 24 December, Ebo Noah release anoda video when he tok say God decide to postpone di floods, so e no go hapun on 25 December anymore.

"Through my prayers and intercession of oda pastors, God give us more time to build more arks wey fit contain di millions of pipo wey go come from all over di world," he tok inside di video.

He add say "we go build more arks so tomorrow [25 December], make nobody rush to any location. I no dey sell tickets, I no dey collect money from anybody; so I beg make you stay home and enjoy yourself but make you repent, sake of still we dey build di arks."

Hours afta dat video – Ebo Noah show up for di concert ofGhanaian rapper Sarkodie on 25 December.

He collect microphone on di stage wey di party goers dey where e tok say "we all our prayers work, God dey reveal to redeem, so for now let di party begin".

Dat be how dem start di concert dat night.

On 31 December 2025, di IGP special cyber vetting team arrest Ebo Noah ahead of di watchnight service to cross-over into 2026.

Viral videos for social media show when di police team arrest am wey dem put handcuff for his hand when he still dey wear di jute sack.

Di circuit court for Adentaremand him into police custody wey dem order say make he undergo psychiatric examination for any govment facility bifor dia next court appearance.

Di court wey Angela Attachie dey preside, direct say make dem reappear on 15 January 2026.

On top di charge sheet, di statement of offence be "publication of false news wit intent to cause fear and panic contrary to section 76 of di electronic communication act".

According to brief facts about di case for di charge sheet, di suspect (Ebo Noah) wey be private security guard for Accra, between August and December 2025, publish plenty videos for his Facebook, TikTok, Instagram and YouTube in which he "falsely claim say di world dey come to an end on 25 December wey he dey build ark for pipo wey go dey saved."

Di facts wey Benjamin Owusu in charge of di case write for di charge sheet add say "following one intelligence operation, we arrest di suspect for his hideout for Weija-Gbawe, where he admit for his caution statement say he record and circulate di videos. For social media.

He also admit say di boats wey he describe as ark inside his videos, neva belong to him, but rather dem be for fishermen at di boat yard for Edina for di Central Region."

Benjamin Owusu Gyamfi also explain say, "di suspect admit again say di claims he make be false, wey he tok say no flood dey come hapun wey go destroy di world; all be his own fabrication."

Director for special investigations unit for CID Chief Superintendent Seth Sewornu tok say, "one pesin from Liberia even pack his tins and enta Ghana to find di ark sake of Ebo Noah."

"From our interrogation, he no be prophet, he be private security man for one school, wey he dey hold HND degree from Accra polytechnic."

Since im arrest, many pipo including some celebrities dey react. Rapper Sarkodie wey Ebo Noah make appearance for im concert on 25 December, tok say he no know wetin di content creator do wey dem arrest am.

"I no know wetin exactly be di crime of my boy, but from di first day I know he dey create content, unless dem dey charge am wit sometin else," di state broadcastergbc quote for dia online story.

One popular lawyer Professor Kwaku Asare alias Kwaku Azar criticize di charges.

He write for im social media page say "di issue here no be whether di speech be false, strange or irresponsible. But whether di law wey di state dey quote fit di alleged conduct."

"On di face of di charge sheet, di conduct no fit di charge – section 76 of di law dey to protect public safety not to punish tins wey be absurd or police belief.

Unless di speech dey coupled wit fraud, coercion or real-world disruption, criminal prosecution risk turning di state into arbiter of belief," Kwaku Azar write.

Inside one viral video, pesin wey dem describe as Ebo Noah mother beg di police and di president to forgive her son.

"Wetin Ebo Noah do no good. He no get money to even build di ark. He just use pipo for Ghana and all ova di world to catch cruise. So make you have mercy on him and forgive am."

For now, pipo dey wait 15 January when dem go call di case again for court – when dem go take im plea.

For Ghana, pesin wey dey guilty of publication of false news fit enta prison for up to five years or a fine or both.
title: Ebo Noah: From predicting end of di world to police detention

raw_text:
Nigerians dominate for di just concluded 9th All Africa Music Awards, Afrima, wit Burna Boy winning di Album of the Year award for im latest work, No Sign of Weakness.

E also share di award for Best African Collaboration wit fast-rising compatriot Shallipopi, wey also win Song of the Year for im hit single Laho, wey make waves for social media.

But na Rema win di most, E carry three awards: Artiste of the Year, Best Male Artiste in Western Africa, and Best African Artiste in RnB and Soul.

Oda Nigerian winners include Yemi Alade and Phyno plus Qing Madi wey win Most Promising Artiste of the Year, while Chella win di title of African Fans Favourite.

Di organisers also honour ogbonge Nigerian music executives and brothers Kenny Ogungbe and Dayo 'D1' Adeneye with di Lifetime Achievement Awards.

Burna Boy No Sign of Weakness - Winner (Nigeria)

Laho - Shalipoppi - Winner (Nigeria)

Friends, family and well wishers show for di burial of  Nollywood actress, writer and producer, Allwell Ademola wey hapun for Atan, Yaba Cemetery on Friday January 9, 2026.

For di burial friends, family and well wishers wear white

Di multi-talented actress bin appear for screen acting, she bin also do stage acting, wey include for di National Theatre.

For 2006, she bin release album wit di band Allwell and Company.

Her death shock many pipo especially her fans and di Nollywood industry wey still dey mourn.

Her broda , Adeboyega Adebayo tok say im neva still digest di news about her death as im add say im dey miss evritin about her.

"To grow up togeda wit her, she bin dey veri adventurous, neva bullied and neva intimidated, wit her size she no get anytin like low self esteem."

Im describe di late [Allwell] as one of im two body guards for life. "She bin dey physically strong, vivacious and full of life na so she take enta inside acting sake of say she bin want to dey out there.

She dey so bold, she fit tok to crowd, she no go any speech school, she no learn am from anywia.

Pipo for di industry dey tell us say make we no cry, say she don already impact pipo.” E tok.

Reports say Allwell die on December 27, 2025 at di age of 49 afta she fall sick for her house.

Na her family later confam her death for statement wey bin clear di rumours and tori wey bin dey fly upandan.

For di statement, wey Adegboyega Adebayo sign on behalf of her family to announce her passing, dem tok say she die on Saturday, 27 December at di age of 49.

"Wit heavy hearts and total submission to di will of God, we announce di passing of our beloved sister, mother and aunt Princess Allwell Ademola wey comot dis world on Saturday, 27th of December at di age of 49," di statement read.

Di cause of her death no dey announced officially.
title: Nollywood actor Allwell Ademola make her final journey

raw_text:
Patients wey get movement problems, including restless legs syndrome (RLS), don tok say doctors no warn dem about serious side effects of di drugs wey dem prescribe give dem, wey later make dem enta risky sexual behaviour.

Twenty women don tell BBC say di drugs wey dem give dem for RLS don spoil dia lives.

One report from pharmaceutical company GSK, wey BBC see, show say connection between one drug wey dem dey call dopamine agonist and "misleading" sexual behaviour bin already show since 2003.

Di report still mention case of one man wey sexually assault one pikin while e dey take Parkinson's medication.

Even though di information leaflet no clearly mention dis side effect, di UK medicines regulator tell BBC say general warning dey about increased sexual desire and harmful behaviour.

Like many women, Claire first get RLS wen she bin pregnant. Apart from strong urge to move, she dey suffer insomnia and crawling feeling under her skin.

Wen di problem kontinu afta she born, doctors prescribe dopamine agonist drug called ropinirole for her.

She say doctors no warn her about any side effects.

At first, di drug work well for her RLS, but afta about one year, she begin feel strange sexual desire.

Claire say she begin dey leave house early morning just go look for sex.

She say she go wear shirt wey show her bodi well, and even wen she wear jacket, she go bend her chest down anytime she see man.

She say even though she get partner, she still dey do all dis tins for dangerous places.

"One part of your mind know say wetin you dey do wrong, but di tin affect you sotey you no even know wetin you dey do," Claire tok.

She say e take years bifor she realise say na di medication cause di cravings, and immediately she stop di drug, di behaviour disappear.

She say she feel shame and depression sake of di danger wey she put hersef inside.

According to health bodi Nice, impulsive behaviours like gambling and increased sexual desire don dey listed as side effects for dopamine agonist drugs for long time, and dem tink say between six and 17 percent of RLS patients fit experience am.

According to NHS, "common" side effects normally affect only about one percent of pipo.

Di drugs dey work by copying dopamine, one natural chemical for brain wey dey help control movement. Dem still dey call dopamine "happiness hormone" becos e dey active wen somtin sweet or rewarding happun.

But experts say dopamine agonist drugs fit reduce sense of consequence by boosting emotional feelings, wey fit lead to risky behaviour.

Among di cases wey GSK describe as "misleading practice" for dia 2003 report, na two men wey dem prescribe ropinirole for Parkinson's disease.

For one case, one 63-year-old man sexually assault seven-year-old girl and go prison.

Di documents say di man sexual desire increase well-well since e start ropinirole, and di problem stop afta dem reduce di dose.

According to Professor Valerie Vaughan from University of Cambridge, di real number of pipo wey dey get "misleading" sexual behaviour from di drugs no dey known becos many no dey report am.

"Plenti shame and stigma dey around am, and pipo no realise say na medication dey cause am," she tok.

Professor Vaughan believe say hospitals and doctors suppose warn patients clearly about risky sexual behaviour, becos di effect fit dey "devastating".

Dem believe say RLS dey affect about one in evri 20 adults, and women dey almost times two more likely to suffer am dan men.

Di 20 patients wey BBC tok to say doctors no only fail to warn dem about serious side effects, dem also no follow up to check how di drugs dey affect dem later.

Sarah dey 50 years old wen dem prescribe anoda dopamine agonist drug for her from different company.

"Bifor, even if Brad Pitt enta room naked, I no go dey interested," she tok. "But dis drug turn me to woman wey get strong sexual addiction."

Sarah begin dey sell used underwear and sexual videos online, arrange phone sex wit strangers, and still begin shop anyhow, wey put her inside £30,000 debt.

Later dem admit her for treatment, but dem collect her driving licence and she lose her job.

"I turn to tins wey no dey healthy. I know say dis behaviour no be me, but I no fit control am," she tell BBC.

Anoda woman, Sue, say dem prescribe two different dopamine drugs for her and nobodi warn her about compulsive behaviour side effects.

She say wen dem give her di second drug, she even mention say she don start gamble and don lose £80,000.

"E affect my family badly. I lose money wey for change our lives," she tok.

"But at dat time, I no know say no be my fault."

BBC don learn say four Parkinson's disease patients take GSK go court for 2011.

Dem say ropinirole cause gambling debts and destroy relationships, and dem complain say GSK no include warning until March 2007, even though clinical studies don show link between di drug and such behaviour since early 2000s.

Similar serious side effects don dey reported for oda kontris, especially for Parkinson's patients.

For France, one court order one father of two to get compensation afta e complain say ropinirole force am enta homosexuality, while anoda man wey neva get criminal record begin torture cats.

American Academy of Sleep Medicine recommend say make dem only use di drugs for short-term treatment.

Some of di women wey BBC tok to still complain say long-term use of di drugs make dia RLS worse.

Dis make doctors increase di dose, wey later increase dia compulsive behaviour.

Consultant neurologist Dr Guy Leschner say di drugs still dey important, but pharmaceutical companies, health authorities and doctors need to warn patients beta.

"Evribodi no know di kain serious changes wey fit happun," e tok.

Forstatement,GSK tell BBC say ropinirole don go through "extensive clinical trials".

Di company say di drug dey effective, but like all drugs, e get side effects and dem clearly state dem for prescribing information.

About di 2003 research wey link di drug to "misleading" sexual behaviour, GSK say dem share am wit health authorities.

Di latest pamphlet for ropinirole mention changes in sexual interest for five different places, warning say di feelings fit become "unusually high" or "excessive".

UK Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency say even though di warning no clearly mention "inappropriate" sexual behaviour, e include general warning about harmful activities.

Dem add say health professionals suppose explain di risk to patients, and say no be evribodi go experience such side effects.

Di Department of Health and Social Care refuse to comment.

Note: Some names for dis tori don change to protect di identities of di pipo wey dey involved.
title: Drug wey fit make women develop dangerous sexual addiction wey doctors no warn about

raw_text:
French actress Brigitte Bardot don die at di age of 91, her foundation tok.

Di statement wey AFP news agency see, call her "world-renowned actress and singer, wey choose to abandon her ogbonge career to dedicate her life and energy to animal welfare and her foundation".

"Di Brigitte Bardot Foundation announce wit immense sadness di death of dia founder and president, Madame Brigitte Bardot, a world-renowned actress and singer, wey choose to abandon her prestigious career to dedicate her life and energy to animal welfare and her foundation."

Di statement no tok di time or place wia Bardot die.

She feature for a number of French cinema hits in di 1950s and 1960s – wey include 1956's And God Created Woman – she dey known as symbol of sexual liberation

Dem born Brigitte Anne-Marie Bardot for Paris on 28 September 1934 to a wealthy family.

She go on to star in a number of French cinema hits, including 1956's And God Created Woman.

She dey popularly known as "BB" for her home kontri. Bardot dey known as a symbol of sexual liberation for di 1950s - and she don act inside almost 50 films.

Later in life, she dey fined multiple times on top accuse say she incite racial hatred.

Afta nearly 50 feems, Bardot turn heads wen she announce say she go step away from di big screen wen she be just 39 for 1973.

Instead, she announce say she go dedicate her life to animal welfare.

"I give my youth and beauty to men, I give my wisdom and experience to animals," Bardot famously tok.

For 1986, Bardot launch her own animal rights charity - di Brigitte Bardot Foundation - wey dey work to protect wild and domestic animals.

Di actress later becom vegetarian, and for 2013, she bin threaten to apply for Russian citizenship in protest against plans to kill two sick elephants for one French zoo.

Her activism get international scope and e go far: for 2001, Bardot celebrate success afta she sign one deal wit di mayor of Bucharest to save about 100,000 stray dogs from death.

According to dia website, Bardot foundation now get "more dan 70,000 donors worldwide, nearly 300 employees and more dan 500 volunteer investigators and delegates".

For 1959, Brigitte - afta several love affairs – marry one actor Jacques Charrier, wey dem togeda feature for one feem Babette Goes To War.

Di couple get one son, Nicolas, but Bardot hate her pregnancy: repeatedly she go punch hersef for belle and beg doctor for morphine to cause miscarriage.

"I look my flat, slender belly for di mirror like a dear friend upon whom I dey about to close a coffin lid," she later recall.

Afta di inevitable divorce, Nicholas no see im mother for decades.

E sue Bardot for emotional damage wen she publish one autobiography wey she tok say she for prefer to "give birth to little dog".

Brigitte at di time na di highest paid actress for France, and some suggest say she dey more valuable in terms of foreign trade pass di kontri car industry.

But she want make pipo take her seriously as actress. "I no get veri much chance to act," she complain, "mostly I gatz undress."

She begin to attract di attention of Europe most respected feem-makers, winning critical acclaim for Jean-Luc Godard powerful, New Wave drama, Le Mépris (Contempt).

But di overall quality of her output dey mixed, especially wen she venture outside France and into Hollywood.

A third marriage to one millionaire German playboy, dey followed by a string of lovers - although, uncharacteristically, she reject Sean Connery.

She make dozens of records, alongside Serge Gainsbourg and Sacha Distel.

Afta nearly 50 feems, she announce say she dey retire to devote her life to animal welfare for 1973.

"I give my beauty and my youth to men", she tok. "I go give my wisdom and experience to animals".

She raise 3m francs (den about £300,000) to establish di Brigitte Bardot Foundation, by auctioning off her jewellery and feem memorabilia.

Bardot bin campaign against di annual seal cull for Canada, and e irritate some of her kontri pipo as she condemn di eating of horse meat.

She becom vegetarian, she attack di Chinese govnment for "torturing" bears, and spend hundreds of thousands on one programme to sterilise Romanian stray dogs.

For her later years, authorities prosecute her on multiple occasions for racial hatred.

She bin kick against di way di Islamic and Jewish faiths slaughter animals for food.

But di way she take voice her criticism bin dey unforgivable, and - indeed - illegal.

For 1999, she write say "Overpopulation of foreigners don attack her homeland, especially Muslims". Dis land Bardot huge fine.

She bin go on to criticise interracial marriages and insult gay men wey, in her words, "jiggle dia bottoms, put dia little fingers for di air, and wit dia little castrato voices moan about wetin dose ghastly heteros put dem through".

Bardot bin dey for court so often dat for 2008, di prosecutor declare say im dey "weary" of charging her.

For di 1960s, dem choose Brigitte Bardot as di official face of Marianne, di emblem of French liberty.

Den she hersef becom icon: beautiful, liberated, modern woman wey no gree conform to outdated stereotypes.

Afta three failed marriages plus plenti suicide attempts, she give up di spotlight to campaign against cruelty to animals.

She dey survived by her fourth husband Bernard d'Ormale, one former adviser to di late far-right politician Jean-Marie Le Pen.

And, for troubled end to troubled life, Bardot political opinions mean say she spend her final years as semi-recluse fighting race-hate allegations for courts.
title: French cinema star Brigitte Bardot die at age 91

Police for Nigeria don begin investigation into di death of popular Fuji singer Afeez Adesina wey pipo sabi as Destiny Boy as fresh details continue to come out from im family and public afta di singer death at di age of 22.

Di Ogun State Police Command confam say dia homicide section dey handle di case and say dem don make one arrest.

Inside statement wey dem release on Monday 19 January, di police say investigations dey go on and dem no disclose further details about di suspect or di circumstances wey surround di death.

"Di Ogun State Police Command don since commence investigations into di death of Adesina Afeez, aged 22 years, popularly known as Destiny Boy.

"Di case don dey transferred to di State Criminal Investigation Department (SCID), Homicide Section, for detailed investigation. One suspect currently dey for custody while investigations dey go on," di statement tok.

News of Destiny Boy death break on Sunday 18 January and quickly spread across social media and trigger shock, grief and widespread speculation. Family of di singer don bury am according to Islamic rites.

As di rumours of wetin kill am dey circulate online, Destiny Boy mama, Saida, release one video on Monday 19 January wia she address di cause of her son death.

She say di singer bin don dey battle long-term illness wey dey always cause seizures.

According to her, di illness, locally referred to as "Ogu oru", bin don persist for years and require both medical and traditional treatment. She explain say di family bin take Destiny Boy to several hospitals and also seek traditional remedies so dem go fit stabilise im condition.

"We bin no let di public know about dis becos na superstar. We take am to churches, herbalists, etc for am to get a cure but no level," she tok.

Saida say di seizures sometimes become severe, and e dey force di family members to restrain am so e no go run into danger. She dismiss claims wey dey circulate online say di singer bin dey involved for money rituals, and she describe such allegations as false and hurtful.

She add say Destiny Boy bin dey active and dey interact wit fans just a day bifor im death, and bin even mention plans to perform for one show on Sunday bifor im condition reportedly worse again.

For anoda development, di singer papa don appeal to di public for help ova di disappearance of im son SUV, days afta im death.

For one video on social media, Destiny Boy papa say one driver don return di SUV to di dealer wey di singer buy am from witout di family knowledge. E explain say e bin follow im son to buy di vehicle and add say di dealer bin provide driver to drive am home on di day dem buy am.

According to di singer papa, Destiny Boy later retain di same driver for personal use. E say problem start wen di driver claim say di singer owe am money and return di SUV to di dealer. Di papa say im no get di driver contact and neva dey able to locate di vehicle since.

E call on Nigerians to assist am to trace di SUV, and add say di situation still dey shake di family,

Destiny Boy death don continue to generate intense reactions online.

Videos wey show im body as dem dey transport am to mortuary don circulate on social media cause speculation and conspiracy theories about wetin fit don kpai am.

Some social media users question di handling of di case, while odas dey demand transparency.

Oda social media users express concern ova di lack of post-mortem examination bifor dem bury di singer.

Afeez Adesina aka Destiny na fast rising Nigerian Afrofuji singer wey dem born on June 24, 2004.

Bifor im death on Sunday 18 January, im be one of di most promising young talents for Nigeria music scene. E dey fuse Fuji music wit contemporary Afrobeats.

E break into di spotlight for 2019 wen im Fuji-inspired cover of Davido hit song If bin go viral on social media, and make am popular at di age of 15 years old. Di success bin mark di start of im music career as e release original songs, reinterpret popular hits and perform for audiences across Nigeria and beyond.

Destiny Boy die for Ijebu-Ode, Ogun State, southwest Nigeria. E leave behind a partner and dia pikin wey dem born for November 2024.
title: Destiny Boy mama tok wetin kpai am as police begin investigation

raw_text:
Donald Trump don vow say e go '100%' carry out im threat to impose tax on European kontris wey no gree to im demand to take ova Greenland.

European allies don stand gidigba for Greenland sovereignty. Denmark foreign minister don make am clear say US president no fit use threat to claim ownership of di semi-autonomous Danish territory.

UK Foreign Secretary Yvette Cooper tok say di UK position be say di future of Greenland na for 'Greenlanders and di Danes alone' to decide.

On Monday, Trump decline to rule out di use of force, and im dey insist say e go continue wit di threatened tax wey go affect goods arriving from UK and seven oda Nato kontris.

Inside one social media post wey im post ontop Truth Social early on Tuesday morning, di US president tok say im get one "beta telephone call" wit Nato secretary general Mark Rutte, and dem agree make dem meet "for various parties" in Switzerland dis week.

E tok say: "Greenland dey very imperative for National and World Security. No going back — On dat everybody don gree!"

Trump don tok say im go charge Britain 10% tariff "on any and all goods" wey dem send go US from 1 February, e go increase to 25% from 1 June, until dem reach a deal wit Washington to buy Greenland from Denmark.

E tok say di same go apply to Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, di Netherlands and Finland - all of dem na members of di defence alliance Nato wey dem start in 1949.

Wen dem ask am if e go follow through on di tariff threat, Trump tell NBC News: "I go do am, 100%."

Wen di outlet ask weda e go use force to take di territory, di president reply "no comment."

Trump add say: "Europe suppose focus on di war wey dey happun wit Russia and Ukraine, you don see wetin e don bring for dem... Na wetin Europe suppose focus on - no be Greenland."

Denmark don warn say if US do military action for Greenland, na im go end Nato.

In recent days, Greenland don get support from European members alliance - some even send small troops go Greenland last week just to show say dem dey dia.

However, Trump follow di deployment to annouce tariffs on di eight Nato allies.

Danish foreign minister Lars Løkke Rasmussen tok say Europe gatz show President Trump say im tariff threat "no be di way forward."

"We get red lines wey no suppose cross," e tell Sky News. "You no fit threaten your way to own Greenland. I no get plan to make dis matta worse."

Germany Chancellor Friedrich Merz tok say di tariffs no benefit anyone, and e hope to meet wit US president during im trip to Davos for World Economic Forum.

E tok say: "We no want dis escalation. We no wan trade fight wit United States of America."

E also add say di Trump administration no go dey surprise say Nato reconnaissance mission ova di weekend, as dem don announce am and agree before.

"No be military action at all," di German chancellor tok.

Di European Union go hold emergency summit for Brussels on Thursday to meet dia leaders discuss how to reply Trump latest threat to take over Greenland.

Kaja Kallas, di EU foreign policy chief, tok say di bloc "no get interest to start fight, but dem go hod dia ground."

"But trade threat no be di way we go about dis," Kallas add. "Sovereignty no fit be for trade."

Dem don release text message wey Trump and Norway prime minister exchange - wey show say on Sunday, US president blame Norway say na dem cause am make e no win Nobel Peace Prize.

For im reply - wey BBC see - Jonas Gahr Støre tok say na independent committee, no be Norway govment, award di prize wey dem give last October but e go to Venezuela opposition leader María Corina Machado.

"Norway position on  Greenland dey clear. Greenland na part of Kingdom of Denmark, and Norway dey support Denmark on dis matta," Støre add.

Trump also address di text message for one interview on Monday and say: "Norway dey totally control [di Nobel Prize] no matter wetin dem tok.

"Dem sabi say dem no get anytin to do wit am, but dem get hand for everything wey get to go wit am."

Meanwhile, di North American Aerospace Defense Command (Norad) annouce say multiple aircraft dey come to Pituffik Space Base for Greenland on Monday.

Di joint US-Canada military defence  organisation don stress say part of dia routine operation na to "support various long-planned Norad activities," and dem also tok say dem don coordinate am wit Denmark and dem don inform Greenland govment.

Similar Norad operations happun for dat base in 2022, 2023, and last year.
title: Trump wan carry out '100%' Greenland tariff threat, as EU stand to protect dia interest

Di US don suspend all support to di govment of Somalia, accuse officials say dem destroy warehouse of UN World Food Programme (WFP) and seize "food aid wey donors fund."

"One tolerance wey di Trump administration get for waste, theft and diversion of life-saving assistance na zero,"statement from US State Department tok for X.

Di message, wey dem post for di account of di under secretary for foreign assistance, say dem receive reports say officials illegally seize 76 tonnes of food wey suppose go help "vulnerable Somalis."

Di statement add say any plan to resume di assistance go depend on Somalia govment "taking responsibility for dia unacceptable actions and taking correct steps to fix di matter."

Even though di US don comot from some UN organisations under President Donald Trump,e still be di biggest contributor to di World Food Programme (WFP) by far, as e pay $2bn (£1.5bn) for 2025 – almost one-third of di agency total funding.

Di Somali govment, wey don dey fight al-Qaeda-linked Islamist militants for long as e dey try rebuild di kontri afta serious civil war and years of drought, neva tok anytin about di matter yet.

Dis na di latest sign of how relationship between Washington and Mogadishu dey spoil.

Last month, Trump attack Somali migrants wey dey live for di US,tell reporters say make dem "go back to wia dem come from" and say "dia kontri no good for a reason".

Immigration raids don target some communitiesas di govment dey accuse pipo of large-scale benefit fraud for Minnesota, di US state wey get di highest Somali population for America.

Di recent decision by US ally Israel to recognise di breakaway republic of Somaliland – wey Somalia still see as part of im territory – don further anger Mogadishu.

According to WFP, di aid wey dem allege say Somali officials seize suppose help people manage di effects of "drought, floods, conflict, high food prices and poor harvests".

Di agency quote figures show say about4.6 million pipo for Somalia dey face serious hunger crisis.
title: US stop help for Somalia

raw_text:
Beyoncé na di fifth musician wey go become billionaire as e join Jay-Z, Swift, Bruce Springsteen and Rihanna to become di world wealthiest pipo, according to Forbes.

Di American star don join di elite group of musicians wit 10-figure fortunes, Forbes report, Taylor Swift, Rihanna, Bruce Springsteen and her husband Jay-Z dey di list di list, wey di magazine publish.

Earlier dis month, Forbes estimate Beyoncé net worth as $800m (£593m) and dem predict say she go cross di billionaire threshold for di first time afta years of success.

Her 2023 Renaissance World Tour make am almost $600m, dis make her and Taylor Swift as one of di biggest pop music icons for di world.

Beyoncé produce feem for her concert performance, dis na her first solo tour afta seven years, and she distribute am directly through one deal wit AMC theater chain, she pocket $44m (£33m) wey she make according to di global box office gross from di feem.

Her 2024 album Cowboy Carter, wey celebrate and show di black roots of country music, win di album of di year for Grammy Awards - na di first time Beyoncé go win dat prestigious award, even though dem don nominate her four times.

Forbes estimate di Cowboy Carter tour - wey get guest appearances from Jay-Z, two of dia three pikin and former Destiny Child mates - make more dan $400m in ticket sales and anoda $50m in merchandise wey dem sell for di shows.

While di tour break ticket records for Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in London and Stade De France for Paris, e still get slow ticket sales wey make promoters slash some prices to fill seats.

However, na still di highest top-priced ticket for any artist wey go visit UK in 2025, and e cost £950, while di cheapest na £71.

One special halftime show for Netflix first Christmas Day NFL game make around $50m, plus $10m for Levi commercials, Forbes tok.

Bloomberg, wey get im own billionaire index, carry Selena Gomez join dia list of musicians - wit net worth of $1.3bn (£962m) in 2024.

But Forbes dey argue dis figure, dem estimate say Gomez worth $700m (£518m).

Di 44-year-old mother of three rise financially afta her big breakthrough in di entertainment industry.

Beyonce start her career in di late 1990s wen she dey part of di best-selling R&B girl group (Destiny's Child) but she later break from di group and start her solo debut for 2003 wit di album, "Dangerously in Love."

Afta Destiny's Child break up for 2005, Beyoncé release "B'Day" for 2006 and follow am wit "Dreamgirls" dat same year.

Beyoncé na one of di big fish for di industry wit 35 Grammy wins and 99 nominations, na she be di most awarded artiste in di history of di awards, including di ones wey she win wit di Destiny's Child, girl group wey help start her career in di music industry.

She marry rapper Jay-Z, and dem get three children togeda. Throughout di 2000s, Beyoncé get plenty Billboard placement wey help her rise as household name in di music industry.

She headline Coachella 2018 wit "Homecoming," wey Netflix produce as  documentary wia she earn around $600 million.

Apart from being a musician, Beyoncé na business mogul. She get cloth and hair care lines, and she don enta drink business wit whisky brand wey she name afta her great-grandpapa, SirDavis.

Beyoncé also get her own company, Parkwood Entertainment wey she start for 2010. she dey manage and produce her own music, documentaries, and concerts.
title: Beyoncé join Jay-Z, Rihanna and odas for di billionaire club as fifth musician to do so

raw_text:
US President Donald Trump don warn say im fit order more airstrikes on Nigeria if dem continue to kill Christians for di West African nation.

For inside one wide-ranging interview wit di New York Times, dem ask Trump weda di Christmas Day strikes for Nigeria northern Sokoto state, wey target Islamist militants, be part of a broader military campaign.

"I for like make am a one-time strike. But if dem continue to kill Christians, e go be a many-time strike," e tok.

Nigeria govment don reject Trump earlier accusations, wey claim say dem fail to protect Christians from jihadist attacks. Di govment say "Muslims, Christians and dos wey no identify wit any faith" dey targeted.

Claims of genocide against Nigerian Christians begin spread last year for some right-wing US circles - but organisations wey dey monitor political violence for Nigeria say most victims of di jihadist groups na Muslims.

Wen dem question am on top dis for diinterview published on Thursday, Trump reply say: "I think say dem dey kill Muslims too for Nigeria. But na Christians dey affected most."

Nigeria population of more dan 230 million pipo dey roughly evenly divided among Christians, wey most of dem dey di south, and Muslims, wey mostly dey for di north.

For di past 15 years, di north-east of di kontri don suffer from one devastating Islamist insurgency for di hands of jihadist groups like Boko Haram and dos wey get connection wit di Islamic State (IS) group, wey base for Borno state.

Di kontri also dey face oda serious security issues for different regions, wey include criminal kidnapping gangs, clashes ova land and separatist unrest.

DiUS Christmas Day strikeshit two camps wey one jihadist group wey di name na Lakurawa dey operate for di largely Muslim state of Sokoto, north-western Nigeria near di border wit Niger.

E still neva dey clear if any casualties dey as neither di US nor Nigerian govment din provide figures - and no update de on di outcome of di attack.

Lakurawa bin establish dia foothold for di border region a few years ago. Dem come from di areas north of Nigeria for di Sahel.

Di US and Nigerian govment bin tok afta last month airstrikes, say di militants dey linked to IS groups for di Sahel - although IS no link diasef to any of di group activities or announce relationship to Lakurawa as dem don do wit oda groups for di region wey dem dey support.

For di wake of di strikes, Nigeria Foreign Minister Yusuf Maitama Tuggar bin tell BBC say na "joint operation" and e get "nothing to do wit a particular religion".

Referring to di timing of di strikes, e say e no get "anytin to do wit Christmas" -though Trumpbin say im order dem as"Christmas present".

Di foreign minister bin add say di strikes get di full approval of Nigeria President Bola Tinubu plus di involvement of di kontri armed forces.
title: Trump warn of more airstrikes for Nigeria if 'killing of Christians continue'

raw_text:
British heavyweight Anthony Joshua need only six rounds to knockout boxing novice Jake Paul, wey bin spend much of di contest for survival mode for one of di biggest mismatch for boxing history.

Joshua almost dey frustrated as Paul bin just dey dance around di ring, but e later put body for di match and knock down di YouTuber-boxer two times for di fifth round.

AJ knock Paul down again for di sixth and den land am powerful right hand to bring di match to conclusion for di Miami Kaseya Center.

Di American no fit beat di count and evribody bin happy as e manage to get up for im feet afta di match and comot for di ring without assistance.

"E no be di best performance," AJ tok afta di fight.

"Di end goal na to pin Jake Paul down and wunjure am. E bin take longer dan expected, but di right hand finally find im destination."

Di result na wetin evribodi for di boxing world bin don predict, and di controversial fight don raise questions about di safety risks wey dey very clear by di big difference between di two fighters in experience, size and power.

Joshua claim di 29th victory of im professional career for 33 outings and e go now turn im attention to more legitimate challenges - may di showdown wit Tyson Fury next year wey many pipo don dey anticipate.

"Come and fight one of di 'realest' fighters out dia, step in dia wit me next if you be really bad boy," Joshua tok as e call out Fury.

Paul, meanwhile, no fit to deliver on im promise to pull off di greatest upset for sports history.

Di 28-year-old spend much of di fight dey tumbling on top di canvas and hugging Joshua legs, a reflection of di big weight gap betwin dem and how badly e bin struggle to cope.

Di social media sensation sha manage to land a few shots, and di fact say di fight even enta six rounds no flatter Joshua at all.

Joshua bin first receive mix reception as e bin walk into di 20,000-seat arena, but e just bone face to show wetin im bin don dey tok say e go take di fight very seriously.

Paul also walk to di ring with di controversial rapper 6ix9ine wey get history of criminal convictions and prison time.

As di opening bell ring, Paul just deyaround as pipo start to dey boo am.

Joshua watch am small bifor swinging heavy lefts and rights wey just dey catch air, and di crowds dey respond wit evri punch wey e miss. Paul respond by bringing out im tongue, playing to di theatre.

Every passing minute feel like small victory for Paul, who bin fight and win 58-year-old Mike Tyson only 13 months ago.

Di event bin dey broadcast live to more dan 300 million Netflix subscribers.

Golf superstar Rory McIlroy, who just win di UK Sports Personality of di Year, also sit  for di ringside alongside rappers Rick Ross and Timbaland.

Di fifth round delivere wetin many pipo bin don dey expect since. A right hook brush Paul shoulder and sent am to di canvas.

Moments later, anoda combination drop am for ground again. E rise heavily and dey breath hard as e attempt to do macho man and hide di damage.

Anoda heavy right for di sixth once again trowey Paul for ground and many pipo for di crowd start to dey ask di referee to step in and stop di fight.

Dose wey remember Joshua brutal one-punch knockout of former UFC heavyweight champion Francis Ngannou last year, bin feel say something like dat fit happun again.

Dis time, e no too dey savage like dat, but di straight right - di punch Joshua bin don dey wait for all night - finally landed, and dat na di end.

Dis no be contest wey suppose test Joshua boxing ability. Na just entertainment wey dem create to generate attention and revenue.

"I no care about di legacy. All di legacy dey dia to just last for 50 years and e go finish. Dis na wetin I dey do, I go dey do am until I no fit any more," Joshua tok.

Joshua go leave Miami wit im share of a reported purse of £210m and im focus go now shift to anoda warm-up opponent for February bifor a potential showdown wit Fury later for 2026.

Paul imsef later admit say AJ really beat am up, but e insist say e go come bak and target a cruiserweight world title.

"I tink my jaw dey broken. But e dey good, I go come bak and get world championship belt at some point," e tok.

Tori later come out say Jake Paul don check imsef into hospital sake of im jaw wey AJ break.

Weda you like am or hate am, Paul dey always draw di audience, headline and debate in a way few boxers can.

Di fact say e convinced some sections of di public say dis fight fit dey competitive show say e be beta show promoter - even if as a boxer, e don cast.
title: Anthony Joshua knack stars comot for Jake Paul eyes

raw_text:
Di United Nations World Food Programme don warn say thousands of pipo for northeast Nigeria dey face di risk of massive food shortages for di first time in almost a decade.

Dem tok dis one on Friday and add say na aid cuts dey worsen malnutrition across di region.

Di WFP tok say for Borno state alone na about 15,000 pipo dey at risk wit ova 13 million for di Northeast region wey go suffer malnutrition dis year.

Di statement add saykasala, displacement and economic palaca don increase food insecurity ova di years but according  to di WFP deputy regional director for West and Central Africa, Serah Longford  "di reduced funding wey we see for 2025 don deepen hunger and malnutrition for di area."

Di financial mata from 2025, for Nigeria make WFP to reduce hand for dia nutritional programmes and dis come affect ova 300,000 pikin dem.

E also make di malnutrition levels for many northern states to go down from "serious" to "critical".

Di latest analysis na from di Cadre Harmonisé wey be like di Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) for West and Central Africa.

Dem dey also estimate say ova three million pipo go face emergency levels of food insecurity for 2026. Dis na double di number from 2020.

Nigeria dey part of di four kontris wey go join to make up 77 percent of di food insecurity numbers. Di oda kontris include Chad Cameroon and Niger.

Di statement tok say, "for Nigeria, WFP go only fit reach 72,000 pipo for February, dis na drop from di 1.3 million pipo wey bin dey assisted for di 2025 lean season".

Meanwhile insecurity for Mali don scata food supply routes for Mali wey make 1.5 million pipo dey face crisis levels of hunger. For Cameroon, ova half a million fit dey removed from aid for coming weeks, according to di statement.

Di WFP tok sat dem need ova $453 million in di next six months so dem go fit to continue dey provide humanitarian assistance across di region.

Madam Longford add say, "to comot di cycle of hunger for future generations, we go need ogbonge shift for 2026. Natoional govments dem and dia partners need to increase investments for preparedness and anticpation and accion and resilience building so dem go fit empower communities".

One of di ways wey di WFP dey work on na land restoration for di Sahel.

Dem reason say sice 2018, WFP and communities don help rehabilitate 300,000 hectares of farmland in five kontris wey go suppoer ova four million pipo in ova 3,400 villages.

WFP programmes for di region, according to di statment dey help to build infrastructiore develoopment, school feeding, nutrition, capacity building and seasonal aid so dependecy on aid go redice.
title: Nigeria go face worst hunger in 10 years sake of aid cut - Report warn

raw_text:
Magistrate court for Sagamu Ogun state don adjourn di trial of di driver wey drive boxer Anthony Joshua SUV wey get accident wit di boxer inside.

Mr Adeniyi Mobolaji Abiodun appear for court Tuesday morning to start him trial.

E dey face charges wey include causing death by dangerous driving, negligent driving, driving without duty of care and driving without valid driver's license.

Dis na after di driver get accident wen e carry international boxer for Sagamu road for December. Two of Joshua personnel die instantly for di location of di accident.

Di prosecutor Richard Ningiwe tell court say him need more to seek legal advice from di officer of di attorney general of di state before e go proceed wit di case.

E say "i don study di case and I go need legal advice to how to proceed wit di case, dis na to make sure justice reach all di parties involved.

E tell court say wen di case start im plan to call 4 witnesses, say three of dose witnesses dey court dat morning.

Counsel to di driver Otumba Abiodun object di request say di prosecutor bin get enough time to prepare for di case, but e wan use dis request to drag di case.

Di magistrate adjourn di case to February 25 2026. She say dis na for best interest of justice.

Kayode bin comot from police custody afta court grant am bail in di sum of five million naira ($3,800) wit two sureties.

Mr Kayode wey dey 46 years bin dey drive wen difatal accidentkill Anthony Joshuapersonal trainer  Latif Ayodele and im strength and conditioningcoach, Sina Ghami

Tori be say di driver dey face four count charges wey include dangerous driving wey cause death, reckless and negligent driving, driving without due care and attention, driving without valid national driver's license.

Na December 29, 2025, di accident bin happun along di Lagos-Ibadan Expressway wen e go jam truck wey park for corner of di road wen e bin dey try to overtaking according to police.

Meanwhile, British heavyweight boxer Anthony Joshua don return since to di UK afta dem discharge am from hospital for Nigeria days afta di fatal car accident happun.

Di former world champion dey deemed fit to recover for house, di Ogun and Lagos states govment tok for inside one joint statement.

Di statement say e dey "heavy hearted and full of emotions" ova di loss of im friends.

Di 36-year-old na passenger for inside one Lexus SUV wey jam one truck wey dem park for one major expressway for Ogun State, near Lagos, on Monday.
title: Anthony Joshua driver appear in court afta accident wey kill two pipo

raw_text:
Di pipo wey dey live for Kurmin Wali, for Kajuru Local Govment Area of Kaduna State, for di northwest region of Nigeria, dey accuse govment authorities say dem dey try to suppress information afta Jaguda pipo attack di area and kidnap177 pip[o from three churches on Sunday.

Some of di pipo tell BBC on Wednesday say govmnt officials no dey allow dem to tok to tori pipo and dem also dey block journalists from entering dia community.

One resident, wey beg make we no mention im name sake of security reasons, tok say di officials bin warned pipo to remain silent about di attack.

BBC tori pipo also find am difficult reaching Kurmin Wali as security pipo and govment officials bin order our team to turn back. Dem later grant dem access afta dem insist say dem must tok to di pipo.

Relatives of di pipo wey dem kidnap tok say di community still dey traumatised and neva still get adequate security days afta di attack.

Di Guvnor of Kaduna State, Uba Sani, also visit Kurmin Wali village on Wednesday and e promise to set up military base for di area.

E also announce say e go provide relief measures for affected residents, including medical support.

Di Kaduna State Police Command and local government officials bin first deny di tori as dem issue statement say di church attacks and abductions no hapun, but dem later do u-turn and confam say e hapun true-true.

Governor Sani explain say di initial denial na misrepresentation of di police position and e say na di public dey politicise di matter.

E say efforts don start to work wit security agencies to rescue di pipo wey dey for captivity.

Also, the tok-tok pesin for di Nigeria Police, Benjamin Hundeyin, also explain why e be like say dem no dey consistent wit dia statements about di attack.

For one television interview on Wednesday, Hundeyin tok say di Kaduna State Commissioner of Police bin explain say wen dem receive di information, dem immediately mobilise dia but dem no get any evidence say di attack hapun true-true.

"Di moment we get evidence, we also come out to say we don get evidence. So dia is no inconsistency," Hundeyin tok.

Meanwhile, di Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) don criticise di police for how dem bin manage di information surrounding di abductions.

Joseph Hayab wey be di CAN Chairman for Northern Nigeria tok for one TV interview say dis no be di first time wey attacks go hapun and police gho wan deny am.

"Di manner di police commissioner and oda security agencies come out to outrightly say dat dis tin bin no happen, to me na total disappointment, total failure, and e just increase di lack of trust wey exists betwin di pipo and dose wey suppose to dey secure dem," Hayab tok.

"Look at di time dem bin use to deny am. Dat time na wetin dem suppose use to dey pursue di bandits, but dem chose to allow di bandits to have gone far bifor dem now come out to acknowledge say di information we bin give dem na true and e remain true."

Di Kaduna State authorities neva release official figures for di numba of pipo wey di bandits dem kidnap, but CAN don release di names of di 177 pipo wey di bandits kidnap for dis attack across three churches.

No group don claim responsibility for di attack so far, but armed gangs, wey many pipo dey call bandits, don dey carry out abductions for many parts of Kaduna state in di past.

Dis incident dey come less dan two months aftabandits bin kidnap more dan one hundred school childrenplus dia teachers for one Catholic boarding school for Papiri, Niger State.

Few days bifor dat, anoda mass kidnapping bin hapun for Kebbi State wia25 students of Govment Girls Secondary School, Maga, bin dey abductedfrom dia hostel afta jaguda pipo attack di school and kill dia security man.

Earlier for di same November of 2025,e get anoda attack for one Christ Apostolic Church for Kwara State, for di north-central region of Nigeria, wia gunmen bin also kill three pipo and pack about 30 worshippers enta bush.

All di pipo wey dem kidnap for dis three incidents don regain dia freedom, butgovment say dem no pay ransomto di kidnappers. Rememba say di Kwara church attackers bin ask for ransom of 100 million naira for eac of di pipo wey dem kidnap.

Dis latest incident go also add fuel to di accuse wey Preident Donald Trump of di US dey make against Nigeria say di kontri govment no dey do enuf to stop di genocide of Christians wey dey hapun for di kontri.

Di Nigeria govment reject dis allegation and dem maintain say di insecurity for di kontri dey affect both di christian and muslim population.
title: Kurmin Wali residents accuse authorities of cover-up afta jaguda pipo kidnap more dan 150 pipo from three Churches

raw_text:
Authorities for Ghana dey pursue suspected cybercriminals (aka Yahoo-Yahoo pipo) wey dey operate for different parts of di kontri.

Dis pipo dey scam many pipo wey dem dey use different strategy to collect money from pipo wey odas dey promise pipo jobs wey no dey even exist.

For di latest crackdown, officers from di Cyber Security Authority (CSA) wit collaboration from di police and odas, gbab 53 suspects from East Legon hills, Afienya, Kwabenya, Weija and Tuba - wey dem rescue 44 pipo wey di kontri communication minister describe as "victims wey dem lure to di kontri to do Yahoo-Yahoo business".

"Di operation wey last for two days, find 62 laptops, 52 mobile phones wit two pump-action guns," Samuel Nartey George, di minister write for im social media pages.

E add say "di cyber security authority pick up nine pipo wey dem suspect to be ringleaders wey all di 53 suspects be Nigerians".

E dey common now to find foreigners for Ghana wey oda foreigners bin deceive dem to enta di kontri for beta jobs.
