Wen dis pipo finally enta di kontri, dem go put dem inside one house, seize dia travel document and force dem to do Yahoo-Yahoo.

Di cyber security authority say from dia operation, most of dis foreigners dey engage for mobile money fraud, romance scam, business email compromise, wire fraud among odas – tins wey Interpol describe as worrying for Africa.

Di sector minister add say "dem profile all di pipo wey dem arrest, wey dem hand dem ova to di immigration service as investigation dey continue".

27 December 2025– Di immigration, police and cyber security authority arrest a total of 141 suspects for Tabora and Lashibi.

Dem collect 38 laptops, 150 mobile phones wey authorities believe say dem use to commit financial crimes.

Di authorities also arrest di landlord of di house wia di 100 pipo dey stay. Di suspects dey accused of mobile money fraud, romance scam, sextortion and wire fraud. Di suspects dey for police custody wey dem dey assist for investigation.

24 December 2025- Dem arrest 48 suspects for Dawhenya for di Greater Accra region – 46 males and two females wey be Nigerians linked to cybercrimes like online investment fraud, impersonation and illegal gold trading among odas. During dat operation, dem say dem seize 54 laptops, 39 mobile phones, star link internet device and oda routers.

13 December 2025– Di cyber security authority arrest 32 suspects for one operation for Kasoa – Tuba. All di suspects be Nigerian nationals, wia dem seize 31 laptops, 15 mobile phones among odas.

11 December 2025– Authorities combine toarrest Frederick Kumi aka Abu Tricaand two odas for dia role in romance scams wey allegedly defraud US pipo up to $8m.

Dis arrest follow indictment by grand jury for di US wey tok say Abu Trica and di oda suspects use AI to fake identity of oda pipo wey dem scam Americans.

Dem charge Abu Trica wit conspiracy to commit wire fraud, money laundering among odas, wey Ghana authorities dey work to extradite am to di US to face trial. Dat process still dey underway.

On 30 April, 2025, di circuit court for Achimota sentence two pipo for trafficking two ladies from Nigeria to Ghana to engage for prostitution. Jessica Daniel aka Blessing and Kelvin Johnson aka Alaska lure di victims to enta Ghana say dem go give dem job as domestic servants but las las dem end up for prostitution.

On 29 May 2025, di court jail Nigerian Promise Ebuorbo and four accomplices say dem keep illegal migrants for dia house wey dem involve for cybercrime wey dem dey scam real estate pipo. Promise Ebuorbo chop 12-month prison sentence wit fine.

For 30 July 2025, di district court for Ashaiman jail two Nigerians for 18 months wit hard labour sake of cyber fraud and illegal entry into di kontri. John Moore and Charles Bruce plead guilty to di charge of engaging for Yahoo-Yahoo and entering Ghana by unapproved border.

Communications minister Samuel Nartey George say dem hand over some of di suspects to di Nigerian law enforcement agencies while odas dey face prosecution for Ghana.

Di kontri Cyber Security Authority and oda agencies dey continue to conduct dis operations to remove cybercriminals, wey dem dey work wit US authorities to arrest high-profile suspects wey dey linked to crimes for America.

"We go continue to protect Ghana cyber security image internationally. Di law enforcement agencies go still pursue dis suspects to find dem wherever dem dey," di minister tok.
title: How Ghana authorities dey gbab syndicates wey dey lure Nigerians to di kontri for scamming jobs

raw_text:
More dan £2m na im dem spend for Harrods on behalf of one former Nigerian oil minister wey dem accuse say e accept bribes from industry figures wey bin dey interested in govment contracts, one court for London don hear.

Diezani Alison-Madueke, 65, allegedly dey "live life of luxury for United Kingdom", including multimillion-pound house, chauffeur dey drive am, private jet travel, and £100,000 cash. Oda benefits wey she allegedly don enjoy na £4.6m wey she spend to refurbishing one properties for London and Buckinghamshire, na wetin dem tell di trial for Southwark Crown Court.

She deny five counts of accepting bribes and one charge of conspiracy to commit bribery.

Alison-Madueke na minister of Petroleum Resources from 2010 to 2015 under President Goodluck Jonathan administration.

Dem tell jurors say ova £2m na im dem spend on behalf of Alison-Madueke for Harrods using di payment card of Kolawole Aluko and di debit card of im company Tenka Limited.

Di defendant get her own personal shopper for di store, wey dey only available to Harrods Rewards Black Tier members wey fit spend ova £10,000 a year, di court hear.

Jurors also hear say she dey live for UK sometimes, wia dem provide her wit housekeeper, nanny, gardener, and window cleaner.

Di owners of energy companies wey get lucrative contracts wit di state-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation na im dey pay di salaries and oda running costs, di court hear.

"Dis case na about bribery in relation to oil and gas industry for Nigeria between 2011 and 2015," prosecutor Alexandra Healy KC tok.

"During dat time dose wey bin dey interested in di award and retention of lucrative oil and gas contracts wit di state-owned Nigerian National Petroleum Corporation or im subsidiaries di Nigerian Petroleum Development Company and di Pipelines Product Marketing Company, bin provide ogbonge financial or oda advantages to Alison-Madueke."

Healy add: "E fit look strange say we dey handle case for UK wey concern bribery in relation to Nigerian oil and gas industry.

We dey live for global society. Bribery and corruption dey undermine how di global market suppose dey function.

Important public interest dey to make sure say wetin dey happun for our kontri no dey promote corruption for anoda kontri."

Dem show jurors photographs inside property wey dem dey call The Falls for Gerrard's Cross, Buckinghamshire. Na Nigerian businessman Olajide Omokore buy am for 2010 - e get company wey dem dey call Atlantic Energy.

From late 2011, dem tok say Alison-Madueke dey use di house wey get cinema room. Court hear say she bin stay dia three or four times in two years, plus six weeks wey she dey dia dey write book about president of Nigeria.

She bin dey assisted by a chef and di driver of car wey im role include dropping off shopping for Alison-Madueke, wey e know as "HM" - short for honourable minister.

Dem tok say dis, along wit £300,000 worth of refurbishment, na im Tenka Limited pay for. Dem tell di court say Aluko also get contracts wit state-owned entities wey bin dey in di process of securing new oil contracts.

Di court hear say between May 2011 and January 2014, dem also pay £500,000 for rent for two flats for central London wey Alison-Madueke and her mama dey live.

Record wey dem take from Tenka offices for Nigeria show say di company settle di bill, dem claim.

Alison-Madueke bin sit for dock beside oil executive Olatimbo Ayinde, 54, wey dey face one charge of bribery relating to Alison-Madueke and one separate count of bribing foreign public official.

Alison-Madueke brother, former archbishop Doye Agama, 69, dey face charge of conspiracy to bribe and e join di trial via video link becos of health issue.

Ayinde and Agama also deny di charges against dem.

Di trial wey dey expected to last about 12 weeks dey continue.

Oil dey play big role for Nigeria economy, but di population no dey feel di benefits.

Nigeria na one of di 13 members of Organisation of Petroleum Exporting Countries (Opec), wey dem set up to manage global oil supply and price.

Diezani Alison-Madueke wey dem born on 6 December 1960 for Port Harcourt, Rivers State, na Nigerian politician and she be di first woman wey ever bicom president of di Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (Opec)

She bicom Nigeria Minister of Transportation on 26 July 2007.

For 2008, dem move am go Ministry of Mines and Steel Development, and for April 2010, dem appoint am as di first female Minister of Petroleum Resources for Nigeria.

She later bicom di first female president of Opec for di 166th Opec Ordinary Meeting wey happun for Vienna on 27 November 2014.
title: Ex-Nigeria oil minister for bribery trial spend £2m for Harrods, court hear

raw_text:
Na August last year, Ugandan lawyer and activist Yvonne Mpambara,34, carry nomination forms fill am so she go fit to run for her kontri presidential election.

Her campaign bin focus around inclusive govment, improved delivery of service and legal reform.

But for September 24, 2025 she find out say dme no clear am to contest. Na so Mpambara para accuse di Uganda Electoral Commission say dem dey comot female candidates from di ballot.

She tok say, "na di system gan-gan I direct blame give".

Adding say, "we bin get three capable women wey suppose enta ballot but we feel say di systemn do frustrate di three of us Win bin no fit make am and I also believe say di vetting process of di Electoral Commission no dey pure".

Wen Uganda go vote on Thursday na only men go dey di list of candidates.

Dem include current President Yoweri Museveni, 81, wey dey run for im seventh term in office afta 40 years for power.

Im main opponent na di musiciam wey turn politician 43 year old Robert Kyagulanyi Ssentamu wey dey popularly known as Bobi Wine.

Di oda six presidential candidates na  Frank Bulira, Robert Kasibante, Joseph Mabirizi, Nandala Mafabi, Mugisha Muntu, and Mubarak Munyagwa. All of dme na man dem be.

Di Elecotral Commission ansa Mpambara accuse for dem through dia tok-tok pesin Julius Mucunguzi wey say di joinbodi bin follow clear guidelines for id nomination and vetting process.

E tok say, "if no female candidate carry herself come and meet all di requirements successfully, di commission no go bend dia riles. E dey possible to get all female race, all male race or mixed one".

According to di Electoral Commission, anyone wey wan run for president must be Ugandan by birth, at least 18 years old, and must be registered voter.

Presidential aspirants also need to pay nomination fee wey cost 20 million Uganda shillings (about £4,200).

For dem to clear pesin to run, di candidate for don present at least 100 signatures from at least two-thirds of di kontri 146 districts.

Yvonne say di electoral commision no comot clear to tell her why dem reject her forms.

She tok say, "when I bin try to submit my papers, dem say na fake and forgery without say dem tok wetin dia criteria be as to how dem reason say na fake".

Uganda bin start ot dey run multi-party politics for 2005 afta oen referendum wia ova 90 percent of voters say na so dme want make e run.

Di last four elections wey dem don hold since dat time don get at least one female presidential candidate.

Former First Lady Miria Kalule Obote bin contest for 2006; Beti Kamya bin run for 2011; Maureen Kyalya run for 2016 and for 2021 na Nancy Kalembe Linda be di only female candidate.

Analysts tok say dis one wey woman no dey un for dis current election, e don reduce moral of di efforts to increase women participation for politics and democratic governance.

But even wit all dis ones, Uganda still be one of di African kontris wey get beta number of women for leaderhip positions. Di kontri present Speaker for Parliament, Vice Presidnet and Prime Minister, all fo dem na women and 45% of di cabinet na women. Plus, dem reserve 146 parliamentary seats for district women representatives.

No be only women don chop ela from dis presidential race.

Dis election dey as di kontri dey fce economic strain and redice in institutional trusts. Many young Ugandans no dey look di election as just political event but to test weda di system fit deliver inclusion and opportunity.

Ova 75% of Uganda pipo dey under 30 years and many young pipo don dey hala for economic empowerment and inclusivity.

Twenty-eight-year-old Gloria Nawanyanga wan rep di youth for legislator for di Central Uganda region.

She say, "if young pipo dey economically empowered, Uganda fit enta middle income status or even turn one of di most developed kontris for world for short time bicos we be majority".

Political financing don cause plenti pipo to chook eye as critics call out wetin dem call di commercialization of politics. Yvonne Mpambara dey warn say di way wey election dey cost mean say young pipo and oda groups fit no participate.

She tok say, "I no think say any of us go fit sustain elections for future. Politics don cost like mad, and na discrimination from start. How pesin go fit afford three billion Uganda shillings to contest for Member of Parliament?"

Political financing has also come under scrutiny, with critics condemning the commercialization of politics. Yvonne Mpambara warns that the high cost of elections risks locking out young people and other marginalized groups.

"I don't think any of us will be able to sustain elections in the future. Politics has become extremely expensive, and that's discrimination from the start. How can one afford three billion Uganda shillings to run for Member of Parliament?" she asks.

Worldwide, youth participation for politics don shift wella. New wave of Gen Z activism don see young pipo dey do protest to ask for beta governance, accountabiltiy and job creations for kontris like Kenya, Bangladesh, Madagascar, Nepal and Morocco.

According to di Uganda 2024 censis, youth unemployment for di kontri still dey high as na only 9.5 million pipo dey employed out of di working age population of 25.1 million.

President Museveni for im campaign ask young pipo to use di kontri peace and stability and use goment youth lifelihood programs wey dey ground. E also say make dem shift from waiting for goment work to start to dey engage for work creation.

But for di opposition National Unity Platform, led by Bobi Wine promise say dem go create ten million million jobs by 2032 for dia  manifesto, A New Uganda Now. Dem also promise to tackle corruption and transform Uganda to tech driven economy.

For young leaders like  Gloria Nawanyanga, di moment for change dey ripe.

She tok say, "na di right time for young pipo to take oca di stewardship of is kontri cos na us be majority."

As Uganda dey go vote, di youth vote dey expected to play beta role to shape di kontri leadership.

Atuhire Vandah, wey be 24 year old fish seller for Luzira for outside Kampala say she go like di leadership of di kontri to address corruption.

She say, "I want di elected to make sure say youth livelihood finds ereach us. We hear say dem release di omey but many of us neva get am bicos of fraud."

Halimah Mutesi wey be 38 year old market seller want leaders to put women empowerment for front.

She say, "I want di electoral bodi to continue dey empower women to di highest bicos we be di mama of di nation and most times, na we be di most disadvantaged"
title: Why no woman qualify to run for President for Uganda?

raw_text:
2026 don land and wit am some events wey world pipo fit look forward to.

From sporting events to world politics even down to di entertainment industry, events yapa for dis year.

Dis na some of di events wey dey happun.

Di 2026 Men's World Cup go be di biggest one in history as e go get 48 kontris wey go compete against demselves. Dis na as e get 16 more teams dan for di 2022 Qatar World Cup.

Di World Cup dey co-hosted by three different kontris wey include di United States, Canada and Mexico.

Di event go last from June 11 to July 19 as di US go get 11 of di 16 venues.

Dem go get 104 matches wey go hold for 16 host cities wey include Toronto and Vancouver for Canada; Guadalajara, Mexico City and Monterrey for Mexico;  and Atlanta, Boston, Dallas, Houston, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Miami, New York-New Jersey, Philadelphia, the San Francisco Bay Area and Seattle for di U.S.

Cristiano Ronaldo wey go be 41 wen di competition start don alreadi tok say dis go be im sixth and last World Cup and e go like end am wit winning di Cup for di first time for Portugal.

Nigeria go miss out on dia second back-to back world cup but kontris wey dey participate include defending champions Argentina (three-time World Cup winners), Brazil (record five-time winners), Germany (a four-time winner), France (two-time winners) and Uruguay (two-time winners) .

Di first total solar eclipse for Europe in ova 20 years go happun for 12 August.

Di last time total eclipse bin happun for Europe na for March 2006. At dat time, parts of Russia and Turkey just go dark just like dat.

Di last time wey dat kain tin happun for di United Kingdom na back for 1999.

NASA dey prep for dia crewed mission to fly around di Earth satelight and di long tme delayed Artemis II wey go dey scheduled to lift-off by April, bad as e bad.

Dis go be in line for America to get boots for di moon again.

Dis na sometim wey Trump don announce say na im goal since im first term in office.

Di United States of America go celebrate dia 250th birthday from di day wen di kontri adopt Declaration of Independence for July 4, 1776.

Dem don alreadi start events ontop dis anniversary.

For New Year Day, America250, di team wey Congress arrange for 2016 to plan for dis anniversary go run float for di Rose Parade for Pasedena for California.

Di theme na "Soaring Onward Together for 250 Years."

Last year, Trump launch di executive order to plan events to mark di anniversary. Di events start from New Year Eve wit di Washington Monument go tun do "world biggest birthday candle" wit projections every night till January 5.

From 25 June to 10 July, Freedom 250 say a "Great American State Fair" go hold for di National Mall and go get pavillions from all 50 states.

Di group don also announce di first "Patriot Games" wey be four days athletic competition wey go take di top high school athletes, one boy and one girl from evri state and teritory.

Just bifor di kontri do dia national election for 2027, Nigerian political parties go run dia primaries to decided which candidates go run under dia party names.

For di ruling All Progressives Congress, fit be President Tinubu wey go run for second term in office. Dis na as campaign posters of im second term run don also start to dey run.

As per presidential cadidates wey run for 2023, Peter Obi don port from di Labour Party wey im use contest for  di last election enta di new join-bodi opposition party wey be African Democratic Congress (ADC) for 31 December, 2025.

In all, Nigerians go sabi all di presidential candidates dis year 2026.

From di foreign side, pipo like  Bruno Mars don anounce say im album dey ready.

Di "Die With A Smile" artist bin reveal say "My album is done" for 5 January.

Di last time wey di artist bin drop new music na for 2024 wen e release collabo wit Lad Gaga, Rose and Sexxy Redd.

Apart from am, di biggest K-pop group for world, BTS dey come back togeda wit new album dis year afta dem split up for 2022 to fit go do dia military service.

Di seven member band announce say dia new album togeda go comot on 20th of March.

For Nigeira, Davido announce say e dey prepare to drop anoda album afta e end im tour for im 2025 album 5ive.
title: Some key events wey go happun for 2026

raw_text:
Foday Musa dey calm as e dey listen to di last voice note e receive from im son.

Di voice note na 76 seconds and di young man wey dey inside dey sound desperate. E dey cry dey beg for im papa help.

"E dey hard to hear, to hear im voice dey hurt me," na so Musa tell BBC Africa Eye, wey get exclusive access to police unit wey dey help am search for two of im children wey fall victim to scammers.

Na for February 2024 dem recruit Musa 24 years old son and di 18 years old daughter with five odas from dia remote village for Faranah region of Central Guinea. Di agent promise dem work abroad.

Di jobs no work out and di recruiters turn out to be human traffickers. Dem take di group across di border into Sierra Leone and hold dem captive.

"My heart dey broken, I no fit stop to dey cry. If you look inside my eyes, you go see di pains," na so Musa tok.

Global policing agency Interpol pick up im case for Guinea and ask dia unit for Sierra Leone to help. So last August, Musa travel go Makeni for central Sierra Leone to go find dem.

Human trafficking scam wey dem dey call QNET dey lure thousands of pipo across West Africa.

Na for Hong Kong dem establish di scam, QNET na legitimate wellness and lifestyle company wey dey allow pipo to sign up and buy dia products and sell dem online.

Di business don face some criticism - however for West Africa, criminal gangs dey use di name as front for dia illegal activities.

Traffickers dey target pipo wit promise of work opportunities for places like US, Canada, Dubai and Europe, dey ask dem to pay large amount of money for administrative cost bifor dem go start di jobs.

Once dem pay, dem go traffic dem to anoda kontri and tell dem say dem go travel abroad only if dem recruit more pipo into di scheme.

Yet even wen dem bring in family and friends di jobs no go still show.

QNET get plenti campaign billboards across di region wit big adverts dey condemn scam like "QNET against Scams" and di company don reject di allegations say dem dey linked to human trafficking.

Musa and im extended family don pay di traffickers $25,000 (£19,000). Dis include di joining fees and extra money to use bring im children home. To travel to Sierra Leone na im last hope.

Mahmoud Conteh, wey be head of di investigation for anti-kidnapping unit of Interpol for Sierra Leone police say di case na top priority for im unit dat time.

"E dey veri easy for di traffickers to manoeuvre across our borders for di illegal crossing points," na so im tell BBC.

Wen Conteh get tip-off say dem dey hold large number of young pipo for one location for Makeni, Musa join di police to raid di place wit hope say e go find im children.

Dem keep clothes and bags for floor, na ontop dia dem dey sleep. Like 10 to 15 pipo dey sleep for one room dia.

Interpol carry evribodi inside di property and even find some wey dey as young as 14 years wey dey live dia.

"Plenti of dem from Guinea, na only one from Sierra Leone. Odas from Guinea," na so Conteh tok.

Dem no see Musa children dia, though one young man tok say di children bin dey dia last week - dis na first time dem dey sight di children for one year.

Dem bin carry all of dem go police station for screening bifor dem return 19 of dem back home to Guinea.

Police say dem don conduct more dan 20 raids like dis over di past one year, say dem rescue hundreds of victims of human trafficking.

Di traffickers don move some of di victims across di border but for 23 years old Aminata wey from Sierra Leone (we change her name to hide her real identity) dem traffic her inside her own kontri.

Aminata tell BBC say na her friend introduce am to di pipo wey dey claim to be representative of QNET for middle of 2024.

She pass her interview and dem tell am say she go do one course bifor she go fly to US for further study and work. But she gatz pay $1000 to join di scheme.

Onto say dem believe say e dey legit, her family give her di money dem bin plan to use send her go college.

"Wen dem first recruit you, dem go feed you, take care of you, but as time dey go, dem go stop," na so she tell BBC. She add say na dis time she go extra mile to survive.

"You go sell your body and sleep wit men to get money - so you go fit take care of your body,"

Aminata say dem tell am say if she want travel say she gatz recruit oda pipo into di scheme.

To make dis happun, di traffickers give her international phone number so dat wen she call pipo e go look like she don already travel abroad.

"Dem go carry you go airport, and you go dress well like you want travel, Dem go give you passport give you fake travel papers" na so she explain.

"Dem go take your fotos so you fit send am to your family and friends."

Aminata manage to recruit six friends and relatives to join di scheme, and still dey hope say di job for US go work out, but e no work.

"E pain me onto say dem waste dia money, and dem suffer sake of me."

Na for Freetown outskirts of Sierra Leone Capital dem hold am for about one year bifor e clear for her eyes say di job no go ever show.

Wen Aminata fail to recruit more pesins, e come be like she no dey of any use to di traffickers, so wen she try to escape dem no stop am.

To return home afta evritin wey don happun kon dey hard her, especially as evribodi feel say she don dey leave abroad.

"I bin dey fear to go home" na so she tok.

"I bin tell my friends say I dey go abroad, I tell my family too di same tin. I dey tink of all di money dem bin give me to go dia."

Statistics of di number of victims of di dis kain labour scams no dey but constant reports for media for West Africa dey show gangs wey dey scam pipo wey believe say foreign jobs schemes dey real.

BBC join police for three days to do raid for Makeni and meet hundreds of young pipo wey dem traffic across di region from kontris like Burkina Faso, Guinea, Ivory Coast and Mali.

Police say dem don arrest total of 12 suspected traffickers.

But di reality be say dem don only succeed to prosecute only few of such cases successfully. Di authorities dey under-resourced for di region and dem dey often face serious battle to tackle such scams.

US State Department statistics show say since 2022 wey Sierra Leone enact anti-trafficking act for April 2025, dem don only get four trafficking convictions.

Musa neva still find im children and no get choice dan to return to Guinea witout dem for end of September.

Conteh from Interpol later tell BBC say di traffickers later release im children.

BBC find out say Musa daughter don return to Guinea but no gree return to di village and no want make dem interview her.

She neva contact her papa sake of di kain shame such victims dey face wen dis kain scam catch dem.

Nobodi know wia Musa son dey now.

Dia papa still dey desperate till now.

"Afta evritin wey don happun, I just want make dis tin dey ova, make I fit see my children again," na so Musa tok.

"We want make dem come back village now, I want make dem dey here wit me."

Additional reporting by Paul Myles, Chris Walter, Olivia Acland and Tamasin Ford
title: 'Dem recruit my children into trafficking scam - I join police hunt to find dem'

raw_text:
Traders for Onitsha main market for Anambra State, Southeast Nigeria dey protest  sake of how govment lock dia shops.

Onitsha, wey be di commercial capital of Anambra State for southeast Nigeria, trend for social media on Tuesday, as traders for di popular Onitsha Main Market para well-well for di state govment sake of di closure of di market for one week.

Govnor Chukwuma Soludo bin give order for di market shutdown for one week, sake of say di traders no gree to open dia shops on Monday.

According to am dem disobey di order wey Soludo bin give say di usual Monday sit-at-home situation for di state don end.

Di traders full for street dey chant songs wey dey support Nnamdi Kanu, leader of di Indigenous People of Biafra, wey Nigeria court  sama life imprisonment.

Dem carry 'we no go gree' waka enta di Onitsha main market wit placards wey dem write different tins.

For one video wey don go viral, di protesters di songs wey dey hail dia alleged leader, Nnamdi Kanu.

On Monday 26 January, 2026 Anambra State govnor, Charles Chukwuma Soludo bin branch di Onitsha main market to check if treaders come market.

Oga Soludo bin dey monitor di Monday sit-at-home exercise wey govnors for di south-east dey try to end since but e neva really work.

For inside anoda video wey bin go viral on Monday, Govnor Charles Soludo bin dey para for traders wey still dey do sit-at-home as dem no open shop on Monday.

Im note say di popular Onitsha main market na di hub of business and trading for di east but now on notin dey happun for di market on Mondays.

Soludo say im bin dey do inspection and evriwia for Awka di state capital dey open, govment offices dey open, markets dey open, pipo dey go about dia business, but wen im reach Onitsha, come down to main market, di market wey bin be di largest and wey carry respect for West Africa no dey fully open.

Oga Soludo say im don waka for some places for di Onitsha main market and im see how some shops dey lock.

'I peep inside na few pipo I see here and there, okay, anybody for main market of markets wey neva open shop. I mean, for main market to dey shut down, I know say pipo bin don do dis sit-at home on Mondays for quite sometime now and as dem tok any abomination wey don last for one year don becom culture, no! Dis no go kontinu to happun for Anambra, and I go tell una say, you beta decide if you want to trade for hia or yiou fit go anoda place."

"For dis main market , if you no want make e open I go bring bulldozer come level am, and I dey serious anout am, i no dey joke."

"Going forward, any Monday wey any shop no open go dey locked for one week, all dis shops wey no open and dis market go dey locked up for di whole of dis week, market no go dey anywia for hia."

Di former CBN govnor say dem go di inspect di market evri week.

Justice James Omotosho of di Federal High Court, Abuja, struck out ex-parte motion wey di convicted leader of di Indigenous People of Biafra (Ipob), Nnamdi Kanu file.

Di ex-parte motion na to transfer am from Sokoto prison.

For court on Tuesday, Kanu legal representative, Demdoo Asan tell court say dem wish to withdraw from di mata as dem cite irreconcilable issues.

Im explain say since di last adjourned date, im dey get constant phone communication wit di relatives of di applicant.

Di relatives no showface for di Legal Aid office to depose to di application, despite phone calls and promises wey dem bin make to appear.

Demdoo add say Kanu bin want to dictate di proceedings and control wetin counsel go tok for court.

"Im bin wan write down wetin I go tok for court. But, as officer of di court, I no go fit accept am in good faith," im tok.

Im tok say afta e do tok-tok wit im superiors, dem tok di same tin.

"As officers of di court, wen any mata come to us, we dey handle am as we fit; otherwise, di applicant fit find legal help elsewhere," Demdoo tok.

Im con invoke Order 50, Rule 1 of di Federal High Court Rules, wey im seek to formally withdraw from di matter.

For di ruling Justice Omotosho commend di counsel as im uphold im dignity and di court dignity too.

Im grant leave for Demdoo and di Legal Aid Council to withdraw from representing di defendant.

Di judge add say di motion dey incompetent. However, for di interest of justice and fairness, im direct di oda parties wey dey involved to dey served with notice.

Im say since di last court sitting on December 8, 2025, no proof of service dey before di court.

Justice Omotosho thereafter order make dem strike out di ex-parte motion for lack of competence.

Di sit at-home bin start for 2021 for di south-east region sake of di arrest of Nnamdi Kanu.

Since August 2021, dis protest dey go on evri Monday to tell govment to release di Ipob leader Nnamdi Kanu wey tok say e dey fight for di independence of Biafra.

Some pipo for eastern Nigeriabin don tire for di weekly sit-at- home.

Many oda cities for di region don resume normal activities on Mondays except Onitsha, wey dey host di ogbonge Main Market wey bin dey described as one of di biggest markets for West Africa.

Currently, Nnamdi kanu get for prison for Sokoto afta court for Nigeria find am guilty andSentence Nnamdi Kanu to life imprisonmentafta years of trial and long stay for Department of State custody.

On Tuesday court still troway Nnamdi Kanu request to transfer am comot from di Sokoto prison.

Why Nnamdi Kanu bin want  court to transfer am from Sokoto prison to any oda prison wey dey near wia e file im appeal
title: Call for Nnamdi Kanu release spark fresh protest between Anambra traders and govnor Soludo

raw_text:
US intensive care nurse Alex Pretti na di second US citizen wey go die during raids carried out by officers wey dey work for di Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) agency dis month.

On 7 January, one US immigration officer bin fatally shoot 37-year-old Renee Good, also for Minneapolis, Minnesota.

Di killing of dis two US citizens don turn di focus on Border Patrol Commander Greg Bovino.

E don bicom di public face of Donald Trump mass deportation policy, wey be central promise for di president election campaign.

Bovino active presence on social media plus on di ground against protesters don also help push am bifor public eye.

Many pipo see di border control commander, wey claim say Pretti bin dey try "massacre" federal agents, as say e dey try pour petrol for di mata wey dey ground for di aftermath of di shooting.

Now, Bovino dey expected to leave Minnesota, wey fit signal a shift for di administration tone towards dia immigration crackdown.

In recent days, Bovino don defend immigration raids for Minneapolis, one predominantly Democratic city for di northern part of di United States.

"Di victims na Border Patrol agents," e tell CNN State of di Union programme, Reuters news agency report.

Dem launch Trump crackdown for Minneapolis for December afta dem convict some Somali immigrants for one case say dem defraud di state welfare programmes.

Di state na home to di largest community of Somali immigrants for di kontri, di majority of dem na US citizens.

Ova di past year, Bovino, wey dey im mid-50s, don oversee several high-profile immigration raids, including for Los Angeles and Chicago.

E dey known for using wetin e call di "turn and burn" tactic of moving in to make quick arrests and leav quick-quick bifor protesters land.

E bin describe di tactic as: "We go turn and burn to dat next target and di next and di next and di next, and no go stop," e tell di Associated Press news agency last year.

Bovino don provoke criticism from former govment prosecutors. Irv Miller, wey be former assistant state attorney of Cook County for Illinois, tell BBC say e believe say di border patrol chief don "violate internal policies of im agency" and di administration suppose investigate am.

Miller, wey be di legal analyst for CBS-TV for Chicago now, tok say dem suppose sack Bovino if "e turn out say e violate rules and regulations or laws for im capacity" afta dem do di investigation.

Former US Attorney for Minnesota Rachel Paulose tell BBC News say, she dey concerned say di operation dey fail to meet di purpose.

"Di focus of dis operation na rapists, murderers, child molesters, human traffickers. And so, if dose kain violent criminals continue to be di focus, make we get di word out...

"If no be wetin dey happun be dat, den we don dey lose focus."

Initially, di Trump administration continue to voice support for di immigration raids.

Trump bin tell The Wall Street Journal on 25 January: "I no like any shooting. I no like am."

E add: "But I no like am wen pipo begin protest and e get veri powerful, fully loaded gun wit two magazines loaded up wit bullets also. Dat one too no good."

Eyewitnesses, local officials and Pretti family don challenge dat account.

Video footage show as Pretti dey feem ICE agents wit im mobile phone and dey help one woman wey di officers push, bifor dem spray two of dem wit pepper spray.

E be like say di administration dey change tactics to de-escalate di situation.

Trump dey send im "border tsar" Tom Homan to oversee di Minnesota operation.

Pipo consider Homan as "a more measured, politically attuned operator", North American Correspondent Anthony Zurcher write.

On Monday, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt also say dem go carry out full investigation.

Unlike most of di federal officers dem deploy for di raids, Bovino often no dey wear mask.

Di long, olive green coat e frequently dey wear don also make am stand out and spark discussions.

Originally from North Carolina, Bovino join di Border Patrol for 1996.

Im 30-year career carry am from Washington DC go New Orleans as well as foreign postings for Honduras and Africa, according to CNN.

For 2020, dem name am Chief Patrol Agent of di El Centro Sector for southern California, CNN tok, but for 2023, dem sack am from di command of di Border Patrol sector and e dey encouraged to retire sake of one controversial social media posts, AP report.

But e return to lead immigration enforcement for Los Angeles under di Trump administration for di summer of 2025, and e don oversee raids for oda US cities.

According to one interview wit di New York Times, e consider bear hunting one of life pleasures, and e start im law enforcement working as a reserve police officer for di Blue Ridge Mountains for North Carolina.

"Pipo dey underestimate im intelligence sake of im demeanour sometimes, but e dey veri smart," Jason Owens, one former Border Patrol chief and friend of Bovino, dey quoted for di same article.

"E just get di kontri-boy demeanour, wia e dey tok about Ma and Pa America, plus im accent, and so a lot of pipo fit dismiss am. Dem dey do am at dia own peril."

Ice na one federal agency wey dey enforce immigration laws and conduct investigations into undocumented immigration. Dem also dey remove undocumented immigrants from di US.

Ice dey operate inside America, wit some staffing abroad. Na sister agency to US Customs and Border Protection, technically dem dey patrol di US borders, rather dan inside di kontri.

But dose roles don bicom increasingly blurred as di Trump administration don pull agents from a range of federal law enforcement agencies to participate for immigration enforcement.

Border Patrol officers increasingly dey operate within di US, dem dey part of raids wit Ice.

On 23 January - a day bifor Pretti fatal shooting - di UN Human Rights Office tok say at least 30 deaths in Ice custody dey reported last year, plus anoda six dis year.
title: Who be Greg Bovino, US Border Patrol commander and chief enforcer of Trump deportation campaign?

raw_text:
Nigeria Super Eagles beat Algeria 2-0 to qualify for di semi-finals of di ongoing Africa Cup of Nations.

Nigeria dominate di match from start to finish, but Algeria no still make di game easy for di Super Eagles.

First half end for goalless draw afta Nigeria and Algeria try dia luck but goal no come.

Victor Osimhen score Nigeria first goal immediately second half start for di 47th minute.

Adams Akor score ten minutes later wit Victor Osimhen assist for di 57th minute.

Nigeria get beta chances to strike but dem dey play di ball ova di bar.

Di match hot sotey Algeria collect five yellow cards while Nigeria collect three yellow cards.

Nigeria go jam host kontri Morocco for di semi-finals.

Di deadly combo of Ademola Lookman and Victor Osimhen versus reliable goalkeeper Luca Zidane go surely sweet to watch.

For di Desert Warriors, dis na chance to complete redemption afta two shameful group-stage exits bifor now. For di Super Eagles, na test of maturity, control and focus, especially afta tournament wey don loud both on and off di pitch.

Nigeria don win Afcon three times – 1980, 1994 and 2013. Algeria don win am two times – 1990 and 2019.

Nigeria enta knockout stage with 100% record too, afta dem beat Tanzania, Tunisia and Uganda for Group C.

For knockout, dem start wit heavy 4-0 beating of Mozambique.

Algeria qualify wit three wins from three matches – against Sudan, Burkina Faso and Equatorial Guinea.

For round of 16, dem beat DR Congo 1-0 for extra time, thanks to fine goal from substitute Adil Boulbina.

Algeria dey calm and organised under coach Vladimir Petkovic. Dem win all group matches, allow only one goal, and survive strong pressure from DR Congo for last 16 bifor Adil Boulbina beautiful 119th-minute goal carry dem go next round.

For four matches, dem don concede just one goal – thanks to good organisation, patience and outstanding keeper Luca Zidane.

Tactically, dis na classic style clash: Algeria compact 4-3-3 versus Nigeria aggressive 4-4-2 diamond. Algeria go want control, tempo and discipline. Nigeria go dey look for space, counter-attack and confusion.

Algeria and Nigeria don meet 22 times bifor, both competitive and friendly matches.

Algeria get small advantage – 10 wins, Nigeria get nine wins, while three matches end for draw.

Algeria don be Afcon bad luck team for Nigeria, as dem don win four and draw two of nine Afcon meetings, including di painful 5-1 beating for 1990 tournament wey Algeria host.

Also, di Fennec Foxes don win di last three meetings, including di memorable 2–1 win for 2019 Afcon semi-final, wey Riyad Mahrez score late free-kick bifor dem win di title.

Nigeria never beat Algeria for competitive match since 2004 and dem neva win any of di last four meetings.

Nigeria:Starting 11: Nwabali , Osayi, Ndidi, Ajayi, Lookman, Osimhen, Bruno, Iwobi, Calvin, Akor, Osimhen

Algeria:Starting 11: Zidane, Belghali, Mandi, Bensebaini, Nouri, Mahrez, Zerrouki, Boudaoui, Chaibi, Maza, Amoura
title: Nigeria sama Algeria 2-0 to set up semi-final clash wit Morocco

raw_text:
Di Canadian snowboarder and alleged drug smuggler Ryan Wedding don chop arrest and dey for custody.

FBI Director Kash Patel confam di news inside one post for X.

E write: "Tanks to President Trump leadership and commitment to global law enforcement - as of dis morning, di DOJ/FBI officially gbab our SIXTH Top Ten Most Wanted Fugitive within di last year.

"Tank you to @AGPamBondi for her relentless pursuit of justice, di US Attorney Office for L.A., and FBI Los Angeles. Ryan James Wedding bin enta custody for Mexico last night. E dey transported from Mexico to di U.S. via FBI FTOC to face justice.

"Wedding dey believed to dey hide for Mexico for ova ten years - and don dey wanted on charges of cocaine trafficking and murder since 2024."

Meanwhile, Attorney General Pam Bondi confam say dem don fly Wedding into di United States from Mexico.

Inside post on X, she write say at her direction, FBI agents gbab Wedding, "di onetime Olympian snowboarder-turned alleged violent cocaine kingpin".

"Wedding bin dey flown to di United States wia e go face justice. Dis na direct result of President Trump law-and-order leadership," she continue.

Bondi further credit FBI Director Kash Patel, Ambassador Ron Johnson, and di Mexican authorities for assisting in di case.

FBI Director Kash Patel say Mexico co-operation for di operation dey important.

"Dis operation na di result of tremendous cooperation and team work wit di Govment of Mexico. Special tanks to our amazing partners for Mexico wey bin facilitate dis - President Sheinbaum, Secretary Harfuch, Ambassador Ron Johnson, Legat Mexico, and more," e write for social media.

E confam say dem gbab Wedding for Mexico City on Thursday night.

Patel say di FBI also gbab anoda high profile suspect for Mexico wey e only identify as Castillo.

E say dem don bring am to di US along wit Wedding.

Ryan Wedding chop accuse say e dey run vast drug trafficking operation wey dey responsible for importing some 60 metric tons of cocaine a year into Los Angeles, Attorney General Pam Bondi previously tok.

Di organisation bin operate across North America and oda kontris and also be di largest supplier of cocaine to Canada - and e dey bring in estimated $1bn a year.

Bifor dem gbab am, Wedding bin dey accused of killing one federal witness inside one case against am.

Dem charge Wedding wit witness tampering and intimidation, murder, money laundering and drug trafficking.

Ryan Wedding na former snowboarder wey bin represent Canada for di 2002 Winter Olympics, and compete for di Parallel Giant Slalom.

Dem born am for September 1981 for Thunder Bay, Ontario, to one family wey bin dey involved in snow sports. Afta di Olympics, e bin study briefly for Simon Fraser University for British Columbia.

For 2009, Wedding chop conviction for federal court for California afta dem charge am wit conspiracy to distribute cocaine. E bin serve time for prison and dem release am for December 2011.

Canadian and US officials don accuse Wedding say e still dey involve in drug trafficking and say e don dodge arrest arrest for many years.

Di FBI allege say e don order dozens of murders across di world, including for US, Canada and Latin America.
title: Who be alleged drug kingpin Ryan Wedding compared to Pablo Escobar wey FBI gbab

raw_text:
British boxer Anthony Joshua don share how e dey cope afta e get injury for one car crash for Nigeria wey kill two of im close friends.

For one Instagram post wey show pictures of di two men, Joshua write say:

"100% e hard for me, but I know say e hard pass for dia parents."

Dis na di first time wey e dey tok directly about how e dey feel since di crash happun.

Joshua im close friends and team members, Sina Ghami and Latif 'Latz' Ayodele, die for di accident. Dem bury dem last week.

Di former two-time world heavyweight champion dem carry go hospital for Nigeria and e return go UK some days later, as e reach back dis weekend.

Bifor now, Joshua share two pictures for Instagram. One show am dey siddon wit im mama and members of di victims families, including di mothers of Ghami and Ayodele. One of dem dey hold picture of Ghami.

Di caption for di post be "My Brother's Keeper."

Di driver, Adeniyi Mobolaji Kayode, 46 years old, don face charge for magistrate court for Sagamu, Ogun State.

Police sources tell BBC say e dey face charges including causing death by dangerous driving.

Dis article contain content wey Instagram provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di Instagramcookie policyandprivacy policybefore accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'.

Sina Ghami na Joshua strength and conditioning coach of more dan 10 years, e help am prepare for major clashes for im career including dis month victory, wey e beat Jake Paul.

E also co-found Evolve Gym for London. Di gym website say Ghami na qualified sports and exercise rehabilitator wey specialise in musculoskeletal injuries and corrective exercise.

Di gym say dem go close on 30 December "as we mourn di loss of our beloved owner".

E don work wit athletes for di National Football League (NFL), National Basketball Association (NBA) and Michigan State University football team.

Sina bin don also work with many big name athletes like Le'Veon Bell from di Pittsburgh Steelers (NFL) and Draymond Green from di Golden State Warriors (NBA).

Latif "Latz" Ayodele na Joshua personal trainer.

Im passion for di gym dey clear on im social media pages, as im dedication to Islam.

"Finding Islam for 2012 has been my biggest blessing," e write for one pinned post from 2020.
title: 'God keep me for dia presence but I no know' – Anthony Joshua dey struggle wit coping afta crash

raw_text:
Defence Headquarters for Nigeria finally agree say some military officers plan coup to overthrow di govment of President Bola Tinubu.

Plenty Nigerians go dey watch well how govment go punish di soldiers wey dem arrest for attempted coup last year.

Dis mata include how court martial dey work, especially as Nigeria no dey under military rule again.

For di time of military govment, soldiers wey try coup and fail, if dem catch dem, military govment fit sentence dem to death.

But wetin plenty Nigerians dey ask now be say: wetin be court martial, how e dey work, and wetin be di fate of dose wey dem arrest for alleged coup attempt for Nigeria last year?

BBC News Pidgin follow one former Nigerian military pesin, Sani Kukasheka, wey explain how court martial dey work under civilian govment.

"A court martial na like State High Court. If you no satisfied wit di judgement, you fit go Appeal Court, even though di judgement still need confirmation from di Army Council," Kukasheka tok.

Kukasheka add say court martial dey mainly for trial of military personnel wey dey under both military law and civil law, as citizens of di kontri.

"Di court martial dey constitutional and e get power to try offences and give punishment, from reduction of rank, dismissal, jail sentence, and even death sentence," Kukasheka tok.

E also add say anybodi wey dem accuse and dey face trial must get defence lawyer for court martial, depending on di case.

As for di fate of di coup plotters, Kukasheka tok say na only di court get power to decide if dem find dem guilty or not.

"Na only issue of confirmation remain, wey legal experts go determine. Na di facts on ground go decide if dis pipo wey dey stand trial guilty or not."

Anoda civilian legal expert, Barrister Umar Bala, also tok about di mata to BBC News Pidgin. E say court martial dey legal and e get power to try any military psin wey commit offence.

"A court martial na military court wey law allow, and e dey try armed forces personnel for breach of military discipline, serious offences, or violation of military law," e tok.

E add say dose wey dem arrest for alleged coup attempt, if court confam say dem guilty, court fit sentence dem.

"Dose pipo wey dem accuse of coup attempt for Nigeria, if court find dem guilty, di court fit sentence dem to death, bicos treason na one of di biggest offences," e tok.

Di Armed Forces of Nigeria (AFN) on Monday 26 January say dem don finish dia investigation on di 16 officers wey dem arrest for October, 2025 ova di plot to overthrown di govment.

Inside one statement on Monday, Director of defence information, Major General Samalia Uba tok say dem don carry out investigations and submit dia findings to "superior authority in line wit extant regulations."

Though e no mention dia names, di defence tok-tok pesin say dem don identify some of di officers wey get plans to overthrown di govment and dis kain actions no dey align with di ethics, values, and professional standards wey dey required from members of di Armed Forces of Nigeria.

"Di findings don identify some of di officers wey get allegations say dem dey plot to overthrow di govment, wey dey inconsistent wit di ethics, values and professional standards required of members of AFN," di statement tok.

E tok say dem go carry di mata go military judicial panel wia dem go make sure to discipline dem "in accordance wit di Armed Forces Act and oda applicable service regulations."

"Di AFN reiterate say measures wey dem take na purely disciplinary and part of ongoing institutional mechanisms to preserve order, discipline and operational effectiveness within di ranks. Di Armed Forces go continue to uphold di highest standards of professionalism, loyalty and respect for constitutional authority," di statement tok.

Di military on 4 October 2025, bin tok say dem arrest 16 officers for mata wey concern 'indiscipline and breach of service regulations' but deny any link to di attempted coup and dismissal of dis officers.

Di presidency also deny any coup attempt in di kontri even afta reports bin link di failed coup to di cancellation of October 1 Independence Day Parade by di president.

On 1 October, 2025, di annual national parade no happun but tori bin come out say di Nigeria military dismiss 16 military officers, ranging from di rank of Captain to Brigadier General.

Di tori tok say di dismissed officers dey plan coup against di govment but di military deny am.

Instead di military tok say dem arrest 16 officers becos of indiscipline and breach of service rules.

"Investigation don show say dia grievances dey mainly from career stagnation wey come from repeated failure for promotion examinations," di tok-tok pesin, Tukur Gusau tok.

"Some of di officers wey dem arrest don dey face different offences, some dey wait trial, some dey undergo trial. Dia conduct no dey compatible wit di standard of military service.

"Afta di investigation don finish, di officers wey dem find guilty go face di full military disciplinary process according to di established procedures to ensure accountability and preserve professionalism within di Armed Forces," e tok

Later for October, di military replace some top officials although President Bola Tinubu claim say im change di hierarchy to further strengthen di nation security but di govment still no link am to di attempted coup.

"I don approve changes in di hierarchy of our armed forces to further strengthen Nigeria national security architecture," President Bola Tinubu tok inside one statement for October 2025.
title: How court martial dey work for civilian govment and wetin go happun to Nigerian coup plotters

raw_text:
Polls don start for Uganda presidential and parliamentary election, though widespread logistical delays dey interrupt voting across di kontri plus di internet shutdown.

By 8am local time (05:00 GMT), BBC observe say tins neva begin waka for five polling stations for di capital Kampala, one hour after voting suppose don start.

Dem say na failure of di biometric identification kits dey cause am, some say na sake of di network outage.

For di presidential race Yoweri Museveni wey dey 81 years and don rule di kontri for four decades dey seek election for him seventh successive victory as e dey face charismatic pop star.

For places wia voting don start, reports dey comot say biometric machines wey dem dey use do voter identification still dey malfunction for some areas.

"Some biometric machines no dey work. I no know weda na di internet dey cause am" na wetin one ruling party agent tell AFP news Agency.

Anoda tin wey follow dey cause delay na say polling materials and equipments no arrive some stations on time.

"We arrive early for polling station, but bling equipments never arrive," no so one voter tell Kampala TV station UBC.

BBC reporter say di voters don dey gradually dey frustrated sake of prolonged delays for some polling stations and electoral officials neva tok anytin about am.

Di problem dey affect both pro-govment and pro-opposition areas.

Di race na between Museveni and singer turned politician Bobi Wine, but analysts say Di president fit extend him time for power as him bin don win six previous elections.

Wine dey 43 years, im don promise to tackle corruption and impose sweeping reforms while Museveni say him be di only pesin wey fit guarantee stability and progress for di kontri.

Di campaign season face plenti kasala as dem disrupt opposition activities. Dem accuse security forces say dem assault supporters of Bobi Wine.

Police tok tok pesin Kituuma Rusoke dismiss di complaints, say na opposition pipo especially pipo from Bobi Wine party National Unity Party (NUP) dey cause di disruption.

Dem bin suspend internet access ahead of voting day. Uganda Communications Commission say di blackout dey necessary to prevent misinformation, fraud and incitement of violence. UN human rights office don condemn am say "e dey deeply worrying".

NUP don reject di explanation and accuse di regulator say im dey try stop opposition make dem no mobilize and share evidence of election fraud.

Museveni wey be former guerrilla army leader don benefit from two constitutional amendments wey remove age limit, and allow him to continue dey run for office.

Wine wey him real name na Robert Kyagulanyi loose to di president for di 2021 election. Di election join bodi say im get 35% of di votes dem cast while Museveni get 59%, although Wine dismiss di result say fraud happun.

Museveni and Wine get six oda presidential candidates for dis year ballot papers. Voters go also choose new parliament wey get 353 seats.

For plenti pipo wey dey vote on Thursday, di economy na dia main issue.

Majority of di population dey under 30 and although di average income dey rise steadily, but enough jobs no dey for di young pipo wey dey look for work.

Concerns plenti about infrastructure and access to quality education and healthcare.

During campaign period, opposition supporters face escalating harassment including arrests on politically motivated charges according to di United Nations and Amnesty International.

Security forces disrupt Bobi Wine rallies unlike dat of Museveni.

Amnesty describe douse of tear gas, pepper spray, beatings and oda violent acts as "brutal campaign repression" ahead of di votes.

Head of Uganda electoral body tell BBC say him don receive threats wey warn am make e no  declare certain results.

"Some pipo say if you no declare so and so as president, you go see. I tell dem say I no dey for business of donating votes," na so Simon Byabakama tok. E vow say na only di voters go decide who win di election.

Di 2012 elections also get him own violence, dem kill dozens of pipo wey protest, and security forces dey responsible for some of di deaths, na wetin BBC investigation find.

Since Saturday security don dey high for Kampala wey be Uganda capital city.

Officers dey match in formation and dey do patrols while dem station amputee cars for various locations.

Some Kampala residents don travel to rural areas, say dem believe say e dey safer dia during election period.

"Na sake of say Uganda election dey usually dey violent, I decide to re-register my polling centre to my home village," na so ona man tell BBC. Im wish make we no mention him name.

"I dey glad say I make di decision, as you can see now, heavy and intimidating security presence dey for di city. So as I go vote for my village, I go also stay away from security scare".

Polls go close by 4pm local time. (13:00 GMT) on Thursday,  although any pesin wey don dey queue by dis time go dey allowed to vote.

Electoral Commission say dem go announce di result of di presidential election by di same time on Saturday.

Additional reporting by Wedaeli Chibelushi
title: Widespread delays hit Uganda election ontop internet shutdown

Di Round of 16 go conclude on Tuesday as Algeria go face DR Congo while defending champions Ivory Coast go jam Burkina Faso.

raw_text:
Dem bin attack Minnesota congresswoman Ilhan Omar wit unknown substance for one event wey she dey host on Tuesday, wen one audience member use syringe spray liquid for her, according to Minneapolis police.

Omar no get injury and she kontinu to dey tok. "I dey okay. I be survivor, so dis small agitator no go fit make me fear from doing my work. I no go let bullies win," she later write for X.

Authorities neva identify wetin di liquid be yet. According to BBC journalist wey dey inside di room, e get sour smell wey resemble chemical product.

Anthony James Kazmierczak, 55, don dey charged wit third-degree assault and e dey for custody, di local sheriff office tok.

Omar, one Democrat wey become di first Somali-American to serve in di US Congress for 2019, she be fierce critic of US President Donald Trump.

She don dey target di president immigration crackdown for Minnesota, wia dem shoot two US citizens die.

On Tuesday, responding to di second fatal shooting, Trump tok say im administration go "de-escalate a little bit".

During her speaking event, Omar call for di abolition of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), di main agency wey dey handle dis kind of operation and e don come under intense scrutiny for dia tactics.

Trump don dey fight wit Minnesota Democratic officials, and e don focus on Omar for personal attacks.

Before di Tuesday attack on di congresswoman, e tell im audience for Iowa say immigrants wey wan enter US "go need to show say dem fit love our kontri, be proud - no be like Ilhan Omar".

In di wake of di attack on Omar, wen ABC News ask di president weda e don see di foto of di incident, and e respond say e neva see am.

"I no dey tink about her. I tink she be fraud," Trump tell di outlet.

During di event wey happun for Tuesday, Omar tok say Trump ally Kristi Noem - wey be di Department of Homeland Security (DHS) overseer ICE - suppose "resign or face impeachment" ova recent events for her state.

For January, immigration officer fatally shoot US citizen Renee Good. And on Saturday, border agents fatally shoot US citizen Alex Pretti, afta dem stop am, wey cause locals make dem protest, and nationwide public outcry.

Na after Omar comment about Noem, dem launch attack on am.

As dem dey push am comot from di room afta im use syringe, di attacker tok say Omar dey "pit us against each oda". E no clear wetin e mean.

Dem arrest Kazmierczak immediately and forensic pipo quick check di scene, police tok.

Officials dey beg Omar make she end di event, but di congresswoman insist say she go continue, she tell di crowd: "We go continue... we dey Minnesota strong."

Wen she come back form di lectern, she add: "We go dey tok. Just give me 10 minutes. Abeg no let dem carry di show."

One attendee, Alfred Flowers Jr, tell BBC say e "respect her courage and strength to still stay and finish di town hall for di pipo."

For one post social media, Minneapolis Mayor Jacob Frey tok say: "Violence and intimidation no get place for Minneapolis. We fit disagree witout putting pipo for risk... Dis kind behaviour no go dey tolerated for our city."

Omar dey regularly hold such speaking events, wey dem dey call town halls for US.

On Tuesday, about 100 pipo gada attend di meeting for di north Minneapolis basement. Dem dey expect to hear about federal immigration officials wey dey for dia town and ask questions about di recent fatal shootings.

For 2019, Omar become di first Somali-American, di first African-born American, and one of di first two Muslim American women wey serve for US Congress.

Trump start im crackdown for Minneapolis in December afta some Somali immigrants dey convicted for massive fraud for state welfare programme.

Di state home na di biggest community of Somali immigrants for di US.

Di president don regularly criticised di state Democratic officials, especially Omar, wey im don call 'radical left lunatic' and 'disgusting'.

Earlier dis month, Trump write for Truth Social say Omar 'supposed dey for jail, or even worse punishment, make dem send am back to Somalia, wey dem dey consider one of di worst kontris in di world. She fit help to MAKE SOMALIA GREAT AGAIN!'

On di same day as di attack Omar, di US Capitol Police - wey dey check incidents like dis - report say dem don see 50% increase for threats to lawmakers from both political parties, dia families, aides and di Congress.

Di USCP tok say di number of threats wey dem investigate don rise for di third year in a row, to 14,938.

Additional report by Kristina Volk.
title: 'I no go allow bullies win' - US congresswoman Omar tok afta dem throw substance at her

raw_text:
Anoda Ghana politician get case for di US – di third pesin in di last two weeks.

Dis time e no be corruption mata, but domestic case wit im wife.

Valentino Nii Nortey wey contest di 2024 parliamentary elections for Ghana, dey di Dauphin County prison.

E dey face charges of attempted homicide, possession of instrument of crime and tampering wit evidence afta im allegedly stab his wife for Pennsylvania.

Lower Paxton policesay di victim dey stable condition afta she undergo surgery.

"We get report from Dauphin County about one stabbing incident – di victim arrive for di local hospital wey she undergo emergency surgery," di Lower Paxton Police Bureau tok.

Di statement add say "di victim currently dey stable wey she dey recover."

Lower Paxton police bureau identify di suspect as Valentino Nortey wey dem "pursue am without any drama wey we carry am go di Dauphin County booking centre."

"Afta arraignment by di magisterial district judge David Judy, dem deny Valentino Nortey bail – he currently dey di Dauphin County prison wey he dey wait for his preliminary hearing," di Lower Paxton police bureau tok for dia statement.

Family of di victim wey be di wife of di politician (Gilda Nortey) say dem want make di law deal wit dia in-law wey allegedly "attempt to kill dia daughter."

Her uncle oga David Gyapinin tok local radio station Citi FM say "dem get argument wey my niece say she go file for divorce if tins no change."

"My niece say Valentino threaten to either kill himself or kill her, wey he stab am three times."

David Gyapanin say "we believe di law go work for di US on dis mata; you no fit marry somebody's daughter wey you go try to kill her sake of she say she no go marry again. If dem no give her justice for di US when Valentino return to Ghana, we go seek justice."

As at 23 January 2026, di victim (wife of Valetino) still dey hospital.

Her uncle David Gyapanin tok BBC Pidgin say "she still dey respond to treatment for di Intensive care unit (ICU) di last time I check on her."

BBC pidgin dey try to reach di family or lawyers of di suspect Valentino Nii Nortey for reaction to all di tins wey happun, but so far e neva dey successful.

Di only message on top di social media page of di politician afta his arrest be "God dey in control."

Di politician get nickname – street boy wey e dey try to enta parliament since 2015.

He contest di Klottey Korle parliamentary seat as independent candidate when im lose di primaries of his party – di new patriotic party (NPP).

He later return to his party afta he lose di 2016 elections wey he apologize to di party and dia supporters.

For di 2020 elections, he support his party new candidate Prince Appiah – but he too lose dat election to di current member of parliament for di area Dr Zanetor Agyeman-Rawlings, di daughter of ex-president Flt. Lt. Jerry Rawlings.

For di 2024 elections, Valentino Nii Noi Nortey contest again on di ticket of di NPP for di same constituency (Klottey Korle), but he lose again.

He be businessman and entrepreneur – wey he also be farmer.

Valentino Nortey get Diploma in Business Administration wey he also get Postgraduate Diploma for Professional Marketing (Level 7) from di Chartered Institute of Marketing (CIM) for di UK.

Valentino Nortey also be security and intelligent expert.

For December 2025, he graduate wit master's degree in security and Intelligence from di University for professional studies, Accra (UPSA).
title: Ghana politician Valentino Nortey face attempted homicide charge for allegedly stabbing im wife for US

raw_text:
Di death of Kelvin Danlami, 300-level student of di Ibrahim Babangida University, don make pipo chook mouth on di danger of gambling and why some pipo dey addicted to am.

Tori be say di Computer Science student bin kpai imsef on Monday 19 January afta gambling chop di house rent moni dem keep for im hand.

Di tok-tok pesin of di Niger State Police Command, Wasiu Abiodun, say investigation dey go ontop di mata.

"One of di student neighbours wey discova di situation raise alarm, and di victim bin dey rushed to Gen Hospital Lapai, wia dem confam am dead.

"Di police operatives wey dey attached to Lapai Div bin visit di scene, conduct a preliminary investigation and di family of di deceased bin dey contacted. However, further investigation dey go on to ascertain di reason for such action", e tok.

To take risks na part of human nature. Weda na gambling or oda activities, evri day we dey engage in activities wey offer both potential risk and potential reward.

We dey motivated to take dis risks by di release of dopamine. Dis feel-good chemical dey activate di same pleasurable reward pathways for our brains as eating our favourite food, or to dey do kerewa.

Risk-taking fit help to advance di human race wen e lead to entrepreneurship, innovation and enhanced creativity. But problems fit start wen increased desire to take risks dey cause harm.

Gambling, alongside di use of substances like drugs and alcohol and even activities like shopping, fit become addiction wen pipo dey do am witout control.

Dis addictions come from two separate reward pathways inside di brain wey dey affect our behaviour - liking and wanting.

Liking describe di spontaneous delight of eating chocolate biscuit. Wanting na our desire to get one wen we see packet of chocolate biscuits for supermarket.

To want somtin dey motivate us - e dey makes us desire tins and do dem repeatedly.

In essence, addiction fit simply dey viewed as rewiring of dis reward systems.

Wen pipo become addicted to gambling, or to drugs, dis wanting and liking systems no longer dey linked togeda. Di wanting remain constant, but di feeling of liking wetin we get dey reduced.

Di addicted pesin go need stay for dat behaviour or drug,  to do am more and more so e go fit get di same pleasure.

Some factors dey wey dey make some pipo dey more at risk to becom addicts. Dem include if family members get addictions abi dem dey face stress or wahala wey relate to how dem train us.

Nature fit also be reason. One study wey dem do wit brain scans suggest say problem gamblers fit get lower impulse-control pass general population.

Di focus now don dey shift to online and mobile gambling, wey dey allow pipo to gamble for up to 24 hours a day. Dem even get possibilities to set up automatic bets.

E get plenti promotion of gambling for apps and betting websites wey include sponsorship deals wit popular sport players and teams wey dey supported by millions of pipo.

Mobile gambling mean say pipo fit lose plenti moni easily. Risk also dey say pikin fit carry stolen details to take gamble online. DIs na as one study suggest say two-fifths of 11-16 year fit don gamble in di past year.

Claims also dey of how gambling industry dey use online data profiling to target poorer pipo, wey fit spend a higher proportion of dia income on gambling.

Dis analysis tori bin dey commissioned by di BBC from sabi pipo wey dey work for outside organisation.

Dr Ricardo Twumasi na lecturer for Organisational Psychiatry & Psychology for King's College London.
title: Why some pipo dey addicted to gambling

American climber Alex Honnold don successfully climb up one Taiwan skyscraper without rope, harness or safety equipment.

Di building, named Taipei 101 sake of di number of im floors, tanda at 508m (1,667ft) of steel, glass and concrete and dem design am to resemble stick of bamboo.

Honnold dey popular as e be di first pesin to climb El Capitan, di vertical granite cliff for California Yosemite national park - also without ropes or safety gear.

Di climb originally suppose happun on Saturday but e dey delayed sake of di wet weather.

Im climb for Taiwan capital bin dey streamed live on Netflix, wey tok say delay go dey on di live feed should in case di worst happun.

Honnold bin complete di climb in one hour 31 minutes and e celebrate di achievement wit one word: "Sick."

Im time more dan halves di record of di only oda pesin to scale di tower.

Alain Robert, one Frenchman wey call imsef "Spiderman", bin make am to di top of Taipei 101 - at di time di world tallest building -in four hours. E do am wit ropes and a harness.

Taiwan Vice President Hsiao Bi-khim don congratulate Honnold on di ascent, e write on X: "I admit I go probably feel sick, too, barely able to watch."

Honnold wife hail am for di top of di building She bin express concern for di wind and heat as e dey climb.

But anoda distraction bin dey during im ascent.

As Honnold reach di 89th floor, fans begin hail am and dey wave to am, face to face but for di window as e hold on to di building.

Honnold and Netflix bin share video ofdimomenton Instagram, e show say di climber continue to dey clim wit no worry.

Honnold don make many extreme climbs during im career. One documentary about im ascent of di 3,000 foot (915m) El Capitan, titled Free Solo, bin win one Academy Award.

E dey very common pass a pipo think am but wen e appear e fit cause big alarm.

Many pipo dey fear wen dem see blood for dia poo-poo and think say dem don get some tin wey dey as serious as colon cancer.

However, e get more common causes behind dis symptom, some more serious dan odas.

Fermín Mearín, director of di digestive system department for Teknon Medical Centre in Spain, explain di most common cause to BBC Mundo:

1. Haemorrhoids or anal fissures:dis usually cause bright red blood to appear afta bowel movement.

"Dis one dey  usually show say di bleeding dey come from below, and di cause fit be di anus or rectum," Dr Mearín tok.

Hemorrhoids no dey easy to see wit naked eyes, but dem fit detect wetin dey happun for di anal area through rectal touch and rectoscopy.

Dem fit detect anal fissure through simple check. Na small cut for di anus wey pipo wey e fit affect dey suffer from constipation, and e fit dey painful.

2. Inflammatory bowel disease:di cause of inflammatory lesions in di intestine fit be colitis ulcerosa or Crohn's disease."

'In dis case, in addition to inflammation, diarrhoea and abdominal pain fit dey happun,' Mearín tok. E dey usually affect di colon, although Crohn disease sometimes dey affect di small intestine.

For dis case, di poo-poo go dey between red and dark in colour wit mixed color. "Di more red, di lower di inflammation dey close to di anus," Mearín tok.

3. On di oda side,if di poo-poo dey very black and sticky, e fit mean say di pesin get existence of high bleeding in di stomach.

In dat side, dem go need to go do gastroscopy, make dem check say e no be bleeding ulcer for di stomach area or duodenum.

Most times, blood dey show no mean say e dey serious.

But if di blood dey dark and e dey mixed wit di poo-poo, e fit come from di colon or some oda part of di body.

For dis matter, doctors dey recommend make dem do colonoscopy to check for colon polyps, colon cancer or vascular lesions.

Some kontris get colon cancer screening programmes wey pipo ova certain age dey use to examine.

Dis programs dey use faecal occult blood testing to show if sign of colon cancer dey.

If dem detect blood for patient poo-poo, dem go refer dem for futher testing, e dey make pipo dey worry.

But for many cases, dis distress no really get any reason base on di statistics.

"Pipo dey come to di clinic scared, but most times, dem get harmless conditions," Mearín tok.

Wen pesin wey don pass 50 years or get family history of colon cancer, doctors go choose to perform endoscopy to check di colon condition.

Even though di color of di pesin poo-poo fit help, no forget say wen you chop some certain food e fit affect am.

Black licorice, for example, fit make your poo-poo black. And beetroots or tomatoes fit sometimes make your poo-poo dey reddish.

In any case, anytime wey you see blood inside your poo-poo, e dey important make you rush go see docror to get accurate diagnosis.
title: Three reasons why blood dey your poo-poo wey no be colon cancer

Di Ghana embassy for di US confam say authorities arrest ex-Ghana govment official, wey dey run away from justice since 2019.

Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu wey be di CEO of di kontris microfinance and small loans centre (Masloc) between 2013 and 2016, comot Ghana afta she ask permission from di court for medical check-up abroad.

She neva return to face trail as di state charge her and one of her deputy CEO for causing financial loss to di kontri and embezzlement of public moni.

Inside one statement wey di Ghana ambassador Victor Smith sign for 15 January 2026, dem confam say she currently dey "detention."

"I fit confam say dem arrest Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu wey dem detain her for di Nevada Southern Detention Center."

Ambassador Smith add say "US Marshals detain am on 6 January 2026 as dem dey act on one extradition request wey Ghana send to US authorities for July 2024."

E tok for di statement say US authorities go soon put her bifor court.

Dis latest gist dey happun at a time US customs and immigration officers arrest and detain di ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta also for immigration irregularities.

Local media network TV3 quote ICE as dem tok say"Kenneth Ofori-Atta be illegal alien from Ghanawey dey face corruption charges for his home kontri."

"Di ex-finance minister enta di US for 28 May 2025 wit visitor's visa wey get expiry date of 27 November 2025. Ken Ofori-Atta overstay his permitted stay," di ICE tok-tok pesin clarify.

Di enforcement team detain di ex-minister on Tuesday 6 January 2026 for di Caroline Detention facility for Virginia.

Ken Ofori-Atta, di ex-ministerdey face 78 corruption and related charges for Ghana.

Lawyers for di ex-finance minister for Ghana inside dia statement say "his US legal team dey in contact wit ICE wey dem expect to address di mata quick quick."

"Oga Ofori-Atta get pending petition for adjustment of status wey go allow pesin to stay for di US legally past di period of validity of dia visa," di statement wey Justice Kusi-Minkah Premo don sign explain.

On 18 December, Ghana attorney general and minister for Justice, Dr Dominic Ayine confam say im office don formally send extradition request for di ex-finance minister and im alleged accomplice – one Ernest Akore (Ken chief of staff when im dey office as finance minister), to di US.

Im confam say dem begin di process on 19 November 2025 when dem submit di request for commencement of extradition proceedings against di two pipo.

Dr Ayine add during dat press conference say dem submit di request to di department of justice for America wey he add say di decision now dey for di hands of American authorities.

"At dis point, na di US authorities especially di judicial authorities wey go determine whether sufficient evidence dey wey go demand say make di two accused pipo – di ex-finance minister and im chief of staff, dey extradited to Ghana to stand trial."

His lawyers consistently tok say dia client (di ex-finance minister) dey innocent of all di corruption charges wey he neva dey run away from accountability.

For 16 April 2024,High court for Ghana sentence di ex-CEOfor di microfinance centre to 10 years in jail wit hard labour.

Di court also sentence her chief operating officer Daniel Axim to five years in prison wit hard labour.

Dem do di trial of Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu from 2019 to 2024 in absentia sake of she comot Ghana wey she neva return till now, even afta dem convict her.

Di court find di two pipo guilty on 78 counts of causing financial loss to d state, theft, conspiracy to steal, money laundering among odas.

Six witnesses testify for di state for dat case, her co-accused pesin di chief operating officer Daniel Axim testify for di court but he neva present any witness.

Prosecution allege say Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu and her co-accused embezzle GHC 3.19m ($295k) during her time as CEO wey dem cause financial loss of GHC 1.97m ($182K) to di state.

Dem also dey accused say dem make "unauthorized commitment wey result in financial obligation to di amount of GHC 61.4m ($6m) for di govment."

Di charges also include GHC 22.15m ($2.1m) in property loss, improper payment of GHC 274K ($26K) and laundering of GHC 3.7m ($342k).

Di high court find di two pipo guilty wey dem sentence dem to 10 years and five years respectively.

But Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu neva return to di kontri to serve her jail term

Ghana first present di extradition request for di ex-Masloc CEO under di previous govment in July 2024.

Di current attorney general Dr. Dominic Ayine confam say his office follow up for dis extradition request for September 2025 when dem come into govment.

Di attorney general tok say "di Americans make we understand say dem dey in di process to extradite her to Ghana, if she wan challenge her 10-year sentence, she fit handle am for Ghana."

"Dem say dem dey follow di extradition process to execute di request; dem confam to us say soon dem go extradite di fugitive afta dem satisfy all dia processes," Dr Dominic Ayine tok parliament on 18 November 2025.

E neva dey clear when dem go carry di ex-Masloc boss Sedina Tamakloe-Attionu come Ghana but di kontris ambassador Victor Smith say US authorities say "she dey await her day for court afta dem arrest and detain her on 6 January 2026."
title: US arrest, detain ex-Ghana govment official Sedina Tamakloe wey run from her 10-year jail term
