Evritin don set for di ogbonge fight betwin Nigerian-British former boxing heavyweight champion, Anthony Joshua and social media sensation-turned boxer Jake Paul.

Dis fight don cause plenty tok-tok since dem announce am in November, as some boxing sabi pipo say na one-sided match e go be sake of say Joshua don be world champion several times while Jake Paul since e start professional boxing neva even fight any serious contender.

Odas say Joshua agree to di fight just for di money wey go dey involved, but di two-time heavyweight champion say even though money folo for why e agree to di fight, e dey also do am for legacy sake.

Jake Paul bin don claim for social media say di money wey dey involved for di fight go reach about $267m.

Both men don dey blow hot about dis match, and Joshua bin tok say e no go mercy for Paul as e tell am for one pre-match event say "if I fit kill you (for inside di ring), I go kill you".

On Thursday, during dia weigh-in event, Joshua tok say: "I go just outclass dis kid. I be serious fighter. Dat na di difference. I be serious, serious fighter."

Paul for im side bin don tell tori pipo say: "I dey ready. I want im hardest punches. I no wan make any excuses dey afta evritin don pass. Make we kill each oda."

Also afta di weigh-in on Thursday, Paul say im bin see fear for Joshua eyes.

"Di pressure dey on am. I dey fight free. I don already win. Dis na lose-lose situation for am. I don get am right wia I want am."

Dis no be di first time Anthony Joshua go fight somebodi wey no too be im level for professional boxing.

For march 2024, Joshua bin face Francis Ngannou, who bin dey try im luck for pro-boxing afta e don dominate di world of heavyweight Mix-Martial Arts.

Di match end forsecond round knockout victory for Joshua.

Dis ogbonge fight go hold for di Kaseya Center for Miami, USA, wey im former name na di American Airlines Arena and also FTX Arena.

Di 19,500-capacity arena na di home of di ogbonge basketball team Miami Heats.

Even though di venue na majorly a basketball event centre, dem fit also reconfigure am for concerts, worship events, family events, musical shows and oda stage productions.

Dis venue don bring goodluck bifor for Nigerian mix-martial arts fighter Israel Adesanya in 2023.

Na for dia Adesanya bin win im ogbonge revenge match against Alex Pereira for di UFC Middleweight Championship, wiae knock am out for di second-round.

Major World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) fights don also happen for di Kaseya centre, but dis Anthony Joshua vs Jake Paul battle na di biggest event wey go happun dia so far.

Di fight go take place dis Friday, 19 December 2025, and e go be eight rounds of three minutes for each round.

E go dey streamed live on Netflix so anybodi wey get Netflix subscrition go fit watch am as e dey happun.

Jake Paul come for Cleveland, Ohio for USA and e be popular social media pesin wey bin gada billions of views for im videos wey e bin dey post on top 'Vine' betwin 2013 and 2017 bifor di platform close.

E come start to dey post videos on top YouTube for 2014, filming plenty prank and music videos wit im brother and fellow YouTuber, Logan.

In 2018, Paul come second for di Forbes list of YouTubers wey dey collect money pass, sake of combination of im streaming and video moni plus im oda business dem.

Na for day same 2018 e make im debut for boxing against anoda YouTuber Deji Olatunji. Paul win dat fight by technical knockout.

By 2020, Paul don go professional and im first fights as a pro na against YouTuber AnEsonGib and basketball player Nate Robinson, wit Paul winning di two fights.

From den, Paul bin don fight some professional Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighters and professional boxers - including di controversial match against 58-year-old Mike Tyson in 2024.

For June dis year, Forbes put Paul name as one of content creators wey dey collect di highest moni for di world as im money bin reach $50m for 2024.

Paul don get 12 wins for 13 matches; im only loss na against Tommy Fury.
title: Anthony Joshua vs Jake Paul: All you need to know about di fight

Registration for di 2026 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) for di 2026/2027 academic session into higher institutions for Nigeria go begin on Monday, 26 January.

Di Joint Admission Matriculation Board (Jamb) wey announce di informate assure prospective candidates say di registration exercise no go carry any wahala, as dem don put measures in place to ensure say candidates get ogbonge service.

For di Jamb bulletin wey di examination body issue on Monday, dem advise students to register for only Board-approved Computer Based Centres across di kontri.

Jamb registrar, Ishaq Oloyede also advise prospective candidates wey get biodata issues to correct am bifor dem go ahead wit di registration.

"Candidates wey get biodata issues, like dose wey relate to names, date of birth, or dose wey wish to correct dia data dey advised to do so wit di National Identity Management Commission (NIMC) bifor dem go ahead wit di registration," Oloyede tok.

Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di Xcookie policyandprivacy policybefore accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'.

Di registrar also warn say di board no go correct or use any data apart from di one wey NIMC generate.

Hia na wetin to know about di 2026 UTME and Direct Entry registration.

Di minimum age for admission into Tertiary Institutions dis year (2025/2026 session) na sixteen (16) years, Jamb tok.

Di exam body explain say candidates must don reach age 16 bifor 30 September 2026.

"Candidates wey dey less dan16 years old by 30th September 2026 go undergo one intensive evaluation to determine dia eligibility for a waiver. Dat kain candidate go don score not less dan 80% for each of UTME/ALEVEL, PUTME, SSCE and for di exceptional candidate assessment."

JAMB add say dem go release di UTME results of di underage candidates only afta dem conclude di complete evaluation process.

Also to register for dis year UTME, candidates must don meet di minimum tolerable admission score into any higher institution of learning for di country.

Di period of registration for UTME candidates including dose from foreign kontris go start from Monday, 26 January to Saturday, 28 February.

However, di sales of di UTME application document e-pin bin start on 19 January and go end on Thursday, 26 February.

Registration of di exercise go close on Saturday, 28 February.

For Direct Entry candidates, sales of di application documents and e-pin vending go start from Monday, 2 March and end on Saturday, 25 April.

Jamb add say di forms go only dey available for di board zonal and state offices.

For di 2026 UTME, na three categories of e-pins dey available according to Jamb.

Di categories carry different charges.

Di 2026 UTME examination go start on Thursday, 16 April and end on Saturday, 25 April.

Di Mock UTME wey dey optional go hold on Saturday, 28 March.

Professor Oloyede say for dis year exam, dem go deploy live camera to monitor live all di centres wey go participate for di 2026 UTME registration from Jamb Headquarters for Abuja.

"Any centre wey dia registration activities no fit dey viewed from di Jamb National Headquarters, Abuja, no go dey paid, and such registration fit dey invalidated," e tok.

Di registrar tok say di use of Microsoft or Digitech Live Cameras for UTME registration dey compulsory.

E stress say na only dis cameras dem go allow for capturing di second image during registration.

Oloyede say di measure na to minimise manipulation of fotos as dem detect during di 2025 registration exercise.
title: All you need sabi about di 2026 UTME registration

Senegal don reach di final of di 2025 Afcon afta dem defeat Egypt 1-0.

Sadio Mane score di only goal for di 78th minute afta he shoot from outside di box.

Egypt keeper El Shenaawy no see d ball bifor e crash into di net.

Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah bin complain say di ball don hit di hand of Mane bifor he shoot.

Bifor dat goal, Senegal don play four shots on target, Egypt neva get single shot until di final 10 minutes.

Dem sit back wey dem dey soak di pressure and waiting for counter attack wey no really help dem.

Even as dem push to get di equalizer, Senegal hold on to secure all three points and book dia place for di final.

Dis be di second time dem dey reach di final afta dem reach di 2021 final and win di tournament, dia first eva trophy.

Senegal bin don play all dia five games for Tangier – dem win four of dia five games to reach di semis.

Dem beat Botswana 3-0, wey dem draw 1-1 wit DR Congo bifor dem defeat Benin 3-0 and den anoda 3-1 against Sudan for di R16.

Di Teranga Lions also beat Mali 1-0 for di quarterfinal.

Dem score a total of 11 goals in di process when compared to di nine goals from Egypt.

Di Pharaohs first beat Zimbabwe 2-1, wey dem sama South Africa 1-0 and draw 0-0 wit Angola for di group stage.

Dem later beat Benin 3-1 wey dem also beat defending champions Cote D'ivoire 3-2 for di quarterfinal to reach di semis.

Both teams get good attacking power wey dem go jam to see who go come on top and reach di final.

Wit dis win now, Senegal now get six wins, three draws and seven defeats versus Egypt.

Egypt neva get dia revenge from dat 2021 final when dem lose to Senegal.

Wit dis Wednesday result, di Pharaohs now fail to win dia eighth title wey dem dey pursue since 2010.

Across 15 games bifor now, Egypt dey lead wit seven wins, Senegal get five wins wey di three oda games end for draw.

For di Afcon, dem meet each oda five times -  wey dem all win two games each and one draw.

Dis dey show say dis game na ogbonge football game.

Dia most recent meeting happun for di 2021 Afcon final for Yaoundé when Senegal beat dem for penalties to win dia first ever trophy.

Dat defeat pain di Pharaohs well well as dem fail yet again to win dia eighth title wey dem dey pursue since 2010 when dem win dia last Afcon.

Dem lose di final for 2017 also.

Many pipo tink say Egypt dey enta dis game wit revenge and unfinished business from 2021 – odas tink say Senegal wan show say dem too be big boys for Africa.

Liverpool star Mohammed Salah bin dey chase his first ever Afcon title – so far he bin don lead di Pharaohs well for dis competition wit four goals -  altogeda, di Egyptian captain get 11 Afcon goals.

But for di five times he don face di Teranga Lions, Salah neva score against dem; he bin hope say dis be di time to break dat bad luck.

His former Liverpool teammate Sadio Mane now don face Egypt six times – he score two goals wey he win four times, wit one defeat and one draw.
title: Mane goal book Afcon final spot for Senegal

Former United midfielder Fletcher wey be di under-18 head coach for di club and di former technical director during Ole Gunnar Solskjaer time go be United new manager now.

title: Ruben Amorim sacked as Manchester United manager
