Di Joint Admissions and Matriculation Board (Jamb) tok say undergraduates wey wan register for di 2026 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME) and Direct Entry, gatz first disclose dia matriculation status.

Tok-tok pesin for di examination body Fabian Benjamin for one statement e issue on Wednesday, 28 January, clear am say, di tori wey dey spread say undergraduates no fit write UTME no be true, but di koko na say di candidate gatz disclose im admission status.

Benjamin explain say no be offence for undergraduate to register for di UTME/DE while e still dey enrolled for one institution, but failure to disclose such status na offence.

"For di avoidance of doubt and for record purposes, plus in line wit dia statutory mandate to prevent multiple matriculations, di Board don direct all candidates wey dey register for di 2026 UTME/DE say dem gatz disclose dia matriculation status, wia applicable," Benjamin tok.

Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di Xcookie policyandprivacy policybefore accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'.

Some undergraduates wey wan register for di 2026 UTME raise alarm say one Jamb policy don bar undergraduates from registering for di exam, as one clause dey for di form wey tok say, bifor dem fit register to rewrite di exam, dem gatz forfeit dia previous admission.

In response, Jamb clear am say di reason for di directive na to guide against multiple admissions, wia one candidate go get di option of rejecting an admission offer but decide to accept am to block oda pipo chances.

Di board add say di policy no bar any candidate from applying for UTME afresh, but wetin di clause simply mean na say, di candidate must show evidence of completion or withdrawal from di previous admission bifor securing anoda offer. "No candidate suppose hold two admission offers at di same time".

"Many of dem no dey take time to read or properly understand di guidelines, yet dem go rush go public space wit false narratives wit di sole purpose of attracting traffic to dia social media platforms," Benjamin add.

Jamb compulsory all candidates wey dey register for di 2026 UTME/DE to disclose dia matriculation status, wia applicable.

According to Jamb tok-tok pesin, "disclosure simply mean say once a candidate secure admission through di latest registration, di former admission automatically don cease to stand.

Dis one mean say, di candidate go automatically lose im previous admission.

Di law dey clear say no candidate dey permitted to hold two admissions at di same time, Benjamin add.

E also point say recent findings show say some matriculated students dey engage as professional examination takers.

"Mandatory disclosure, therefore, expedite appropriate action weneva dem catch dose kain candidates," e tok.

Benjamin add say although di board system fit detect prior matriculation, candidates wey fail to disclose stand di risk of forfeiting both opportunities.

Registration for di 2026 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination (UTME)for di 2026/2027 academic session bin commence on Monday, 26 January.

Di period of registration for UTME candidates including dose from foreign kontris bin start on Monday, 26 January and e go end on Saturday, 28 February.

However, di sales of di UTME application document e-pin bin start on 19 January and go end on Thursday, 26 February.

Registration of di exercise go close on Saturday, 28 February.

For Direct Entry candidates, sales of di application documents and e-pin vending go start from Monday, 2 March and end on Saturday, 25 April.
title: 'University students gatz declare status or forgo UTME registration' - Jamb

raw_text:
As Ugandans go enta polls on 15 January, dem dey face di choice of electing one leader wey enta im fifth decade in power or supporting one candidate wey wan capitalise on di desire for change from some quarters.

81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni don dey office since 1986, e dey aim for seventh successive election victory.

Im main challenger, 43-year-old pop star wey turn politician Bobi Wine don promise revolution in governance and sweeping reforms.

Di campaigns dey marked wit disruption of opposition activities, wey include di detention of activists and police wey dey scata rallies.

Wit high rates of youth unemployment for kontri wia majority of di population dey under 30, di economy don bicom key concern for di campaign.

Di election go hold on Thursday 15 January. Polls go open at 07:00 local time (04:00 GMT) and close at 16:00. Dem go allow anyody wey dey queue for dat time to vote.

Di 21.6 million registered voters go take part in three elections:

Museveni and Bobi Wine na di two front-runners among di all-male list of eight hopefuls.

Dis na di second time dem go face each oda for di ballot box. Di president bin win di 2021 poll, wey dey marred by allegations of rigging plus crackdown on di opposition, wit 58% of di vote compared to Bobi Wine 35%.

Yoweri Museveni - National Resistance Movement (NRM)

Museveni bin first take power by force 40 years ago as di leader of one guerrilla army wey bin pledge to restore democracy afta years of civil war and di dictatorship of Idi Amin.

Pipo bin first see am as part of a fresh generation of African leaders wey go usher in a new democratic era, however, growing accusations of human rights abuses and harassment of opposition figures don spoil dat perception.

Critics tok say e don rule wit iron hand since e seize control and e don go back on pledges to step down. E be di only president wey most Ugandans know.

Currently di third longest-serving leader in Africa, Museveni don benefit from two constitutional amendments – e remove age and term limits – wey don allow am to keep running for office.

E argue say na only im be di sole guarantor of stability and progress.

Bobi Wine - National Unity Platform (NUP)

Pipo reason one-time hit maker Bobi Wine, wey im real name na Robert Kyagulanyi, as di strongest of di seven opposition candidates.

At a time, pipo nickname am as ghetto president", dem see am as pesin wey carry youthful aspirations for change and e enjoy strong support among young, urban, working-class voters.

Bobi Wine establish imsef as a serious contender five years ago, e come second and help restrict Museveni to di lowest share of di vote for any election e don contest. Bobi Wine NUP party bicom di largest opposition force in parliament.

Since dat vote, Bobi Wine don continue to face harassment from di security forces.

Di oda candidates na Frank Bulira, Robert Kasibante, Joseph Mabirizi, Nandala Mafabi, Mugisha Muntu and Mubarak Munyagwa.

Prominent opposition figure Kizza Besigye, wey bin run against Museveni four times, no fit take part for dis year election as e remain for jail on treason charges afta dem arrest am forneighbouring Kenya in 2024. E don deny any wrongdoing.

Economic issues, particularly unemployment dey heavy on di minds of many as dem dey ready to vote.

Di average income per person dey slow but e don dey rise since di pandemic but enough jobs no still dey to match di high numbers of young people wey dey find work.

Concerns also dey ground about poor infrastructure and differences in access to quality education and healthcare.

Di kontri don however manage to avoid di spike in di cost of living wey don affect so many oda countries for di region and lead to pressure on dos in power.

Corruption is another major concern.

Uganda come 140th out of 180 countries on Transparency International annual Corruption Perceptions Index, wit widespread bribery and nepotism wey dey reported in govment institutions.

Pipo don often condemn di way dem take carry out elections for Uganda.

Dis time around, officials tok say di vote go be free and fair but UN experts don warn say dat fit no be di case, as dem cite wetin dem describe as "pervasive climate of fear" for Uganda.

During di campaign period, opposition supporters bin face more harassment, wey include arrest on politically motivated charges, rights groups say.

Security forces scata Bobi Wine rallies, unlike dos of Museveni.

Amnesty International bin describe di use of tear gas, pepper spray, beatings, and oda violent acts as "a brutal campaign of repression" ahead of di vote.

Di govment say di measures dey necessary to ensure peaceful election and stop anyone from causing riots on election day.

Wen e come to di election itself, Bobi Wine don urge voters to stay for polling stations and safeguard dia ballots to help prevent vote rigging.

But election officials don say make pipo cast dia ballots peacefully and leave, as dem give assurance say di vote counting go dey transparent and party agents, di media and election monitors go observe am.

Critics, however, don question di independence of di electoral commission.

Despite govment denials, fears also dey based on previous experience, of internet shutdown during di election wey dey aimed at preventing pipo from verifying results. Di NUP tok say dem get vote-monitoring app wey fit overcome dis issue by using Bluetooth technology.

If everything go according to plan, kontri pipo suppose know di outcome of di presidential vote by 16:00 local time (13:00 GMT) on Saturday 17 January.

Dis na becos by law dielectoral commission must declaredipresidential result within 48 hours fromdiend of voting.

Polls go close at 16:00 local time on Thursday.

Di counting of votes suppose begin at each polling station as soon as voting close. Dem go transmit di results to one central tallying centre.

A candidate must gain more dan 50% of di votes cast nationwide to win di presidency for di first round, if not, run-off within 30 days between di top two candidates.

Museveni don always gain more dan 50% for di initial round of voting.
title: Di musician and di strongman leader - wetin you need to know about Uganda election

raw_text:
Di Confederation of African Football (Caf) don sama Cameroon Football Federation (Fecafoot) President, Samuel Eto'o Fils four-match ban and a fine of $20,000.

According to Caf, na sake of allegations of misconduct during di ongoing Africa Cup of Nations, Afcon, competition.

For statement, Caf say dem find Mr. Eto'o guilty of violating di principles of sportsmanship, during di quarterfinal match between Cameroon and Morocco.

For di match wey bin hapun on January 9, tori be say di Fecafoot president bin dey make angry gesture ova some of di decisions wey di officiating referee make.

Cameroon lose di match 2-0 to hosts Morocco.

E be like say di President of Caf, Patrice Motsepe wey bin dey for di stadium witness Eto'o frustration.

On January 12, di confederation bin announce say dem dey launch investigation into violent confrontations and unacceptable behaviour of some players and officials during matches.

Meanwhile, Fecafoot don reject Caf decision, dem describe di process as one wey dey "raises serious reservations about di fundamental requirements of a fair trial."

Di federation express support for dia president inside one statement on Wednesday, wia dem suggest say Mr. Eto'o go appeal di sanction.

Since im enta office as head of Cameroon Football Federation for 2021, Eto'o don enta several controversy.

Im bin don face accusations of improper conduct, poor management, wit some football stakeholders wey dey also complain of serious irregularities within Fecafoot.

Di 44-year-old former striker don reject dis allegations many times.

Samuel Eto'o Fils na one of di best footballers wey Africa don get. Di Cameroonian forward bin play for big clubs Real Madrid for 1996 at di age of 16 before e go on loan for Leganes, Espanyol and Mallorca. Im bin al;so play for Barcelona

For 2006, Eto'o become di first and only African to win di Spanish Golden Boot afta e net 26 times in 34 matches.

Di forward score 108 goals in 144 games for di Nou Camp side before e join Inter Milan for 2009, wia e win im third Champions League crown as well as Serie A title and di Fifa Club World Cup for 2010.

Internationally, Eto'o epp di Indomitable Lions to win two successive Africa Cup of Nations for 2000 and 2002 and go on to become di tournament record scorer with 18 goals.

For 2000, e guide Cameroon to Olympic gold medal, wia e score for di final.
title: Why Caf sama Cameroon football President Samuel Eto'o anoda fine

raw_text:
Wen Ruth enta police station to allege say her partner don rape am, she no expect say she go end up for dock.

Police later accuse am say she make false allegation, charge her and put her for trial. E lead to years-long of struggle to clear her name, before dem finally free her.

Ruth, we don change her name to protect her identity, report di alleged rape for early 2020 - seven months afta she and di man, wey be police officer, don break up.

Di day wey di alleged assault happun, na di last time dem see each oda. "I feel say if I no report am, I no fit continue wit my life anymore," Ruth tell File on 4 Investigates.

Although di man wey dem accuse no face any charge, Ruth dey face accusation of perverting justice, wey fit carry life sentence.

For UK, only "extremely small number" of pipo evri year dey prosecuted for false rape claims, according to Crown Prosecution Service (CPS).

Di latest official figures from CPS show say for more dan one decade ago, ova a period of 17-month, between 2011-12, dem prosecute 5,651 for rape in England and Wales - but only 35 for making false allegations.

Around dat time, dem update di CPS guidelines, dis lead to false rape prosecutions dropping.

Pesin wey dem falsely accuse of rape before trial fit spend time for police cell or even prison.

If dem charge dem, dia name normally go dey public. Even pipo wey dem quickly clear fit face stigma.

Current CPS guidance tok say e dey important make police accept di damaging impact false rape allegation fit cause, and dem need handle these cases well.

"Di bar for dis prosecutions dey high," e tell us, and "lawyers for di highest level of di organisation need approve charging decisions."

For Ruth matta, di judge tok say e be like say "di whole prosecution start on false basis."

E ask serious kwesions about how dem handle di case - including one piece of evidence: secret audio recording wey Ruth former partner make.

Dis report contain explicit and distressing references to alleged sexual assault.

Ruth relationship wit di man wey she accuse dey short but intense.

E end for summer 2019, afta painful sexual encounter wia she tok say na rape.

Ruth gree reluctantly for one particular sexual act, but she set two conditions - one be say her partner go stop if she tell am say e dey pain am. She tok say she later withdraw consent during sex.

"E really, really, really dey painful," she tok.

However, she tok say her partner no stop.

Later, dem start to argue, and Ruth partner tell am say di relationship don end.

Ruth tok say she suffer so much pain, so she go see her GP wey send am go hospital for swabs and checkup.

She believe say dem don rape am. "I no wan report am becos na police officer," she tok.

She try forget wetin happun, but wen she dey find am hard to connect wit new partner months later, she decide to report di rape to Warwickshire Police.

Ruth ex partner - wey be officer for West Midlands Police - dem arrest and kwesion am, but e deny say im rape her.

To show say di sex dey consensual, e bring one audio wey im don secretly record for im phone during di sex, wey prove say Ruth dey lie.

Later, e go come clear say di officers wey dey investigate for Warwickshire agree say dem fit hear as she dey "laugh and consent".

Six weeks later, Warwickshire Police tok say dem no go take any action against Ruth ex partner.

She den, receive one phone call from di force wia ask make she come do voluntary interview.

"I think say dem really dey support me, but e change quickly," she tok.

"Dem tok say I be scorn woman, he no want me, so I dey cry for rape."

Na for her police interview Ruth find out about her ex secret audio recording.

For November 2020, nine months afta she make her allegation, dem charge Ruth wit perverting di course of justice.

Wen pesin dey pervert justice, e mean say dem dey interfere wit justice system.

E fit cover crimes such as to give false lie alibi to protect friend or family, destroy or hide evidence, dey threaten witnesses or make false allegations.

For England and Wales, wen police dey suspect false rape claims, police make decision to raise am and charge di case to higher level, by informing di director of public prosecutions.

According to CPS guidance, authorities must get evidence to show say pesin don make false allegation.

For Ruth case, as well as di audio recording, di officers wey investigate tok say plenty contradiction dey between wetin Ruth tok and di WhatsApp messages wey she don send her partner, wey show say she gree make dem do kerewa.

Wen di trial for Ruth finally start for April 2023, di prosecution lawyers tell di court say di recording and messages, plus her behaviour bifor and afta di matter, na proof say she dey lie.

Dem refer to di transcript of di recording, but dem no play di audio for di jury.

But Ruth barrister, Sophie Murray, play am.

As di recording dey play, Ruth dey tok say she dey pain and she tell her partner "no" and "make e comot am".

No laughter or enjoyment for Ruth voice.

Her lawyers check di audio file and see say na actors from porn film dey make those noise wey dey background.

"Suddenly, evriwia change," Ruth remember. Na first time she dey hear di recording of di alleged rape.

She tok say e dey "worse dan I fit remember". Murray wey dey listen to di audio for court, say Ruth wey dey sideon behind am for dock, clearly dey in pain. E tok say na "one of di hardest moment for my career", she tok.

Ruth defence tie to di idea of her "conditional consent" wey dem don break. Di Sexual Offences Act 2003 tok say pesin fit set condition wen e dey agree to sex - like say, make dem wear condom. If dem break dat condition, dem go consider di sex as non-concensual.

For im victim impact statement, Ruth ex-partner tok say as dem accuse am of rape e be like "living nightmare" and say Ruth don agree for di sexual encounter.

But under cross-examination by Murray, e admit say Ruth don ask am to stop di sex if e dey pain am - and e no stop.

Dem don suspend di man from West Midlands Police wit full pay.

E dey face misconduct hearing later dis year to know weda e break police code of ethics by recording di sexual act without her knowing.

We try to reach am, but e no respond.

Di jury take ova one hour to clear Ruth say she no dey guilty for perverting justice.

No be rape trial, so verdict no mean say jury find say im rape am – only say she believe so wen she make her allegation.

"I no cry, I no shout," she tok as dem no find her guilty. "I no really know wetin I feel if I tok truth"

Di judge dey ask how CPS and Warwickshire Police take make dia decisions. E also ask make dem reopen di original rape matter.

CPS tell BBC say dem dey take every rape allegation seriously, and for special cases like Ruth, na many senior prosecutors dey review evidence.

But dem respect di jury decision. Inside one statement, Warwickshire Police tok say dem consult CPS bifor dem charge Ruth for perverting justice.

Afta her trial, "dem conduct thorough review of dis case and original rape investigation, by independent officers wey no dey involve before."

We also seek advice from different CPS area to make sure say e dey independent – but dem still find say dem no get enough evidence to fit pursue di rape charge and dem close the case.

We update di victim throughout the review process, di force tok say dem dey take  "all rape reports seriously and dem dey do everytin to support rape victims" and  don "invest more resources for rape allegations."

Di suspect wey dey under investigation in di rape case na serving police officer, but e no affect di investigation, dey add extra levels ofscrutiny, di statement tok.

Di force wey employ Ruth ex-partner, West Midlands Police, tell us say dem carry out investigation into di conduct od di matta afta Ruth trial, as dem no dey progress internal investigations during criminal case.

Dem tok say even though investigation into di officer happun as fast as possible, e happun "within strict legal framework, wey mean serious or complex cases fit take time."

Ruth tok say she feel let down by di decision say dem no prosecute her ex-partner, but she no regret say she report di alleged rape.

"I fit honestly tok say everything wey I don do dey right for myself and for oda pipo," she tok. "I dey hope say nobody go dey in di same position like me."
title: I accuse one police officer say e rape me, but na me end up on trial

raw_text:
One dangerous winter storm don scata many places for di US, wey kill at least seven pipo; wey e don cut power to thousands of homes.

Dem close schools and roads across di kontri wey flights dey cancelled as "life-threatening" conditions dey stretch from Texas to New England, according to di National Weather Service (NWS).

At least two pipo die from hypothermia (dem lose heat wey dia body temperature drop) for Louisiana.

Oda deaths dey linked to di storm wey dem report for Texas, Tennessee and Kansas.

By Sunday, more dan 800,000 households no get power, according to poweroutage.us. Meanwhile more dan 11,000 flights dey cancelled, FlightAware bin report.

Plenti heavy snow and di freezing rain fit last for days wey di storm fit affect around 180 million American pipo - more dan half of di population.

"Di snow and ice go dey veri slow to melt, e neva fit go away soon, dat fit affect di recovery effort," Allison Santorelli, meteorologist wit di National Weather Service, tell di BBC US media partner CBS News.

Louisiana Department of Health don confam say two men die from hypothermia on Sunday.

Di mayor for Austin, Texas, say one "exposure-related" death don happun.

Officials for Kansas also tok say dem find di body of one woman wey snow don cover all her body - e fit be say "she bin die from hypothermia."

Dem also report di death of three oda pipo for Tennessee.

New York City Mayor Zohran Mamdani don write on top im X handle say at least five pipo for di city don die on Saturday but im add say dem no find di cause of dia death yet.

New York state Govnor Kathy Hochul don warn residents say make dem dey indoors wey dem for stay away from roads.

"Dis na di coldest weather we don see, di coldest winter storm we bin see in many years," she tok on Sunday.

Hochul say di "brutal" conditions dey expected to bring di longest cold stretch and highest snow falls in years.

"E dey chill di bone - dis be dangerous," she tok.

Kentucky Govnor Andy Beshear tok for Sunday say di kontri dey see more ice and less snow dan wetin dem first predict.

"Dis neva be good news for Kentucky."

Sabi pipo don warn say one ogbonge dangers of storm na ice, wey e fit destroy trees, affect power connection wey e fit make di roads unsafe.

For Virginia and Kentucky, authorities don respond to hundreds of crashes on top di roads.

Canadians don also suffer heavy snow wey dem cancel hundreds of flights.

Officials dey estimate say di snow fit continue to fall (15-30cm) for di province of Ontario.

About half of di states don declare emergencies wey schools across di kontri bin dey cancel classes sake of di storm dey continue into Monday.

Di US Senate also scata dia schedule voting wey dem plan for Monday evening.

Washington Mayor Muriel Bowser tok as im declare emergency for di capital say "we dey experience di biggest snowstorm in 10 years for DC dis weekend".

While places for di north like Dakota and Minnesota dey used to temperature below freezing level for di winter, e dey unusual to see dis kain extreme cold for states like Texas, Louisiana and Tennessee, wia di temperature dey around 15-20C below di seasonal average.

Di polar vortex - wey be one strong westerly wind wey dey form from above di Arctic evri winter wey dey contain pool of cold air - dis bin lead to di powerful storm, according to sabi pipo.

For dis case, di winter storm dey push to di north and east, wey e dey clear di Canadian maritime by Tuesday - wey e dey leave more cold air behind.

Dem forecast say e go dey cold like dis (dangerous) until di beginning of February.

Some sabi pipo believe say climate change fit influence di behaviour of di polar vortex sake of changes for di sea surface temperature for di world.
title: Major winter storm wey hit di US kill at least seven pipo, 800,000 witout power

raw_text:
Di 2025 Africa Cup of Nations don end but di almost one month long tournament wey happun for Morocco still dey cause tok-tok.

Senegal win dia second Afcon title afta kasala wey almost see dem almost abandon di match.

Dis reactions from fans and football lovers na sake of some tins wey happun for di tournament.

Afcon 2025 witness alleged referee bias and poor officiating, violence on di pitch between Nigeria and Algeria for di quarterfinals, tensed match between Nigeria and Morocco and walk-out for di finals between hosts Morocco and Senegal.

Cameroon Football President, Samuel Eto'o Fils also chop match ban and fine sake of di way e react to referee decision wey no sweet im belle.

Anoda part na how big names for football miss important penalty and di awards wey kontris and players later win as di tournament end.

Make we chook eye inside dem one by one.

Senegal beat Morocco to win Afcon 2025 afta last minute dramana di major highlight of di tournament.

Di kasala wey happun during di final wen di centre referee Jean Jacques Ndala award stoppage time penalty to Morocco.

Di referee give penalty for di 98th minute afta di VAR advise am to watch di monitor to confam El Hadji Malick Diouf challenge of Brahim Diaz of Morocco.

Dis dey come afta e bin don cancel goal wey Senegal score sake of foul wey happun for di buildup to di goal.

Dis decision make Senegal coach vex as e tell di team to comot from di field. Di players and technical crew para well-well sotay dem vex comot from pitch say dem no dey play again.

Dem later come out to play and Brahim Diaz of Morocco miss di penalty as di ball in 'Pamela' spot kick land for Senegal goalkeeper Mendy hand.

For Extra time, Pape Gueye score di winning goal inside di fourth minute of extra time.

For post-match conference, Morocoo coach Walid Regragui say di actions of Senegal dey "shameful" and e no "honour Africa"

Fifa President, Gianni Infantino don strongly condemn di "ugly scenes" inside post for Instagram.

Meanwhile di coach of Senegal no fit tok for post-match conference because dem cancel am sake of di kasala wey burst for field.

Caf for statement wey dem release on Monday 19 January say dem go review wetin happun and take disciplinary action against Senegal or Morocco if dem find any of dem guilty.

For di quarterfinal match between Nigeria and Algeria anoda kasala bin happun afta Nigeria beat Algeria 2-0. Nigeria bin progress to di semifinal while Algeria journey end.

Dis win make tempers rise as Algerian players cause kasala for pitch as dem begin argue wit Nigeria players.

Small time dem begin push each oda before match officials and di technical crew intervene.

Dem later calm down ans di players and evribody waka enta dressing room.

Nigeria also face hard time against Morocco as pipo allege say Caf do evritin to frustrate Nigeria so dat Morocco go enta di finals.

Football fans begin complain from wen Caf binname Ghanaian referee and oda officialswey go officiate di Nigeria vs Morocco semifinal clash.

Dem even accuse di Ghanian referee Daniel Nii Ayi Laryea of poor officiating.

But Caf don tok say dem go chook eye for all di controversies and accusations against referees and oda officials for di 2025 Afcon.

Penalty kicks plenti well-well for di 2025 Afcon sake of say many matches enta extra time from di quarterfinals.

Dem need dis penaties to decide di winner of dis matches and coaches dey always bring dia best leag to play, but sometimes e no dey go as planned.

Some of di ogbonge players wey miss spot kicks na.

Mohamed Salah- Di Egyptian and Liverpool forward bin step forward to take di first kick against Nigeria but nigeria goalkeeper Stanley Nwabali catch di ball.

Omar Marmoush- Anoda Egyptian player Omar Marmoush miss dia secomd spot kick as Nigeria goalie Stanley Nwabali show imsef again as e save di kick.

Brahim Diaz- Dis ogbonge player dey play fopr Morocco and Real Madrid for Spain. E miss di penalty wey suppose give Morocco dia first title in 50 years. E play 'paneka' kick wey land for Senegal goalkeeper Mendy hand.

For Nigeria team di likes of Samuel Chukwueze, Bruno Onyemachi and Dele Bashiru miss penalties.

One tin wey sweet pipo belle na di Best Player awards wey players dey win for dia kontri sake of dia performance for di tournament.

Sadio Mane of Senegal win di Player of di tournament.

Brahim Diaz of Morocco win di Golden Boot as top scorer wit fiove goals.

Yassine Bonou of Morocco win di Golden Glove for di best Goalkeeper

Sake of all di complains and accusation of poor officiating, di President of Cameroon Football Federationchop sanction from Caf

Caf say dem sama Et'o ban and fine sake of allegations of misconduct during di Africa Cup of Nations, Afcon, competition.

For statement, Caf say dem find Mr. Eto'o guilty of violating di principles of sportsmanship, during di quarterfinal match between Cameroon and Morocco.

For di match wey bin hapun on January 9, tori be say di Fecafoot president bin dey make angry gesture ova some of di decisions wey di officiating referee make.

Cameroon lose di match 2-0 to hosts Morocco.

Meanwhile, Fecafoot don reject Caf decision, dem describe di process as one wey dey "raises serious reservations about di fundamental requirements of a fair trial."

Di federation express support for dia president inside one statement on Wednesday, wia dem suggest say Mr. Eto'o go appeal di sanction.

Since im enta office as head of Cameroon Football Federation for 2021, Eto'o don enta several controversy.

Im bin don face accusations of improper conduct, poor management, wit some football stakeholders wey dey also complain of serious irregularities within Fecafoot.

Di 44-year-old former striker don reject dis allegations many times.
title: Five key tins wey happun for Afcon 2025

raw_text:
Di military junta for Burkina Faso say dem scata fresh attempt to remove Captain Ibrahim Traore through coup d'etat ova di weekend.

Di junta allege say na di former leader Lieutenant Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba dey responsible for di latest coup attempt – wey dem plan to assassinate President Ibrahim Traore, state-run Radiodiffusion Television du Burkina (RTB) report on Tuesday.

Security Minister Mahamadou Sana say di coup plot involve di "targeted assassinations" of civilian and military officials, beginning wit Traore, either "at point-blank range or by bombing his house."

Di minister add say "arrest and investigation dey continue wey we dey scata dia networks; we go later show videos of dia confession during interrogation of most of di pipo behind dis attempt."

Di military junta allege say Damiba don mobilize soldiers and civilians, wey dem get foreign funding (70 million CFA francs from Côte d'Ivoire) for dis operation.

Both Damiba and Cote d'Ivoire neva comment on dis allegations yet.

Security Minister Mahamadou Sana say "di situation dey under control" wey he advise di kontri pipo say make dem no "mislead dem into dis kind dangerous tins."

Captain Traoré overthrow Lieutenant Colonel Paul‑Henri Damiba in 2022 to become leader of di west African kontri.

But since den, authorities say pipo don plan to stage coups against Captain Traore.

Di latest attempt hapun afta one wey di military govment describe as "major coup plot" for April 2025, allegedly by exiled opponents for Ivory Coast.

Since Captain Traoré become leader through coup d'etat, im military regime bin face wahala including jihadist violence wey displace millions across di region.

Despite dis, Traoré get popular support for di kontri – as im dey preach development wit im pan-African vision.

But critics – foreign and local don accuse Traoré of authoritarianism wey dem say di military govment no dey allow freedom of speech wey dem dey prevent opposition voices.

Di Traoré regime also dey accused of arbitrary arrest of military officers wey dem no dey allow free media.

Dis power struggle inside di kontri don dey cause tension for di West African region.

Di Traoré govment claim in di past say dem find say pipo outside di kontri dey plan to "destabilize" di kontri, especially from Ivory Coast – situation wey don dey cause diplomatic tension.

E neva dey clear how many pipo dem arrest for dis latest alleged coup plot, even though di kontri security minister confam say dem go make di suspects face trial afta dem finish wit dia investigations.

Kontris for West Africa don dey monitor di situation for Burkina Faso.

Traoré im govment also dey face di challenge of how to balance security for di kontri and di democratic transition wey dem bin promise.

For December 2025, Burkina Faso military ruler, Capt Ibrahim Traore, become di new Chairman of di Alliance of Sahel States (AES).

E take ova di rotating presidency from Mali military leader Gen Assimi Goita during di 2nd Ordinary Session of di College of Heads of States summit wey hold for Bamako on Tuesday, 23 December.

Di summit bring togeda di three AES leaders: General Assimi Goita (Mali), Captain Ibrahim Traoré (Burkina Faso), and General Abdourahamane Tiani (Niger).

For im remarks, Traore bin warn of one severe West African instability, e call "Black Winter" wey e blame on "imperialists" wey dey sponsor militant groups to further destabilise di region.

E also accuse unnamed African "cowardly heads of state" say dem undermine regional security forces and destroy public confidence for di juntas wey dey govern di three AES member states.

E neva dey clear at dis time wetin di Alliance of Sahel States go do about di latest alleged coup plot for di kontri.
title: Wetin we know about di latest coup attempt for Burkina Faso and plan to remove Ibrahim Traoré

raw_text:
President Donald Trump dey face calls to launch full investigation following di fatal shooting of 37-year-old nurse, and US citizen, Alex Pretti by federal agents.

Pretti death bin come less dan three weeks afta one immigration agent for Minneapolis shoot to death Renee Good.

Minnesota Govnor Tim Walz don repeat demands for di Trump administration to remove federal agents from di state. E say US dey for "inflection point".

For one interview wit di Wall Street Journal on Sunday, Trump tok say im administration dey "review evritin" and also indicate say im go eventually withdraw Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) agents from di city - but e no give time frame for dis.

Federal and state officials don give totally different accounts of di moments bifor Pretti death.

Di Trump administration defend di officer wey shoot Pretti. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem tok say dem shoot Pretti bicos e dey "wave" one gun.

Local authorities deny dis. Dem say di gun dey legally registered, dem say di agent shoot Pretti afta dem remove im firearm.

Protesters don continue to enta di streets of Minneapolis plus oda parts of di US following di fatal shooting.

Meanwhile, di Republican Govnor of Vermont, Phil Scott, tok say e no "dey acceptable" for "federal agents to kill US citizens" for exercising dia protected rights to protest.

E dey among some of di Republican lawmakers wey dey call for full investigation into di fatal shooting of Alex Pretti.

E say, "at best", immigration officers actions na "complete failure of coordination of acceptable public safety".

"Di president suppose pause dis operations, de-escalate di situation and reset di federal govment focus on truly criminal, illegal immigrants," e write and add say, "Congress and di courts gatz step up to restore constitutionality."

Di family of di man wey federal agents for Minneapolis shoot dead on Saturday don identify am as 37-year-old intensive care nurse, Alex Pretti.

Pretti family describe am as active outdoorsman wey love mountain biking, and dem say e bin follow for di protests afta one Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) agent shoot dead Renee Good, wey also be 37, for inside her car earlier dis month.

Conflicting accounts don emerge about moments wey lead up to Pretti death.

Di Department of Homeland Security (DHS) tok say agents bin fire in self-defence afta Pretti, wey dem claim say hold handgun, resist attempts to collect di gun from im hand.

Some eyewitnesses and officials, plus Pretti family, don challenge dat account.

Pretti bin work as ICU nurse for di Minneapolis Veterans Affairs hospital, im family tok for one statement.

Dem tell di Associated Press news agency (AP) say e no dey happy wit US President Donald Trump crackdown on immigration for di city.

Pretti mother also say her son care deeply about di Trump administration rollback of environmental regulations.

"E hate am, you know, di way pipo just dey pour dirty on di land," Susan Pretti tell AP.

She add say: "E be pesin wey like to dey outside. E dey carry im dog go evriwia e go. You know, e love im kontri, but e hate wetin pipo dey do to am."

Pretti love adventures wit im beloved Catahoula Leopard dog Joule, wey die around a year ago, AP bin report.

Im family say e no get wahala wit law enforcement beyond one handful of traffic tickets. According to AP, court records show say e no get criminal record.

Pretti parents, wey dey live for Wisconsin, tok say dem bin recently tell dia son to dey careful as e dey protest.

"We bin get dis discussion wit am two weeks ago or so, you know, say go ahead and protest, but no follow dem cause wahala, no do anytin stupid, basically," im father Michael Pretti tell AP.

"And e tok say im sabi all dat one. E know."

Pretti family also explain say e get one handgun and e get permission to carry concealed handgun for Minnesota - but dem no ever see am carry am.

Minneapolis Police Chief Brian O'Hara also tok say police believe say e be lawful gun owner wey get permit to carry, BBC US partner CBS report.

After dem see videos wey suggest say dia son na "domestic terrorist," Pretti family issue a statement wey say "di sickening lies wey dis administration tok about our son dey reprehensible and disgusting".

Dem claim say videos show say Pretti no hold gun wen federal agents tackle am.

"Please get di truth out about our son. Na good man," dem tok for dia statement.

Pretti na Democratic voter and e don take part for di wave of street protests afta Minneapolis police officer kill George Floyd for 2020, im ex-wife tell AP.

She say e be pesin wey fit shout at law enforcement officers for protest but she no sabi am as persin wey dey physically confrontational.

Pretti na US citizen wey dem born for Illinois. E grow up for Green Bay, Wisconsin, wia e play football, baseball and e run track for Preble High School.

E bin dey Boy Scout and e sing for di Green Bay Boy Choir.

Pretti attend di University of Minnesota and graduate for 2011 wit a bachelor degree in biology, society and di environment, according to im family.

E bin work as research scientist bifor e return to school to bicom registered nurse.

Im parents tok say di last conversation wit dia son na some days bifor im death.  Dem bin tok about di repairs wey e go do for di garage door of im house, AP report.

Doctor Dmitri Drekonja, wey work wit Pretti, tell ABC News say two of dem bond well-well ova dia interest in mountain biking and dem dey compare notes on which trails to ride.

"E be di type of pesin you go like to dey around and di idea say dis helpful, smiling joking guy dey labelled as a terrorist? Dey annoying," e tok.

Neighbours describe Pretti as quiet and warmhearted.

"E be wonderful pesin," Sue Gitar tell AP. She dey live downstairs from di nurse and say e move into di building about three years ago. "E get great heart."

Pretti live alone and dey work long hours as nurse, but e no be loner, im neighbours tok.

"I no ever reason am as pesin wey fit carry gun," Gitar.

Di shooting happun on Saturday morning near Nicollet Avenue and 26th Street for south Minneapolis at 09:05 local time (15:05 GMT).

On Saturday night, hundreds of pipo pay tribute to Pretti - dem light candles and chant im name near di spot dem take shoot am.

During di day, hundreds of protesters bin show dia anger against di shooting and ongoing Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) raids for di city, as armed and masked agents use tear gas and flashbang grenades to scata dem.

Protests don spread to oda US cities, wit more dan 1,000 demonstrators for New York on Saturday, wey hold signs wey include "Justice for Alex" and "abolish Ice". Hundreds bin also take part for one protest for sub-zero temperatures for Chicago.

Videos from moments bifor di shooting bin show as Pretti bin dey feem di agents wit im fone for di middle of di street. Pipo fit hear di whistling and shouting from bystanders for di background.

From one angle, e show like say one agent push one woman. Wen di camera move back to Pretti, e show im arm around her. Di agent push anoda woman. At di same time, Pretti stretch out im hand and stand between her and di agent.

Di agent come spray somtin for im eyes. Pretti turn im face away and put one open hand up for air. E be like say e hold fone for di oda hand. No gun dey visible.

Anoda video from a different angle show as di agent grab Pretti hand bifor more agents get involved.

Dem push Pretti for ground, and at least six agents bin dey on top am. Di video show as one agent dey hit am on im head..

Di video show anoda agent wey come di scene wit empty hands, pull back wit wetin be like gun for im hand. As e waka comot towards one vehicle, one split second later anoda agent stand beside am and open fire.

Di agents jump back from di man wey lie down for ground and di firing continue. Pipo say dem hear a total of 10 gunshots.
title: Trump say im administration go 'review evritin' afta fatal shooting of Minneapolis nurse

raw_text:
To dey drink orange juice all di time fit get effect on pesin health.

While oranges demsefs get plenty vitamins, in di form of drink, experts warn say orange juice dey deliver sudden rush of sugar go di blood.

Overtime, dis sugar spike fit lead to insulin resistance, wey go raise di risk of diabetes, heart disease plus obesity.

Na so some pipo dey tink, yet, research don start to show say despite say e get plenty sugar, one glass of orange juice evriday fit get different kain health benefits.

To start wit, cohort studies – wey dey track tens of thousands of pipo ova time – show say di chances of pipo wey dey eat plenty citrus fruit to suffer from heart disease and stroke dey low.

Howeva, most of these large studies dey ask pipo about how much fruit dem dey chop, no be how much fruit juice de dey drink.

To chop fruit dey get different effect on di body, wen you compare am wit wen pesin drink fruit juice.

"First of all, na di speed wit which you take chop am," Federica Amati, one nutrition scientist for Imperial College London, UK tok.

Amati say if pesin eat two or three oranges – di average amount e dey take to make small glass of orange juice – "to eat, chew, and swallow dem go take longer time".

She add, "In fact, most pipo no go like to take two or three oranges, as dem go see am as too much. Whereas, dem go squeeze dat number of oranges for inside small cup – and pesin go drink am finish within seconds.

Whole fruit also dey rich in fibre, wey dey feed di good bacteria for your gut, and e dey linked to health benefits like reduced risk of cardiovascular disease and colon cancer.

Fibre dey also dey also slow down di flow of sugars into our bloodstream. Dem dey make orange juice – plus oda fruit juices –by crushing and pulping whole fruits, dem go most of di fire for di fruits.

Di end result na say if you compare di blood sugar of pesin wey dey eat whole orange versus di pesin wey dey drink orange juice, di blood sugar of di pesin wey dey take whole orange go rise small, whereas one glass of orange juice get more dramatic effect.

"[In orange juice], dem don free di sugars from dia fibre capsules, and so dem dey absorb very fast for di mouth and for belle. So, dat go lead to rapid rise in blood sugar," Amati tok.

Howeva, for most pipo, dat kain rise no be problem, bicos insulin dey released wey dey remove sugar from di bloodstream.

Howeva, for pesin wey get diabetes, one glass of orange juice fit no be good idea.

"I tink di challenge wit fruit juices generally na say technically e dey free of sugars, but no be only dat," Amati tok. "So yes, dem fit make your blood sugar go up, but – especially if dem dey freshly squeezed – dem also get bioactive nutrients in dem like vitamin C.

Signs dey day frequent orange juice drinking fit get plenty benefits, despite high sugar content.

For example, one meta-analysis wey gada di results of 10 randomised controlled trials (RCTs) discover say drinking 500ml (17 fl oz) of orange juice a day dey associated wit lower blood glucose levels, improved insulin function and lower levels of low-density lipoprotein (LDL), known as "bad cholesterol" – all signs of good heart health.

No be just heart health; orange juice fit dey good for di brain too.

For one trial, 24 healthy men aged between 30 and 45 drink 240ml (8 fl oz) of 100% orange juice, or one sugary drink wey get di same amount of calories.

Dem test di cognitive function of di participant mood six hours afta drinking the beverage. Di mental faculties of di orange juice group no only increase afta dem drink am, dia subjective feelings of alertness bin also ginger.

Howeva, di participants wey drink orange juice dey manage to retain dia alertness. One glass of orange juice fit e beta choice pass sugary drink. E go boost di brain power and focus for di short term – na one good thing if you get important meeting scheduled for your diary.

Signs dey say orange juice fit get long-term impact on brain health and ageing too. For one second study, Lamport and im team bin ask 37 healthy older adults aged 60-81 to drink either two glasses of 100% orange juice evri day for eight weeks, or two orange-flavoured drinks wey get similar amount of sugar and calories. Older adults wey drink orange juice get beta cognitive function compared to di placebo group afta eight weeks.

Even though explanations dey for why orange juice fit improve health. Oranges get plenty vitamin C, wey dey boost immunity, aid iron absorption and help make collagen for skin. E also contain oda vitamins and minerals like folate, calcium, potassium and thiamine (vitamin B1).

Howeva, di molecules pipo tink say dey behind orange protective role in heart and brain health dey known as flavonoids – one class of plant compounds dem dey see for fruits and vegetables wey dey give plants dia vibrant colours and help protect dem from stress and infection.

Flavonoids get antioxidant properties, wey mean say dem fit neutralise so-called "free radicals" – extremely reactive chemicals wey fit damage cells and accelerate biological ageing. Flavonoids also dey well known for dia anti-inflammatory properties.

One compound in particular wey don receive plenty interest na hesperidin – one flavonoid wey present for citrus fruits.

Hesperidin dey thought to be behind orange juice ability to influence blood pressure. For example, one 2025 study suggest say orange juice – and hesperidin – fit work dia wonders by activating genes wey dey help lower inflammation and help blood vessels relax.

Di study bin track 85 adults wey drink 500ml of pure pasteurised orange juice evri day for two months. Afta di end of 60 days, blood tests show say many of di genes wey dey associated wit triggering inflammation and high blood pressure bin bicom less active.

Sabi pipo reason say flavonoids, and hesperidin in particular, dey help blood vessels relax by increasing levels of di gas nitric oxide for di inner lining of blood vessels, known as di endothelium.

According to Lamport, good evidence dey wey show say flavonoids generally fit improve cognitive function and mood.

For instance for one study, 12 overweight women drink 500ml of orange juice evri day for four weeks. At di end of di trial period, di women blood pressure don go down.

Howeva, di two nutritionists wey BBC follow tok, say whole fruit na still di preferred option and di healthier choice.

Oranges no only contain more fibre, but dem dey also retain more flavonoids wey dey very beneficial for health. Polyphenols na di wider class of plant compounds to which flavonoids belong.

"Wen you eat fresh orange, di vitamin C and some of di more oxygen-sensitive nutrients [like flavonoids] no dey oxidise as much bicos dem still dey inside di fibre," Amati tok. "Whereas wen you juice orange, you go destroy di food matrix and dos nutrients go bicom exposed to di air, and so dem oxidise, wey dey reduce dia potency."

As fibre dey so hard to digest, e also dey help to carry polyphenols and flavonoids all di way to di colon wia beneficial microbes fit feast on dem and enhance dia benefits.

Howeva, if juice na your preferred choice, den freshly squeezed oranges for home or restaurant go retain more health benefits pass commercially available juice, as more fibre go remain.

Industrially produced orange juice, on di oda hand, dem go don pasteurise and heat am – wey fit kill off some of di more oxygen-sensitive nutrients, like vitamin C
title: Orange juice dey good for your health?

raw_text:
Di 2025 Afcon dey serve top football action for di pitch so far – now di competition don reach di business end.

Small small, we go find out who go win di tournament.

But beyond di football for ground, oda tins dey happun for di tournament.

One iconic fan Michel Kuka Mboladinga bin dey trend for matchdays wey involve DR Congo and oda teams.

Already pipo dey call am di star for dis 2025 Afcon - even though he no be footballer, or coach or technical team member for DR Congo.

Michel Kuka Mboladinga almost become di unofficial poster boy even though he no open mouth tok even one word.

Michel Kuka Mboladinga become meme for Morocco as im unique Lumumba pose like di statue for stadium dey attract many pipo.

E bin dey wear colourful yellow or grey jacket, sometimes white and blue shirt wit tie, wey e dey stand as he raise his hand for air like Lumumba im statue, for di whole football game.

Videos and foto of Michel Mboladinga, don go viral on top social media, wey pipo across di world don dey interested to know who Patrice Lumumba be and why Congolese pipo dey honour im memory wit such dedication.

Di Algerian football federation apologize to Michel Mboladinga afta dia player Mohamed Amoura face social media pressure wen im copy wetin Mboladinga dey do, bifor e fall to ground like say di statue don fall, during im celebration.

Di 25-year-old player now post apology on top im Instagram say "e neva mean to disrespect DR Congo."

"For dat moment, I neva dey aware of wetin di pesin or di symbol for di stands dey mean; I just try to joke around without any bad feeling," Amoura tok.

Afta dat game wen Algeria sama DR Congo to comot dem for di tournament – Mboladinga dey sad.

E comot im eye glass and clean some tears for face.

Na so di Algerian football federation reach out to am afta Amoura apology wey dem send dia media officer to present Mboladinga wit Algeria jersey wit di name 'Lumumba" for di back of di shirt.

Days afta, Nigerian striker Akor Adams pay tribute to Lumumba afta im score when Nigeria defeat Algeria 2-0 for di quarterfinal of di tournament.

Di Sevilla striker run to di touchline wey e follow Mboladinga do di iconic sign – e raise one hand for air, wey he stand still like statue for few seconds.

Lumumba no be pesin wey dem dey see and celebrate as hero for DR Congo alone; around di continent, e dey regarded as one of dileading voices for di anti-colonial movement for Africa.

Im become di first prime minister for di kontri at 34 years wey e bin play ogbonge role as di kontri gain independence from Belgium for 1960.

For di handover ceremony for June 1960, Lumumba bin speak out boldly about di violence and human suffering wey di pipo of Congo bin go through for di hands of dia colonisers.

Dis speech vex di Belgium authorities no be small as dem shock say one black African fit humiliate dia King and officials.

By September of 1960, wahala start within di military of DR Congo as one colonel Joseph Mobutu declare coup.

For December, dem capture Lumumba and two of im men, and by January 1961, supported by di govment of Belgium, dem kpai Lumumba and im men by firing squad and bury dia bodi for shallow graves.

But as di Belgian authority fear say pipo fit discova Lumumba bodi, dem dig up di corpse, carry am to anoda far location and bury am again, and den dig am up again, take saw pieces di bodi and den dissolve am for acid.

Di Belgium policeman wey supervise dis atrocity later confess and e tok say e keep one tooth of Lumumba wey no gree dissolve for di acid.

For 2002, di Belgium govment apologise to DR Congo, wey dem return dat one tooth of Lumuba wey remain, for im family to give am proper burial.

His daughter Juliana Lumumba wey go Brussels to receive di tooth remember di times she go dey her papa im office when im dey work as prime minister; at dat time, she be only five years.

She say her papa "belong to di kontri sake of he die for Congo and for his own values and dignity of di African pesin".

Juliana tok BBC news at di time say di handover of di tooth for Belgium to return to DR Congo be "symbolic sake of wetin remain neva be enough but he gatz to come back to his kontri wia dem kill am."

Dem later parade di tooth around di kontri for pipo to pay dia last respects wey dem do state burial for dia icon.

Dem later build mausoleum wey dey symbolize national reconciliation and remembrance for dia independent hero.

For years, di Lumumba family neva sabi exactly wetin happun to dia papa as officials close mouth about di circumstances wey lead to his death.

Lumumba im journey from prime minister to victim of assassination no last for more than seven months.

DR Congo dey celebrate am as dia hero wey he also be regarded as pan-African icon.

Wetin Michel Mboladinga – di DR Congo superfan don show for dis tournament, don dey show say di Afcon no just dey crown champions, sometimes e don dey revive legacies.
title: Michel Kuka Mboladinga - di man for Afcon 2025 wey become Lumumba

raw_text:
Chelsea Under-21s head coach Calum McFarlane go take charge of Sunday Premier League match wit Manchester City, as di club dey work to appoint who go be Enzo Maresca successor.

McFarlane na former coaching staff for Manchester City academy - and na im go take Friday press conference.

Maresca and im coaching staff comot for Chelsea on New Year's Day and Strasbourg manager Liam Rosenior be like di leading contender for di job.

Meanwhile, McFarlane go dey incharge of Chelsea for di little time, but e neva take charge of senior professional football match bifor.

McFarle dey for first season as Chelsea academy coach, afta e join from Southampton for summer, and e don lead di under-21 team to fourth position for di Premier League 2 afta nine matches.

McFarlane join Chelsea afta two years in charge of Southampton Under-21s.

E cross paths withChelsea academy technical director Glenn van de Kraan wey dey appointed from Man City for 2024.

McFarlane get impressive start for Chelsea, as e guide im side to first place for di league phase of di Uefa Youth League wit wins ova Barcelona, Benfica, Bayern Munich and Ajax.

Afta di game on Sunday, e possible make Chelsea don get new coach, but who be di contenders?

Enzo Maresca bin comot from im role as Chelsea manager as di club dey fifth for di English Premier League table.

Di 45-year old Italian pack im property leave Stamford Bridge just less dan six months afta ewin di Club World Cupfor di end of im first season in charge.

Chelsea management tok for dia statement on Thursday say: "Enzo and di club believe say change go give di team di best chance of getting di season back on track."

Di Blues don win only one of dia last seven league matches and take only six points from six games for December as dem fall 15 points behind leaders Arsenal.

But match results na only small part of di tori.

Maresca, wey im contract suppose last till 2029, bin totori di ogas dem for Stamford Bridge - including sporting directors Paul Winstanley and Laurence Stewart, and dia co-owner Behdad Eghbali - as e carry Chelsea to finish for top-four last season and also win di Uefa Conference League and Club World Cup.

Howeva, success turn to sourness for im relationship wit di hierarchy.

Afta winning 2-0 against Everton 2-0 for dia single win for di Premier League for December, Maresca shock many pipo wen e tok say "many pipo" don make am di "worst 48 hours" since e join di club.

Dose comments bin come witout any warning to club staff or senior management, who for prefer make di mata remain private.

But wahala don dey shele for months bifor dat.

Maresca bi get hope say e go fit raise im profile afta di Blues successes tru opportunities outside di club. E bin plan to publish book bifor dem block am, and e speak for di Il Festival dello Sport - one event for Italy organised by La Gazzetta dello Sport newspaper - witout di club permission.

E also make public say e disagree wit di club as dem no sign central defender afta Levi Colwill bin injure im anterior cruciate ligament for pre-season. Di club hierarchy explain say if dem do dat, e fit make dia academy prospect Josh Acheampong to request for transfer, and Maresca later back down.

Di former Leicester manager has bin also change agents - from di Wasserman agency to Jorge Mendes - and im name bin don come up as potential successor to Pep Guardiola for Manchester City, which Maresca bin dismiss.

Also, e don dey avoided wearing club tracksuits - instead choosing to wear im own clothing.

Afta im last game wit Chelsea - di 2-2 draw wit Bournemouth for 30 December - assistant manager Willy Caballero said Maresca bin no feel well to do im post-match media duties, but tori be say im absence na more due to say e don dey tire wit di club.

And e dey even more noticeable wen Chelsea bin post one 52-second video for social media for New Year Eve to summarise dia year, Maresca bin no dey di video.

Di Italian believe say di pressure for im dey unfair sake of wetin e feel say na difficult working conditions, and say di management bin cross line in terms of attempts to influence im team selection.

Although e tok say e no dey vex say e dey manage young squad, e feel say di supporters expectations suppose dey managed regarding wetin dey achievable - especially sake of injuries to Colwill and attacker Cole Palmer.

Chelsea bin plan to assess Maresca position for di end of di season if results improve, but Maresca no longer dey happy and dat na di main factor as dem agree to go dia separate ways.

Di Blues next match na against second-placed Manchester City on Sunday - starting a difficult month wey also includes matches against Arsenal and Napoli.
title: Who dey incharge of Chelsea afta Enzo Maresca comot

raw_text:
Di State High Court wey dey sit for Oyigbo Division for Port Harcourt, Rivers State, no grant perpetual injunction wey seek to restrain di Chief Judge of di state, Justice Chibuzor Simeon Amadi, from acting on di impeachment request by di Rivers lawmakers against Govnor Siminalayi Fubara and im deputy, Professor Ngozi Ordu.

Presiding judge Justice Florence A Fiberesima rule say di court no fit issue di requested order as di mata already dey bifor di Court of Appeal.

Di judge kon adjourn di case indefinitely, pending di determination of di appeal.

On Friday 16 January, di court bin issue interim injunction wey restrain di Chief Judge from receiving or attending to any such request for seven days pending di case wey dey bifor di court, but di Assembly go on appeal in di mata.

Remember say Chief Judge of Rivers State, Justice Simeon Amadi, bin don tell di House of Assembly say e no go fit set up di investigative panel wey dem bin request from am to investigate Govnor Siminalayi Fubara and im Deputy, Professor Ngozi Nma Odu.

Di Chief Judge Justice Simeon Amadi for letter e write to speaker of di Assembly acknowledge say e receive di Rivers Assembly resolution to set up a seven-man impeachment panel against Fubara and im Deputy but tok say e no fit do anytin becos of asubsisting High Court order wey stop amfrom taking any further action.

For inside di four-page letter wey e send to di Speaker, Martin Amaewhule, on January 20, 2026, di Chief Judge tok say di court orders and many legal cases wey still dey ground don tie im hand, so e no go fit set up di panel.

Justice Amadi explain say di Govnor and im Deputy bin carry di mata go court and dem don already get some interim injunctions since January 16, 2026, wey warn di CJ make e no receive or even look any paperwey concern dia impeachment.

E say as di oga patapata for di judiciary side of govment for Rivers, im must respect wetin di law tok and obey court orders, weda pipo like di order or not.

Beyond di subsisting injunctions, Justice Amadi note say di House of Assembly sef don file appeal against di interim orders for di Court of Appeal.

E kon invoke di legal doctrine of ‘lis pendens’ and  stress say once mata dey bifor a higher court, all parties dey bound to maintain di status quo pending di determination of di mata.

Emphasising di supremacy of di rule of law, di Chief Judge say all pesins and authorities dey obligated to obey valid court orders until dem dey set aside.

E reinforce dis position by citing one judicial precedent wey include Honourable Dele Abiodun v. The Honourable Chief Judge of Kwara State & Ors (2007), wia one Chief Judge bin dey faulted for proceeding wit di constitution of one investigative panel in spite of a restraining court order.

E say im "hands dey legally fettered" and so e currently dey unable to exercise im constitutional duty under Section 188(5) of di Constitution.

Remember say on Friday 16 January, 2026, Speaker of di Rivers State House write to di Chief Judge of Rivers State to set up a seven-man investigative panel wey go investigate allegations of gross misconduct against Govnor Fubara and im Deputy.

Dat same day, di Govnor approach one High Court wey give an interim order of injunction against di Speaker of di House of Assembly and 32 odas including di clerk of di House and di Chief Judge of Rivers State.
title: Court adjourn indefinitely suit wey challenge impeachment of Govnor Fubara, Deputy

raw_text:
Ghana authorities confam say dem go issue popular American streamer IshowSpeed wit Ghanaian passport.

Dis announcement by di foreign affairs ministry happun hours afta di streamer (real name Darren Jason Watkins Junior) finish im Africa tour wen evisit 20 kontris.

IShowSpeed end di tour for Namibia afta e stream for Ghana for five hours on Monday 26 January 2026.

During di Ghana stream, e tok say e go return to buy house and oda property for di kontri.

"I go miss Africa afta dis tour, but I go buy house for Ghana. E go be good asset say you go buy house for here," IShowSpeed tok during di stream afta e spend some time for di Asenema waterfall for di Eastern region of di kontri.

Many pipo say di five-hour stream open dia eyes to di culture, tourism, hospitality, art and di pipo.

Di 21-year-old streamer tok say e get family wey be from Ghana, so e dey happy to "return home" for dis visit.

"I get family wey be Ghanaian. My mama side get Ghana roots, my mama be Ghanaian so I dey happy to stream for dis kontri.

End of Di one wey oda users dey read well well

Foreign affairs minister Samuel Okudzeto Ablakwa write for social media say "following discussions and confirmation of di fact say IShowSpeed get convincing ties to Ghana, I dey happy to announce say di ministry approve say make we issue Ghana passport give am."

Di minister also celebrate anoda Ghanaian Youtuber and travel blogger Wodemaya – wey be part of di team wey carry IShowSpeed move around some of di cultural and tourism places of di kontri during di stream.

"Make you (IShowSpeed and Wodemaya) continue to make Ghana and Africa proud."

Di foreign minister add say "Ghana dey celebrate di two of you - you be our ambassadors, dat be why we grant you (Wodemaya), diplomatic passport last year."

If authorities give pesin Ghana passport, e mean say di pesin be registered citizen of Ghana, wey dey recognised by govment either by birth, naturalisation, registration or adoption.

Di passport be di basic legal document for international travel and identification.

Ghana citizen wey dey hold valid passport no dey need visa to enta di kontri from anywia around di world.

Di pesin also no go need visa to travel from di kontri to at least 66 kontris.

Wit di confirmation say IShowSpeed get roots for Ghana, di passport mean say e fit get access to di kontri at any time.

Many pipo dey tok about di experience wey IShowSpeed get for Ghana during im visit.

In fact, di streamer imsef tok say e enjoy di time for di kontri.

During di stream, di chiefs and elders of Akuapen Akropong for di Eastern region give am Ghanaian name.

Di chief of di area, Oseadeeyo Kwasi Akuffo III for di naming ceremony, give IShowSpeed di name Barima Kofi Akuffo – e name am afta im grandpapa.

Dem also decorate am wit gold jewellery and di rich kente cloth from Ghana wey be di symbol of royalty.

Di streamer engage for di cultural drumming, dancing and activities bifor e use helicopter fly to di city for Accra to experience di energy and vibes.

Afta di activities for di kontri independence square wia e chop Ghana jollof (e tok say di Ghana jollof and di Nigeria one be di same but e go choose di Nigeria one).

E also visit di memorial park of Ghana first president Dr Kwame Nkrumah wia dem tell am di history of di man and im role for di independence of Ghana.

IShowSpeed take fotos under di iconic statue of Dr Nkrumah for di memorial park.

Later e visit di rich Jamestown community wey produce 10 boxing champions for Ghana, wey e participate for one boxing match wit local boxers wey e jam wit di locals.

Di climax of di stream for Ghana carry am go di shea butter museum wey former beauty queen Hamamat Montia dey operate for Accra.

Ova dia, dem show di streamer wetin shea butter be, how dem dey make am and wetin dem fit use am for.

Hamamat tok am say "dis shea butter from Ghana be cosmetic wey e also be medicine. We dey mix some of di shea butter wit herbs wey dey sooth di body and keep di skin fresh."

"We also dey use di shea butter cook and eat some," Hamamat tok IShowSpeed, wey shock well well.

"E dey taste like butter," IShowSpeed tok afta e put some of di shea butter for mouth.

About 12 ladies carry di shea butter massage am well well, for several minutes bifor e finish di stream.

Even for some Ghanaians, dem say dem neva know say somtin like shea butter museum dey for Accra.

Di Ghana tourism authority CEO say "IShowSpeed im visit to Ghana show di power of culture and digital influence in real time."

Maame Efua Houadjeto add say, "Dis be di new face of tourism wey be authentic, youth-driven and global; Ghana dey ready."

IShowSpeed end dis tour for Namibia on 27 January 2026.

Di end of di one-month tour of di kontris for Africa.

Speed say e decide to stream dis Africa tour to "show di world wetin Africa be like."

For many years, some pipo outside Africa dey see di continent say e be place of poverty and bad pipo.

But di 21-year-old say e wan change dat narrative dat be why e carry im team and equipment to begin di tour of 20 kontris.

E visit Nigeria, Kenya, Liberia, Botswana, Eswatini, Egypt, Ethiopia Senegal, among odas.

Oda places e visit be Ivory Coast, Benin, Zambia, Zimbabwe, Algeria, Angola, and Mozambique.

E also visit South Africa and Rwanda and Morocco during di just-ended Afcon

Bifor e end di stream for di final kontri (Namibia), IShowSpeed wey become emotional tok say "dis tour be amazing all ova. I make happy say I do dis tour".

"I make happy say I come experience Africa for mysef - dis tour go change my life for di beta."

IShowSpeed also add say "dis tour open my eyes wey e spark somtin deep inside me. Dis be comeback to di motherland, to stream 20 kontris in 28 days be miraculous."

"I tank evribodi wey watch di tour wit me, I meet many pipo and evri kontri show me love. I feel di love evriwia."

Di streamer announce day e go return to Africa for anoda round of di tour - dis time e go set up fundraiser wey go support organisations and groups for di kontris e go visit.

Bifor di camera off, IShowSpeed confam say "I be 100% African".
title: Why authorities issue popular streamer IshowSpeed wit Ghanaian passport afta 20-nation Africa tour

raw_text:
Ajit Pawar, deputy chief minister of India western state of Maharashtra, don die for plane crash along wit four oda pipo.

Di cause of di crash neva dey officially confirmed.

Pawar political career span decades and e serve as di deputy chief minister of Maharashtra several times.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi dey among dose wey don express shock and grief at di news of di crash.

Police say dem don take bodies of pipo wey die for di plane crash to di hospital.

"One expert team dey present for di crash site," Superintendent of Police Sandip Singh Gill tell reporters. "We go provide update afta di bodies don dey identified."

One eyewitness wey no wan tok her name tell ANI news agency say di plane wey carry Pawar and four oda pipo crash just bifor e reach di runway for Baramati airport.

She tok say afta rescue pipo quench di fire, local pipo see one burnt bodi inside di plane wey don scata.

She add say police later ask di locals make dem bring blanket take cova di bodi.

Till now, pipo still dey wait for official statement on wetin cause di crash.

Pipo dey pour tributes for Ajit Pawar from different political sides for India.

"E no possible to put into words how Ajit Pawar dedicate imsef for more dan three and a half decades to di welfare of evribodi for Maharashtra," Home Minister Amit Shah write for X.

Opposition Congress party leader Rahul Gandhi describe Pawar death as "veri heartbreaking".

Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis say e get "no words to express my emotions".

"I don lose my strong and generous friend," e post for X.

Sanjay Raut, one top politician from di state opposition Shiv Sena (UBT) party, call Pawar di "backbone" of di state and say im death na "black day" for di political and social life of di state.

"Witout Dada [meaning elder brother for Marathi language], di political scene of Maharashtra no complete. E get open heart and evri party worker admire am," e tok.

Pawar and four oda pipo die for plane crash for Baramati earlier today. Pawar dey travel from Mumbai to Baramati to hold meetings ahead of coming local govment elections for di city.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi write for X say e dey "sad" about di news of di crash.

"My thoughts dey wit all di pipo wey lose dia loved ones for di crash. I dey pray for strength and courage for di families wey dey mourn for dis time of deep pain," e write. For anoda post, e also pay tribute to Pawar.

Pawar home state Maharashtra don declare three days of official mourning following di tragic death for plane crash earlier today.

During dis period, flags across di state go fly at half‑mast and govment offices and schools go remain shut. Officials say all public events don dey cancelled as mark of respect.

Di mourning period reflect di state recognition of im long service and influence for di state politics.

Pawar, wey be nephew of ogbonge politician Sharad Pawar wey establish di Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), na influential politician for Maharashtra.

Im political career last many years and e don serve as deputy chief minister of Maharashtra several times.

Few years ago, e break away from im uncle party wit some lawmakers and form im own party, wey India Election Commission later officially recognise as NCP.
title: Ogbonge Indian politician Ajit Pawar die for plane crash

raw_text:
Di Nigerian Police don confirm di report of mass kidnap of worshippers for Kajuru Local Govment Area of Kaduna state.

For statement wey police tok-tok person CSP Benjamin Hundeyin release on Tuesday, e say Kaduna State Security Council meet afta dem receive di report.

"Nigeria Police Force don acknowledge di worry wey pipo get over reports of abduction for Kurmin Wali, one remote community for Kajuru Local Govment Area of Kaduna State," di statement tok

According to di statement, during di meeting wey hold for Govment House, Kaduna, some pipo from di affected local govment area argue say di report wey police earlier tok say no be true.

Police say "di disagreement create confusion and show say dem need to dey careful and verify well bifor making final public statement on such sensitive matter."

Police explain say comment wey Commissioner of Police for Kaduna State Command talk during media interaction na to avoid panic while dem dey still confirm facts.

"Di remarks wey pipo don misinterpret no be denial of di incident, but na careful response while dem dey wait to confirm details from di field, including di identity and number of people wey affect," di statement tok.

Police add say later verification from operational units and intelligence sources confirm say di incident truly happun.

Dem say coordinated security operation don start, as police dey work with oda security agencies to find and safely rescue di victims and restore calm for di area.

Tori wey come out on Monday claim say over 100 pipo bin kidnap by bandits during church service for Kurmin Wali village for Kajuru on Sunday.

One community leader wey escape and also see di attack wit him own eye tok say di gunmen strike during Sunday evening church service, and worshippers no get any chance to run.

"Pipo try run, but dem warn us say if anybodi run, dem go shoot am. Dem don already surround di area," im tell BBC News.

Im say di attackers force worshippers make dem lie down for ground bifor dem begin push plenty of dem enter nearby bush.

"Dem force evri bodi sit down and lie for ground bifor dem push pilo enter bush," im tok.

According to am, at least 177 pipo dem first carry go, though some later manage escape including him.

"Dem first take 177 pipo. Later some return, and 168 still dey with dem. Even me sef I escape afta I hide for one room." im tok.

E add say di bandits thief money and anytin wey get value for di community.

As im dey describe wetin dey happun for di village afta di attack, im say families don dey overwhelmed wit fear and sorrow.

"Pipo dey in fear and dem dey look for dia relatives wey bandits carry" im tok.

One senior church leader even tok say more dan 160 worshippers dem abduct during Sunday service.

Dis na di latest mass kidnap for Nigeria, wia both Christians and Muslims don dey targeted.

Di gangs, wey pipo dey call "bandits" for local area, dey regularly carry out dis kain attacks for northern and central parts of di kontri, mostly to collect ransom.

As dem describe di attack for Sunday, local security tok say gunmen wey carry "sophisticated weapons" burst enter two churches for Kurmin Wali, one forest community for Afogo ward, around 11:25 local time.

"Di attackers come plenty and block di entrance of di churches, force di worshippers comot and carry dem enter bush," Rev Joseph Hayab, chairman of Christian Association of Nigeria (CAN) for northern Nigeria, tell AFP news agency on Monday.

Wen e dey tok to Reuters, Hayab add say: "Information wey reach me from di church elders be say 172 worshippers dem kidnap, while nine pipo manage escape."

Meanwhile, Amnesty International don call on Nigerian authorities to ensure say all di 166 pipo wey dem abduct from three churches for Kurmin Wali village, Kajuru Local Govment Area of Kaduna State, return safely to dia families.

Di organisation condemn wetin e describe as denial of di incident by police and Kaduna State govment.

Di human rights organisation say "di abducted pipo include minors and pregnant women, for di incident wey happun during church service on Sunday, 18 January 2026."

According to di group, residents of di village and families of di abducted pipo tell Amnesty International say gunmen enter di village and move from one church to another, forcefully carrying worshippers from all three churches.

Amnesty International say di incident don again show failure of authorities to stop killings and abductions for some parts of northern Nigeria.
title: Wetin don happun since police confam kidnap of over 100 Church goers for Kaduna
