raw_text:
One US judge for di Annadale immigration court for Virginia adjourn hearing of di immigration case against ex-Ghana finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta, who dey face corrupting charges back home.

Di judge David Gardey move di hearing to 27 April.

Dis be in connection wit immigration wahala afta US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) arrest and detain di ex-finance minister for Virginia since 6 January 2025, sake of e overstay im visa.

Tori be say US authorities revoke di ex-minister visa for November 2025 wey he refuse to comot di kontri.

During di first appearance bifor di court on 20 January, lawyers for di ex-finance minister ask di court for private hearing.

By dis time many pipo join di virtual hearing sake of Ghanaians dey interested in di mata.

Two cases dey bifor di court – one of dem be bond application; wey mean say lawyers for di minister apply for di release of dia client from ICE custody wey di oda one be di immigration case proper.

Dis be di first time since January 2025 wey di ex-minister dey appear for public afta e comot Ghana to di US for "medical attention."

Di ex-Ghana minster appear for di Caroline detention centre as e dey wear one grey jacket, wey he wear black detention coverall.

He also dey wear blue face mask - di common one wey pipo wear during di covid 19 pandemic.

As e waka enter di isolated room, e comot di jacket, leaving im dark detention outfit.

E carry di jacket hang for chair behind a table for di centre of di empty room, wey e sidon.

Di minister also wear one armband for his wrist.

Few minutes later, Ken Ofori-Atta comot di chair wey e comot di lonely detention room briefly, bifor e return when di judge call im case.

As e return, e move im glasses wey e hang am on top his head wey e sidon for di chair dey face di camera.

As di judge call di case, lawyers for di minister, Christopher Chaisson and Kwao Amagashie tok say dem wan make di judge hear di case for private.

Judge David Gardey:Dis be di bond determination hearing for di mata wey involve Kenneth Ofori-Atta. Dem detain am for di Caroline detention centre wey he dey appear by Webex (virtual conference). Make di lawyers wey dey represent am enta dia appearance.

Lawyers:I be Christopher Chaisson, I dey on behalf of Enayat Qasimi and Kwao Amagashie on behalf of di respondent.

Judge David Gardey:Sake of di nature of di issues wey we discuss for di bond hearing, you pipo want di bond hearing to be private, as in make e dey closed to di public?

Christopher Chaisson:Yes, your honour. I make happy say you raise dis mata serf. I wan raise am bifor.

Judge David Gardey:Okay. I hear am.

Christopher Chaisson:For di record, your honour. Di oda issue also dey - di master calendar hearing.  Wit di way di mata dey, some of di issues we go raise for di hearing be sensitive.

Judge David Gardey:You dey ask say di master calendar hearing also go dey private; closed to di public?

Christopher Chaisson:Yes. We wan clarify sometin small. We go like say make di two hearings all dey closed to di public.

However, for di bond hearing case, we go ask di court say make dem try anytin dem fit do for dia power, to finish di case [today]. I go wait for di court decision.

Judge David Gardey:I understand. So all di pipo wey join us for di Webex (online video conference), we go hear di mata in private under di US immigration law. Di law say if any party for di immigration case say make di hearing dey private and closed to di public, under di circumstances, di court go close di hearing.

If anyone dey for di Webex (online video platform) wey dey here to view dis hearing; either di bond hearing or di master calendar hearing, make everyone comot now sake of we neva go continue if pipo still dey on di online link. Only di parties for di case dey allowed to be present during di hearing.

Dat be how dem comot hundreds of Ghanaians wey join di virtual link to follow di proceedings for di hearing to continue.

Afta dem arrest Ken Ofori-Atta for di US, his Ghana lawyers tok say "Oga Ofori-Atta get pending petition for adjustment of status wey go allow pesin to stay for di US legally past di period of validity of dia visa," di statement by Justice Kusi-Minkah Premo explain.

"Oga Ken Ofori-Atta be law-abiding pesin wey he dey fully cooperate wit ICE to deal wit dis mata," di statement from his lawyers add.

Now as di Annadale immigration court judge adjourn di case to 27 April, di ex-finance minister go likely remain in detention until di next hearing (for three months).

Sabi pipo explain say if di ex-minister lawyers succeed wit di bond application, den dia client go dey out of di ICE custody wey he go dey attend di substantive immigration hearing.

If dem no succeed or di judge no gree wit dia argument, di detainee go dey inside ICE custody until dia deportation case dey finalized.

Di judge gat di discretion to determine weda pesin be flight risk or di pesin be danger for di community

If pesin dey inside custody during di hearing, di case go fit move fast fast.

For all dis, di detainee get option to appeal if di judge deny dem di bond.

Dem fit appeal to di board of immigration appeals (BIA); but dis process neva dey easy.

Attorney general for Ghana Dr Dominic Ayine, file extradition request to US authorities for di ex-finance minister.

Dem wan make US authorities carry di minister and his chief of staff wen e be minister, to Ghana make dem face accountability for di time as minister for seven years from 2017 to 2024.

"At dis point, na di US authorities especially di judicial authorities wey go determine whether sufficient evidence dey wey go demand say make di two accused pipo, dey extradited to Ghana to stand trial," id attorney general explain.

Di kontris special prosecutor's office already slap di ex-minister and odas wit 78 counts of corruption and related offenses.

According to di special prosecutor Kissi Agyebeng, di ex-minister and oda accused pipo allegedly conspire to set up "criminal enterprise wey directly and indirectly influence di kontri procurement process to win contracts for di company (SML)."

"Di SML company carry unfair advantage to get transaction audit services, external price verification services, measurement audit for downstream petroleum products and odas form di Ghana govment through di finance ministry and di Ghana revenue authority."

Kissi Agyebeng di special prosecutor tok say "dem begin di criminal enterprise for 2017 by di ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta, Emmanuel Kofi Nti (ex-GRA commissioner) and Evans Adusei togeda wit di SML company itself."

Di prosecutor say dem neva ensure value for money for di contracts dem carry give di SML company wey dem cause financial loss of Ghc 1.4bn ($128m).

Dis be some of di reasons why di kontri dey pursue di ex-minister; oda investigative agencies also dey find di minister to help dem investigate oda cases wey im allegedly dey involved.

Ken Ofori-Atta comot Ghana after his govment lose di 2024 elections wey he say he dey go for medical check-up and surgery – since dat time, he neva return.

Many pipo and political watches say di ex-minister dey run away from accountability and trial - but his lawyers say di minister gat nothing to hide.

Di govment thru di Attorney general and odas say dem go work to ensure say US authorities extradite di ex-minister to Ghana to face di law.

But dem also say dem go welcome any move wey go make di minister return to Ghana faster than di extradition – if ICE fit deport am, dem go happy say he go at least return to Ghana and face accountability like anybody else.

Pipo wey dey close to di ex-minister say tins no go be easy sake of di Ken Ofori-Atta apart from di US visa, also get Canada and UK visa, wia he fit go, but time no tell.

For now di ex-minster dey remain for custody for di Caroline Detention centre for Virginia, until sometin happun.

At di time di immigration hearing dey happun, one pressure group for Ghana and oda Ghanaians gada for di US embassy for Accra to protest.

Dem carry placards wey dem wear red shirts and armbands wey dem demand say make di embassy authorities work to bring di ex-finance minister back to di kontri to face trial.
title: Ex-Ghana finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta go remain for ICE custody for US

raw_text:
Di US immigration and customs enforcement (ICE) don arrest and detain ex-Ghana finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta ova im residence status for di kontri.

Di enforcement team detain di ex-minister on Tuesday for di Caroline Detention facility for Virginia.

ICE put for dia website say dem dey hold di former Ghana minister for custody.

E neva dey clear if im detention dey connected to di Ghana govment extradition process for di ex-minister wey dey face 78 corruption and related charges, but tori be say dis one dey relate to immigration wahala.

Lawyers for di ex-finance minister for Ghana inside dia statement say "his US legal team dey in contact wit ICE wey dem expect to address di mata quick quick."

"Oga Ofori-Atta get pending petition for adjustment of status wey go allow pesin to stay for di US legally past di period of validity of dia visa," di statement wey Justice Kusi-Minkah Premo don sign explain.

Dem add say "under US law, dis kain arrangement wey dey allow pipo to petition for adjustment dey common."

"Oga Ken Ofori-Atta be law-abiding pesin wey he dey fully cooperate wit ICE to deal wit dis mata," di statement from his lawyers add.

According to di ICE website, adjustment of status be di process when pesin go apply to become lawful, permanent resident for di US.

Dis mean say di ex-finance minister don apply for permanent residency status for di US at a time when authorities for Ghana dey pursue am to face prosecution for di kontri.

But e get few ways wey dis adjustment of status dey work.

For pipo wey dey face removal proceedings, most of dem dey apply through family members; dis fit hapun if your family member wey apply na US citizen or also be lawful permanent resident, wey di visa dey available to you.

ICE say most pipo dey apply for adjustment of status through di US citizenship and immigration services (USCIS) – di federal agency wey dey process immigration applications.

But if ICE don put you for deportation proceedings, you gatz to apply for adjustment of status for immigration court bifor a judge.

ICE add say adjustment of status cases fit dey complicated, especially when pesin dey detained.

Even though e neva dey clear at dis point if di arrest and detention of Ken Ofori-Atta dey in connection wit di extradition request by Ghana govment, sabi pipo say di charges against di minister no fit dey overlooked for dis mata.

On 18 December, Ghana attorney general and minister for Justice, Dr Dominic Ayine confam say im office don formally send extradition request for di ex-finance minister and im alleged accomplice – one Ernest Akore (Ken chief of staff when im dey office as finance minister), to di US.

Im confam say dem begin di process on 19 November 2025 when dem submit di request for commencement of extradition proceedings against di two pipo.

Dr Ayine add during dat press conference say dem submit di request to di department of justice for America wey he add say di decision now dey for di hands of American authorities.

"At dis point, na di US authorities especially di judicial authorities wey go determine whether sufficient evidence dey wey go demand say make di two accused pipo – di ex-finance minister and im chief of staff, dey extradited to Ghana to stand trial."

According to di special prosecutorKissi Agyebeng, di ex-minister and oda accused pipo conspire to set up "criminal enterprise wey directly and indirectly influence di kontri procurement process to win contracts for di company (SML)."

"Di SML company carry unfair advantage to get transaction audit services, external price verification services, measurement audit for downstream petroleum products and odas form di Ghana govment through di finance ministry and di Ghana revenue authority."

Kissi Agyebeng di special prosecutor tok say "dem begin di criminal enterprise for 2017 by di ex-finance minister Ken Ofori-Atta, Emmanuel Kofi Nti (ex-GRA commissioner) and Evans Adusei togeda wit di SML company itself."

Di prosecutor say dem neva ensure value for money for di contracts dem carry give di SML company wey dem cause financial loss of Ghc 1.4bn ($128m).

Ghana president John Mahama afta he order investigation for dis mata, direct di finance ministry to cancel dis contract wit SML on 31 October 2025.

According to di prosecutor, if di president no cancel di contract at di time e do am, directors of di company tok say make di kontri pay dem Ghc $2.8bn for five years without parliamentary approval.

Sake of dis tins, dem charge di suspects wit 78 counts.

Lawyers for di underfire ex-minister bin say dia client dey di US dey seek medical attention wey he go make available to face accountability if he make fit.

Dem maintain say di minister no do anytin wrong during im time in office.

But di prosecutor office no gree to dis excuse as dem accuse di ex-minister say im dey run away from justice in respect of his tenure as finance minister for di kontri for seven years.
title: US Immigration arrest and detain ex-Ghana finance minister wey dey face corruption charges

raw_text:
Fela Anikulapo Kuti don enta di news again almost 30 years afta e kpai and e no even be time for Felabration.

Ova di years, many Nigerian stars wey comot di kontri don get comparisons to di Afrobeat musician afta im passing.

As music inheritance, Fela music don dey sampled ova di years by many musicians worldwide most notably, Kendrick Lamar wit Mortal Man, Tiwa Savage 49-99 and Wizkid Jaiye Jaiye.

At di end of 2025, dem bin host art exhibition for Nigeria wey bin dey about im life and music wey dem call Afrobeat rebellion.

So, wetin be some of di facts wey you fit no know about im life even though dem don dey loud im tori for ova 50 years

E comot for im exhibition say apart from using im music to call out di govment, Fela Kuti bin dey buy space for newspapers at di time to dey hala to di govment about wetin e see say dem do wrong.

Di section im bin dey write for dis newspapers for di 1970s bin dey written in pidgin and always start wit "Chief Priest Says".

Di content include yabbing govment for wetin dem dey do wrong or dem go call out di corruption of multinationals or call America out for neo-colonialism. But sometimes na just to announce di next time wey e dey run im concert

For 20 February 1978, e marry 27 of di women wey gada for im side from di middle of 70s.

Di mata bin vex some pipo but Fela say e see am as say e dey go back to African tradition. Di marriage for many of di women no really last.

Fela start di Fela Shrine for 1973 as im own nightclub wia im new group Africa 70 bin dey play several times a week wit songs wey dey long reach 30 minutes.

Di altar of di Shrine bin get picture of Pan-African leaders like Kwame Nkurumah, Malcom X and im mama Funmilayo Anikulapo Kuti wit images of Yoruba gods dem.

Na for di early 70s wey Fela change im family name from Ransome wey e tok say e see as slave name to Anikulapo Kuti wey mean "di pesin wey carry death for im pocket".

No be only break in tradition for name but di first most influential Ransome-Kuti na im grandpapa, Reverend Josiah Jesse Ransome-Kuti wey be di first Nigerian wey record music ontop record plate. Fela also comot from di religion of Christianity.

For Kalakuta wey Fela call im small republic, e bin dey like to waka round di place and many pictures bin dey of am dey wear only pant.

E reveal say di reason na to show im slim bodi as e different to how pipo dey see how success suppose be for pesin bodi for Nigeria. E also show all di scars of di bulala im don chop becos of im resistance to police violence.

However, e still keep di tradition of activism alive wey im mama bin get.

Fela Anikulapo Kuti bin call im small community around wia im dey live say na Kalakuta. E bin dey named afta one of di prisons wey Fela bin stay inside.

Kalakuta Republic be like small state wey get im own clinic and bin house plenti homeless pipo including pipo wey bin dey ginger on top political tok-tok

"Fela die of one beating wey too many. Im body dey covered in scars and im mind and spirit gatz cope wit 200 arrests. Di system fit only take so much,"Rikki Stein tell di BBC for interviewto mark di publication of im memoir – in part about di 15 years of managing one of Nigeria most influential musicians.

One of di times wey dem gbab am na for 4 September 1984 wey dem arrest am as e dey plan to climb plane for for international tour.

Dem gbab am say e dey do currency trafficking sake of £1600 wey dey im bag wey im no declare - and dem sentence am to five years for prison.

According to Afrobeat Rebellion, pipo hala sotay just 532 days afta dem lock am up, for 23 April 1986 dem free am afta di judge wey sentence am say na govment bin pressure am.

Stein believe say dis no be about di moni. Di military see am as stubborn pesin for dia side and dem wan silence am.

But e get di opposite effect. Im arrest bin cause public anger for di world, Amnesty International bin declare am prisoner of conscience and im music become more widely known and radio stations dey play im work for di day.
title: Seven facts to sabi about Fela Anikulapo Kuti

Turkey don announce new economic, trade and defence cooperation agreements wit Nigeria.

Dis dey come afta one state visit by Nigeria President Bola Tinubu to di Republic of Turkey.

For one joint press conference wit President Tinubu on Tuesday, 27 January, Turkey President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan tok say both kontris don agree to pursue a five-billion-dollar trade volume target.

Dis na some of di key highlights of President Tinubu visit to Turkey.

Turkish President Recep Erdogan give assurance say im kontri go support Nigeria fight against terrorism.

For di joint press conference, e express readiness to deepen cooperation in military training and intelligence.

"We stand wit di friendly pipo of Nigeria for dia fight against terrorism. We don evaluate opportunities for close cooperation, especially concerning military training and intelligence," di Turkish president tok.

E add say Turkey ready to share significant experience in dia fight against terrorism wit Nigeria govment.

Di Turkish president tok say terrorist groups, particularly in Africa Sahel region, pose a threat to di continent stability.

Nigerian officials also hold meetings wit Turkey leading defende industry firms during di visit and express confidence say di outcomes of dose toks go dey positive.

President Tinubu say di military assistance go extend beyond Nigeria to di wider region, wey dey face different security challenges.

Nigeria dey face multiple security crises, wey include attacks by jihadist groups, mass abductions and kidnappings for ransom by armed gangs wey pipo sabi well-well as bandits, plus violence wey dey linked to criminal gangs and separatist groups.

Dis article contain content wey X provide. We ask for una permission before anytin dey loaded, as dem fit dey use cookies and oda technologies. You fit wan read di Xcookie policyandprivacy policybefore accepting. To view dis content choose 'accept and continue'.

During di press conference, President Recep Tayyip Erdogan also announce new economic and trade agreements wit Nigeria.

E say im kontri dey target $5 billion trade volume wit Nigeria and add say discussions to make dis possible don already start.

"We see say we harbour important potential for di areas of trade and investments. During our meetings today, we reaffirm our commitment to di five-billion-dollar trade volume target and discuss di steps we go take," e tok.

However, e neva dey clear yet wetin di full framework of di trade target go involve or di timeline to achieve am.

At present, di trade volume between di two nations dey about $2 billion. Turkey dey export planes, helicopters, machinery, iron and steel, and chemical products to Nigeria. While Nigeria dey export crude oil and agricultural products to Turkey, tok-tok pesin to President Tinubu, Bayo Onanuga, tok for statement.

President Erdogan say di establishment of di Joint Economy and Trade Committee between di two kontris go create opportunities to expand Turkish investments in Nigeria to realise di target.

On education, di Turkish leader say wit di initiation of di Maarif Foundation activities in Nigeria, dem go fit provide additional contributions for Nigeria young population.

"Wit di agreement on cooperation in education we sign today, we go further strengthen di contractual basis of our cooperation," President Erdoğan add.

Nigeria President Bola Tinubu dey "in great shape" afta e fall for one reception ceremony for Turkey, one of im aides tok.

73-year-old Tinubu, bin dey welcomed by im Turkish counterpart for one official ceremony for di capital, Ankara, wen e stumble.

Afta e waka past one line of sojas and dignitaries, pipo fit see Tinubu on di  official video of di Turkish president X account as e dey move to di right wen e stumble and fall.

Di video briefly show as pipo gada help di president bifor e cut to aerial shot and 45 seconds later Tinubu and Erdogan dey seen next to each oda.

Tinubu appear unhurt and one of im aides Sunday Dare, tok say e dey able to continue wit di bilateral meeting.

Video clips of di incident don spread on social media.

One tok-tok pesin for di president, Bayo Onanuga, later say Tinubu bin step on one metal object "for ground, wey make am lose im balance".

"Dis no be big deal, except for dose wey wan make trouble out of small incident. Na just stumble, tank God, no be fall," e add.

Di last time wey di president fall for public, bin happun for June 2024, e bin use am as joke, say na dance im bin dey dance.

For dat time, one of im aides bin describe di incident as a "mild misstep," and plenty pipo express sympathy for Tinubu, including from leading opposition politician Atiku Abubakar, wey call am "unfortunate incident".

Nigeria President Bola Tinubu tok say at di end of di bilateral meeting, di two kontris sign nine agreements across defence, education, media, diaspora policy, trade, social development, and institutional cooperation between dia foreign ministries.

Nigeria and Turkey don maintain close diplomatic ties ova di years.

President Erdoğan bin visit Nigeria for 2021.

Both kontris na members of di Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) and di D-8, one development cooperation group wey also include Bangladesh, Egypt, Indonesia, Iran, Malaysia and Pakistan.

Turkey don expand dia presence across Africa in recent years, strengthening dia influence through military cooperation, drone technology, education, humanitarian projects and cultural engagement. Dem don position diasef as alternative partner to Western powers on di continent.
title: Turkey to train Nigeria Special Forces against Boko Haram and oda highlights of President Tinubu visit to di kontri

Di US govment don tok say Nigeria must to do more to stop di violence against Christians for di kontri, following di tori of di kidnap of more dan 170 pipo from three churches for Kaduna State.

Di Under Secretary for Political Affairs Allison Hooker tok dis one for di first meeting of di US-Nigeria Joint Working Group to address adding of Nigeria to di list of  kontri of particular concern by di Donald Trump administration.

Dat meeting bin hapun for Abuja on Thursday wit di National Security Adviser, Nuhu Ribadu in attendance plus oda top oga dem including di Inspector General of Police Kayode Egbetokun and di Minister of Information Mohammed Idris.

Hooker say di meeting na to discuss how di two kontris go fit work togeda to discourage di violence against Christian communities, investigate di attacks against dem and hold di perpetrators accountable, in oda to reduce di numba of killings, forced displacements, and abductions of Christians.

She point out say true-true di Nigeria govment don make some progress especially wit di recent release of 38 Christians wey jaguda pipo bin kidnap from dia church for Kwara State, and anoda 265 wey dem bin abduct from St. Mary's Catholic School for Niger State.

"Dis real progress na direct result of our engagement wit di Nigerian govment and our partnership" Hooker tok.

Howeva, di US envoy add say "we dey concerned about recent reports say gunmen kidnap more dan 170 Christians for Kaduna State on January 18. We want to see an end to dis type of violence", she tok, adding say di US and di Nigeria govments go work togeda "wit di goal of protecting Christians and dia right to practise dia faith freely and safely".

"We dey call for di govment to work wit di local authorities to find and secure di release of di innocent victims and to work wit NGOs to meet di victims' families' needs in di meantime."

BBC News Pidgin report on Thursday how di villagers of Kurmin Wali wia di kidnapping bin hapun for Kaduna State,accuse di authorities of cover upas police bin first deny say di kidnapping hapun.

For im response, di NSA Nuhu Ribadu say di Tinubu-administration dey committed to make sure say all citizens of Nigeria dey safe.

"Nigeria na deeply plural society, and di protection of all citizens, Christians, Muslims, and dose of oda beliefs, dey non-negotiable. We dey treat violence framed along religious lines as attack on di Nigerian state," Ribadu tok.

E also tok say di response of govment include security operations, di rule of law, humanitarian safeguards, and strategic communication, to make sure say di public go get confidence for wetin govment dey do and unity go dey strengthened.

Ribadu say e dey important to measure progress not by isolated incidents wey happen witin complex security environment, but rada to consider di overall direction of travel, di decisions taken at di highest level of govment, and di institutional capacity being built to prevent, respond to, and punish violence whereva e hapun.

Remember say US President DonaldTrump bin declare Nigeria as a kontri of particular concernfor October 2025, as e tok say dem dey kpai Christians anyhow for di kontri.

"Christianity dey face existential threat for Nigeria. Dem dey kill thousands of Christians. Radical Islamists dey responsible for dis mass slaughter," Trump tok dat time, as e threaten say im go send di US military to Nigeria if di situation continue.

But di Nigeria govment reject di accuse and say di insecurity wey di kontri dey face no be only Christians e dey affect.

Since den, Nigeria don dey send high-powered delegates to di US to tok wit di govment and assure dem say efforts dey on to stop di killings.

On Christmas Day of 2025,Trump approve airstrikesfor parts of Sokoto State, for di northwest region of Nigeria, for areas wia a group of terrorists called Lakurawa dey stay.

But di Nigeria govment say di operation na joint effort betwin di military of di two kontris.
title: 'We wan see di end of dis kain violence' - US tell Nigeria afta kidnap of over 150 Churchgoers for Kaduna

For December 2025, President Donald Trump expand US travel ban to include partial restrictions for additional countries including Nigeria.

US President Donald Trump don deploy im border oga kpatakpata, Tom Homan, to lead immigration enforcement for Minneapolis, afta federal agents bin shoot two US citizens die for di city in less dan one month.

Di White House tok say Homan, wey bin arrive for Minneapolis on Tuesday, go now be di "main point of contact on di ground" and e go meet wit city officials.

Dis dey come as Gregory Bovino, wey be di US border patrol oga and public face of di Trump administration mass deportation drive for cities across di US, dey expected to leave di city along wit some of im agents.

Pipo dey see di 64-year Homan as key Trump ally and pesin wey get plenty experience for immigration mata across both Republican and Democratic administrations.

Im na also one of di most vocal defenders of Trump immigration policy and mass deportation drive.

A native of upstate New York, Homan start im career for law enforcement as police officer bifor e join border patrol for 1984 for southern California.

Four years later, e join di Immigration and Naturalization Service as dem dey call am dat time, and e climb through di ranks ova di years.

By 2013 - during di Obama administration - e bin hold one important post as di head of di Enforcement and Removal Operations arm of Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice)

Homan bin don plan to retire for 2017, just days bifor Trump first administration start, but di incoming Chief of Staff John Kelly call am as e dey celebrate im retirement party, and dat call change im plans.

"I remember as e tell me say, I know say dis na bad timing, but di president-elect want me to stay and run [Ice]," Homan tok for one interview last year wit di Daily Caller. "Monday morning, I call [Kelly] and tell am say I wan come back."

Anoda call from current Chief of Staff Susie Wiles, again bring am out retirement for 2024 ahead of di second administration.

While di title "border tsar" na informal term and position, e refer to di executive-branch role wey dey oversee border and immigration policy across multiple agencies. E no need Senate confirmation, and na policy position wey be say na di serving president dey appoint am directly.

So far for Trump second term, Homan na vocal defender of di president deportation goals, and e don vow to target di "worst of di worst" and to challenge di notion say "dose wey dey enforce di law na di bad guys and dose wey dey break di law na di victims".

But true-true, as dem dey enforce immigration laws and attempting to focus on public safety threats, di net don also catch oda undocumented migrants wey no get any criminal background.

Homan acknowledge dis fact but e blame am on "sanctuary cities" wey no dey work wit federal immigration efforts. Officials tok say di act of being in di US illegally na crime on im own.

"We no go instruct Ice say make dem no arrest pesin unless e commit a serious crime," Homan tell tori pipo in July for di White house wia e dey appear regularly.

"Wetin be di message e go send to di whole world? Go ahead and enta di kontri," Homan add.

For September, di White House kiakia defend Homan afta dem accuse am for one bribery mata wey di justice department later drop.

White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt describe dat case - wey accuse Homan say e bin accept $50,000 from undercover agents - as effort to "entrap" ogbonge Trump ally.

Unlike Homan,Bovinodon spend almost im entire law enforcement career for border cities, as e bin first joine Border Patrol for 1996 and e don serve for plenty US domestic postings as well as overseas for Honduras and Africa.

Di North Carolina native bicom veri popular for di Trump second term, taking di lead during immigration crackdowns for Los Angeles, Chicago, New Orleans and Minneapolis.

Bovino don serve as "commander-at-large" for Border Patrol - wey be informal role outside of di organisation formal hierarchy. Border Patrol na one of several immigration-centred agencies wey dey operate under di Department of Homeland Security (DHS).

Bovino dey reportedly answer directly to di DHS head Kristi Noem. For im informal role, e dey work alongside officials like di Chief of Border Patrol, Michael Banks, and di Commissioner of Customs and Border Protection.

Bovino tactics dey controversial, especially di  aggressive "turn and burn" method wey e dey use to arrest bifor protesters fit arrive to any area.

"We go dey turn and burn to dat next target and di next and di next and di next," e tell AP of di tactic. "We no go stop."

Bovino don also get di reputation as official wey dey willing to clash wit lawmakers.

For example, Bovino don publicly quarrel wit lawmakers wey bin express concern about im operations for Minneapolis recently, from both di Democratic and Republican parties.

As Homan dey replace Bovino for Minneapolis, some political sabi pipo see am as recognition from di White House say urgent change dey needed amid growing public concern.

But for practice, dat change no go too change di administration approach to immigration enforcement.

"Homan get more years at Ice and for interior enforcement work," former DHS immigration official Lora Ries tell di BBC. "Dis no be surprise to me."

Ries, wey be di head of  border security and immigration centre for di conservative-leaning Heritage Foundation for Washington, add say as Homan don tok say im dey focus "on di worst, first", all deportable undocumented migrants go continue to dey "on di table".

For immigration activists, Homan career - wey don include strong defence of Trump family separation policy, wey bin lead to separating children from parents wey dey for di kontri illegally - also mean say dem see little practical difference between am and Bovino.

"I no sure say e mean much. Homan na career deportation advocate, and di architect of family separation," Michael Lukens tok - im be executive director of di Amica Center, organisation wey dey help immigrants wit legal access and services.

"I tink say di difference be say e dey more polished dan Bovino. E dey beta at speaking to di press, and stakeholders," e add. "E beta for wetin dem need, pesin wey go paint dia actions as somtin wey e no be."

"Dis na more about weda di White House go see dis as political issue, no be human issue," Lukens add. "But e no get any world wia Homan dey more moderate."
title: Who be Tom Homan, di border oga kpatakpata wey Trump deploy to Minneapolis?

Brooklyn Peltz Beckham come outside for di first time to tok on top di tori about wetin dey happun between am and im parents. E tok say e no wan "reconcile" wit im family.

Sir David bin dey snapped on Tuesday morning bifor e do podcast recording for di World Economic Forum for Davos, Switzerland but e neva gree to tok about di mata of wetin im first son write directly.

Sir David show for panel for Davos, Switzerland to tok about sport as business togeda wit di CEO and president of the Bank of America, Brian Moynihan.

Dis na as Sir David co-own Inter Miami CF and Salford City and also goodwill ambassador for Unicef. E tok say, "I don dey able to use my platform and following for Unicef and e don be di biggest tool to make pipo know wetin dey happun around di world as e concern pikin dem."

E add say, "I don try to do di same wit my pikin to teach dem, make dem make mistakes. Pikin dem dey allowed to make mistakes, na how dem dey take learn... but you sabi say you go need let dem make dose mistakes too."

Plenti of di younger Beckham statement focus on im relationship wit im wife, Nicola Peltz Beckham.

Nicola Peltz Beckham na American actress and also di pikin of billionaire businessman Nelson Peltz. And her husband don tok say she don dey "consistently disrespected by my family no mata how hard we don try to come togeda as one."

E accuse im parents say dem try scata dia wedding as im claim say im mama wey be fashion designer bin "cancel di making of Nicola dress for dying minute even though she bin dey veri excited to wear her design, wey force am to start to find new dress".

Tori bin comot dat time say Nicola, 31 bin no gree wear one of Lady Beckham design. She later tok The Times to clear di air say her mother-in-law find out say her atelier no go fit finish di dress on time. And na so she take quench di rumour say fight dey ground.

E also accuse Lady Beckham say she hijack im and im wife first dance, say wen dem call am come stage, "na my mama bin dey wait to dance wit me" instead of im wife and she "bin dance very inappropriately on me for evribodi front".

E tok say dem bin renew dia vows for 2025 to create new memories "wey go bring us joy and happiness, not anxiety and embarrassment".

Brooklyn Peltz Beckham also accuse im parents say dem don "continue to pressure and try bribe am to sign away rights to im name" some weeks bifor di weddig. E neva clear di rights wey e dey tok about.

E tok say e no quick gree to do am wey "affect di payday and dem neva treat me di same since dat time".

Brooklyn don also call out im family say dem value "public promotion and endorsements pass any oda tin".

E write say "Brand Beckham na im dey come first" as e add say "wetin dey determine family 'love' na by how much you post for social media".

E tok say, "I don dey controlled by my parents for most of my life. I grow up wit overwhelming anxiety. Dis na di first time for my life, since I shift from my family wey dat anxiety don disappear".

E also torchlight anoda mata wey ginger di tori say di family dey fight. Dat na as di couple no show face for di 50th birthday of Sir David for May.

Brooklyn Peltz Beckham say im and im wife bin travel go London for di birthday but dem bin dey "rejected for a week as we bin dey wait for our hotel room dey try plan quality time wit am".

Di influencer write say, "e refuse all our attempts, unless e dey for im big birthday party wit hundred guests and camera evriwia".

E tok say im papa "finally gree" meet am but under di condition say im wife no go dey, somtin wey im describe as "slap on di face". E also add say im family no gree see am even wen dem enta Los Angeles for visit.

Dat time one source bin tell BBC say di 26-year-old no greee go one party becos im younger brother, Romeo bin dey attend wit one woman wey e bin dey linked wit.

Brooklyn Peltz Beckham post accuse im mama say she don dey "bring women from im past to im life ova and ova again in ways wey bin dey clear say na to make us uncomfortable".

E say e don face "endless attacks from my parents, both privately and publicly wey bin dey sent to tori pipo based on dia orders".

E add say im younger brothers bin also dey "sent to attack me for social media bifor las-las dem block me out of nowhere for di last summer wey just pass so".

But Cruz Beckham, 20 tok different tin. In responce to one Daily Mail tori, e say dia parents "no fit eva unfollow dia pikin".

E bin write for Instagram say, "No be true, My mama and papa no go eva unfollow dia son. Make we get am right. Dem two wake up see say dem dey blocked, me sef follow for di blocking".

Di former England football captain, Sir David and di former Spice Girl, Lady Beckham get two oda boys and one girl apart from Brooklyn. Dem be Romeo, 23, Cruz, 20, and Harper Seven, 14.

"Actor. Writer. Director. And dog activist." Na wetin Nicola Peltz Beckham call hersef for her Instagram.

Even though na Beckham family gbas-gbos na im make she dey evribodi mouth now, on a normal dey she dey known for her acting career and her popular parents wey be billionaire businessman Nelson Peltz and model Claudia Heffner.

Her papa na founding member of one investment management fund for New York and bin work bifor as director of plenti global brands, one of dem na Heinz.

Her mama na successful model from di 1980s and 1990s and di couple born eight pikin for dia ova 40 years of marriage.

She bin start her acting for stage for 2005 for di Manhattan Theatre Club.

But she start to dey act for feem for 2004 as she act as Mackenzie for di Christmas feem Deck di Halls.

She bin also act for M. Night Shyamalan The Last Airbender for 2010 and for di 2013 series, Bates motel as well as Transformers: Age of Extinction (2014) and Hulu drama When the Street Lights Go On (2017).

Nicola don also show for music videos like for di song Its you by Zayn Malik and 7 Things by Miley Cyrus. She don also do modelling for brands like Genny.

She start to do director work for di 2024 feem Lola wey she bin also write and act inside. Di feem na about one girl wey dey try comot di broda from toxic family.

Di feem get mixed review as The Guardian comment say e dey "exploit hardship".

She don also tok about her privileged life say pipo don call am out say she no dey work and say she no blame dem sake of say she no show workings.

Apart from her work, Nicola dey popular on top di way wey she dey ginger her followers to adopt or foster animals wey cause Peta to give am award say she be Pawsome Adoption Advocate for 2022.

Na dat same 2022 she and Brooklyn run dia lavish wedding wey make pipo begin torchlight her.

Her husband, for interview wit Glamour torchlight say e bin meet her for Coachella but na afta one Halloween party dem start to collabo.

Nicola by hersef don dey hype up di Beckham family tay-tay.

For interview wey she do wit Brydie for 2024, she bin tok say, "family na evritin to me and I mean am wit my whole heart. I dey veri close wit my family and Beckham family and I tink no feeling beta pass to sabi say you get strong support system. Na blessing and I no go take am for granted".

Even though she still dey hail di family, tori be say she recently comot post wey hail Victoria Beckham for her 50th birthday.
title: 'My family dey disrespect my wife' - David Beckham son Peltz say im no wan settle wit im family

raw_text:
Nigerian Afrobeats star Asake don speak afta di death of 20-year-old Karen Lojore, wey die afta one crush wey hapun for di concert e headline for Nairobi, Kenya.

For one statement on Monday, Asake say, "I dey devastated by di tragic incident wey happun for di festival on 20 December.

"My heart go out to di family, friends and loved ones of Karen Lojore," e tok, as e promise to support efforts to "understand wetin really hapun".

E say music na always im "way of sharing love and joy" and "e break my heart say anyone gatz experience such loss".

Asake add say make authorities hold those wey dey responsible accountable.

Meanwhile, Kenyans dey mourn di death of di young lady.

Karen Lojore die for night of Saturday 20 December 2025 afta di crush hapun for Nyayo Stadium during di concert.

Nyayo National Stadium get 18,000 capacity and na multipurpose stadium wey dey Nairobi, Kenya capital. Di stadium dey popular sake of di different national and social events wey dey hapun for dia.

Anoda music artiste wey also bin dey di concert na Gabzy, a British-Nigerian singer wey base for London.

Family and friends of di victim don call for full investigation and justice.

Kenya police tok-tok pesin Michael Muchiri, tell BBC say dem don begin investigations.

According to videos and fotos wey trend for social media, di gbege bin hapun wen wahala start for one side of di stadium and e make pipo begin dey rush.

Na from di rush di crush hapun and e lead to di death of di young Kenyan lady.

Meanwhile, di organiser of di concert, Tukutane Entertainment confam di incident say dem dey sad ontop di loss of life for dia event.

Karen death don cause serious tok-tok among Kenyans and oda music lovers wey attend di concert.

Di mama of di 20-year-old woman dey demand for justice.

For one post on social media wia she tag di concert organisers, Asake and co-headlining artist Gabzy, Karen mama write: "Wetin hapun to my pikin? Why her? I want justice for my pikin."

"During one musical concert for Nyayo National Stadium, brief stampede hapun for di entry gate.

"While di situation later calm down and fans dey able to access di stadium wit di concert progressing, di unfortunate case of a 20-year old woman wey dem press to death near di entry point dey recorded," Kenyan police tok-tok pesin Michael Muchiri tell BBC.

Wen BBC bin reach out to di organisers of di event, Tukutane, for comments, dem say dem dey work wit relevant authorities bifor dem release statement ontop di incident.

Di organiser of di concert, Tukutane Entertainment say dem dey sad for di incident.

"We dey deeply sad to confam say tragic incident hapun during our December

20th concert, wey result for di loss of life."

"Our hearts dey wit di family, friends, and loved ones wey affected by dis devastating loss."

According to di organiser, dem say dem no dey take safety of fans play and dem dey cooperate well well wit di authorities so dem go fit understand wetin really hapun.

"Out of respect for di family and di ongoing investigation, we no go speculate on di

circumstances wey surround di incident."

On 20 December 2025, music lovers gada for Nyayo stadium for Nairobi, Kenya wia dem bin wan attend concert wia popular music artiste, Asake and oda musical artistes dey perform.

Report say plenti pipo wey get ticket and di one wey no get ticket bin wan enta di stadium despite di heavy security wey dey.

Account from pipo wey attend di concert say di gbege hapun wen some fans wey no get ticket wan gain entrance into di concert venue.

Dem come begin dey push into di venue so dem go fit enta but di security no gree.

Pipo wey witness am and post dia experience for social media, say shortly afta, di crowd bin overpower di security.

Na di push and rush to enta di entrance cause di crush, according to eyewitness report.

Report say Karen get ticket to enta di venue but di gbege wey dey hapun for di entrance lead to her death.

One similar crushbin happun during Asake concert for di Brixton O2 Academyfor south London for 2022, wen eight pipo land for hospital, wit four for critical condition.

Dat incident too, officers bin respond to reports of one big number of pipo wey dey try force dia way inside di venue.

Video for social media show one big crowd wey gada outside di venue, wit one pesin claiming on Twitter say more dan 1,000 pipo bin turn up witout tickets.

For di video footage, di crowd bin dey stretch from di road outside to di venue doors, wit pipo screaming, shouting and struggling.

Asake, wey im real name be Ahmed Ololade, dey nominated for BBC Radio 1 Sound of 2023 award.

E dey described for di venue website as "one of di hottest breakout stars from Nigeria" and dey tour im debut album, Mr. Money with the Vibe

Born and raised for Lagos State, im songs be part of di Nigerian street-pop subgenre wey blend Afrobeats wit Amapiano, pop melodies and street-smart rap lyrics.

E bin get break-out hit for 2020 wit im single Lady.

Asake don get different era of how e don look wit im hairstyle since im bin blow up for 2020 afta di release of im hit single Mr Money.

E don go from fat dreads to longer braids and even do tinted hair at some point in im career.

So far, Asake don run three albums wit YBNL for im career, wey dem call Mr. Money With The Vibe, Work of Art and Lungu Boy.

Im first album Mr. Money With The Vibe bin break record for di Billboard 200 chart as di highest charting Nigerian debut album wey di chart don get at dat time.

For 2023, e win di Next rated award for di Headies for September.

Asake describe how im join di label for different interviews say, "na Yhemoleee show Olamide wetin I fit do, na so Olamide call me one day say make we see and wen we finally meet, witout any paparazzi, e ask me weda I wan join YBNL, somtin wey I don dey wait for years".

For 2022, e sell out O2 Arena for concerts wey last three days sotay two pipo lose dia life for December sake of crush wey hapun.

So far, e don get two nominations for di Grammy awards. For 2024, e bin dey nominated for Best African Music Performance for im song Amapiano.

E also dey nominated for di 2025 Grammys for di same category for di song MMS wey im do wit fellow musician, Wizkid.

title: Afrobeats star Asake say im dey 'devastated' afta fan die for Kenya concert stadium crush

raw_text:
Di confederation of African football (Caf) don condemn di kasala wey happun during di Afcon final between host nation Morocco and Senegal on 18 January 2025.

Chaos breakout for di last minutes for dat game afta referee and VAR give penalty to Morocco for foul on Brahim Diaz.

Di game scata for more than 10 minutes as Senegal players boycott di game wey dem waka comot di park.

Senegal players vex sake of di centre referee blow whistle for foul inside di Morocco box bifor Senegal score dia goal.

Sake of di ref already bin blow di whistle, di VAR no fit check di incident – but Senegal players and coaches no gree.

Al Nassr forward and former Liverpool player Sadio Mane call out his teammates to return to di park and continue di game.

Youssef En-Nesyri wey be di penalty taker carry di ball give Brahim Diaz wey bin get five goals for di tournament.

But wit di chance to win dia next Afcon title in 50 years, Brahim Diaz try di Panenka penalty wey Edouard Mendy save di ball.

Senegal bin go ahead to score di winning goal for extra time thru Pape Gueye to break di hearts of Morocco players and fans.

Na so Caf announce say dem dey chook eye for di videos from di game to act against players and officials wey scata di game for di last minute.

Caf say "we condemn di unacceptable behaviour of some players and officials during di final – Caf no dey support behaviour like dat especially those wey dey target di refereeing team or match organizers."

"Caf dey review all di footage wey we go refer di mata to sabi pipo for act against di pipo wey go dey guilty."

Na so Fifa president Gianni Infantino wey watch di game for di stadium also 'condemn some Senegal players for di unacceptable scenes" wey overshadow di final.

Infantino tok inside one statement to AFP say "we strongly condemn dis behaviour of some Senegal players and technical staff members."

"Na unacceptable to comot di park like dat wey equally violence no dey tolerated for our sport; e just no be right."

Senegal coach Pape Thiaw wey lead his kontri to dia second Afcon don apologize say he ask his players to boycott di game afta dem award late penalty to Morocco.

Afta di game, coach Pape Thiaw tok for BeIN sports interview say "we no gree wit di decision, dat be why we do dat tin; I no like how I bin act."

"I tok di players to leave di pitch dat time sake of I don vex, I apologize to di world of football."

Thiaw add say "once I bin calm down wey I tink about di tin, I ask di players to go back to di pitch wey we all sabi wetin happun afta dat."

Meanwhile French manager Claude Leroy confam afta di game say Sadio Mane bin ask am for advice for di touchline during di confusion.

"Sadio ask me wetin I go do if I dey inside im shoes, wey I tok am say I go resume di game, sake of you neva sabi wetin go happun afta dat."

Las las Mane call his teammates wey di game continue – bifor di Teranga lions eventually win di game; dia second Afcon for dia history.

Sadio Mane also win di player of di tournament; wit dat, di 33-year-old player now win two Afcons, wey he be two-time Caf player of di year.

Yassine Bono from Morocco win goalkeeper of di tournament, Brahim Diaz win top scorer wit five goals.
title: Wetin Caf, Fifa dey do about Morocco vs Senegal Afcon final drama?

raw_text:
Di Presidency don withdraw di name of former Kebbi State guvnor Usman Dakingari wey dem bin announce on Thursday as di new ambassador designate to Turkey.

Bayo Onanuga wey be di tok-tok pesin for President Bola Tinubu bin publish a statement wia e tok say di President don approve di names of four pipo as ambassador designates to di United States of America, di United Kingdom, France and Turkey.

Ayodele Oke na di ambassador-designate to France, Lateef Are na di pesin for di US; Amin Dalhatu na for di UK, while Usman Dakingari na for Turkey, according to dat statement.

Tinubu also direct di Ministry of Foreign Affair "to notify di govments of di kontris about di ambassadors-designate, in accordance wit diplomatic procedures".

Howeva, dis Friday morning anoda statement come out from di presidency wey tok say "President Tinubu don approve di posting of three ambassadors-designate,no ambassador for Turkey yet".

Di statement also dey signed by Bayo Onanuga, but e no give any reason why di name of Dakingari no longer dey dia.

Dis development dey come as President Tinubu dey embark on a state visit to Turkey dis weekend.

Remember say President Tinubu bin appoint nominate 68 Nigerians including some names wey pipo describe as controversial like former presidential tok-tok pesin Reno Omokri and former aviation minister Femi Fani Kayode.

Di Nigerian senate don conclude di screening of di nominees since, but di president neva assign dem to di kontris wia dem go work.

Oga Dakingari serve as di guvnor of Kebbi State from 2007 to 2015 for di platform of di Peoples Democratic Party (PDP).

Im na graduate of Ahmadu Bello University Zaria wia e bin study Geography and graduate for 1984.

E bin start im professional career as Town Planning Officer for di Sokoto State Ministry of Works and Housing for 1985 bifor e later join di Nigerian Customs Service four years later.
title: Tinubu withdraw posting of former govnor of Kebbi State as ambassador to Turkey

raw_text:
For K-Dere community inside Ogoniland, for di Niger Delta region of southern Nigeria, a Shell-owned crude oil processing station dey silent, dey rust inside thick air.

Di plant no dey in use for over 30 years.

Metres away, tractors wey belong to di agency wey get di task of cleaning up oil spills – di Hydrocarbon Pollution Remediation Project (Hyprep) - dey work to remove pollution.

Ledisi Nomkia, a local farmer, point to one old cassava plants wey show di effects of oil spillage.

"Bifor oil spoil evritin, we bin get di best garri," she tok.

"Wen you plant cassava, you go harvest wetin to chop and sell. But now all dat wan don go, you go need a lot of fertilizers to get am to grow. We bin dey plant yam, cocoyam and watermelon but now we no fit," she tok.

E don reach 30 years since a group of nine activists from di Movement for di Survival of di Ogoni People (MOSOP) bin dey executed for case wey make  headlines around di world.

Di group wey writer Ken Saro-Wiwa lead, dey known for dia protests against pollution wey dem say na di Royal Dutch Shell Oil Corporation cause am, wey don dey collect oil from di region since di late 1950s.

Di activists say oil spills don spoil farm and coastal land and make di area uninhabitable.

Ledum Mitee, a lawyer and Saro-Wiwa deputy in MOSOP, bin chop arrest and dem try am wit di Ogoni nine but e escape death as dem find am not guilty.

"We form MOSOP and raise awareness by peaceful means for justice and for environmental remediation," e tok.

"Wen dis kontinu under di military regime, a lot of activities happun, many pipo bin dey killed."

Di casualties include four Ogoni chiefs wey bin dey opposed to MOSOP campaign and wey bin dey brutally murdered in 1994.

Despite concerns by human rights groups over di judicial process, dem hang Ken Saro-Wiwa and eight oda MOSOP activists for di crime in November 1995.

For October 2025, wen di 30-year anniversary of di executions happun, both di "Ogoni nine" activists and di "Ogoni four" chiefs bin get posthumous pardons by Nigeria president Bola Ahmed Tinubu.

Di move come as di federal govment dey consider to restart drilling, three decades after di killings bin throw di region into crisis.

Di Nigerian govment don publicly indicate say dem dey  look into Ogoniland as dem dey  target oil production of 1.8 million barrels per day by di end of 2025, and three million barrels per day by 2030.

But National Security Adviser Nuhu Ribadu say di main goal behind di pardons na reconciliation.

"One of di biggest challenges we face as a kontri na dat of di Ogoni wey lead to di crisis, di insecurity wey affect lives, environment and di pipo," e tok of di region.

"President Bola Ahmed come in and say time don reach for closure and to reconcile our pipo.

"We no dey do dat wan becos we want di exploration or exploitation to be di main tin, we do am for reconciliation, we do am to give back pipo dia lives," e tok.

Soil wey oil don soak – signs of serious environmental pollution – remain sometin wey common across Ogoniland.

"Di oil for dis community na blessing God give to us but since dis problem happun, I no know if I go call am a blessing or a curse," na so farmer Ledisi Nomkia.

59-year-old fisherman, Birabi Nenage also tok di same tin. Im say oil on top di water wia im dey fish mean say e must paddle far out to catch fish.

"One oil spill destroy all di mangrove hia up to di Bonny river," e tok.

"Since dat time till now, we di fishermen dey suffer, fishes no dey hia again. We no fit pay our children fees, and we no fit buy food to chop. Di water now dey toxic, and I get wound all over my body."

K-Dere no be di only community wey dey suffer from di destructive impact of oil spillage.

For 2008 a massive oil spill from Shell pipelines devastate neighbouring Bodo community.

For 2014, Shell settle wit di community in one of several lawsuits over oil spills and environmental damage for di Niger Delta.

However, di company don repeatedly deny wrongdoing, and dey maintain say environmental pollution dey caused by sabotage and "di wahala of oil theft and illegal mining" wey dem say dem no dey liable.

For 2021, one Dutch court order Shell to compensate farmers for spills wey contaminate large areas of farmland and fishing waters for di Niger Delta. Di company agree to pay more dan a hundred million dollars.

Today, fisherman Gbea Kpanbari say e still dey avoid di river becos of oil contamination.

"All di periwinkles, crabs and di mangroves don die and wen we travel to anoda local govment like Bonny to fish, e dey cause conflict," e tok.

In 2011, a United Nations Environment Programme report conclude way di environmental restoration of Ogoniland dey possible but fit take from 25 to 30 years.

Based on dat report, in 2017 di Nigerian govment, under di administration of President Muhammadu Buhari, set in motion a $1 billion clean-up and restoration programme.

But almost a decade later, di effort to clean up di land dey criticised by residents and environmental activists say e dey slow and inadequate.

But National Security Adviser Nuhu Ribadu say na work in progress.

"Right now, e get 65 places wia remediation dey take place. Cleaning up, restoring di whole place back to how  e suppose be. E get about 14 water projects... dis administration set up a specialist hospital wey directly dey relate to addressing some of di damages wey dey particular to health," e tok.

Ribadu also point to di establishment of a University of di Environment and to a project to restore mangroves.

"Now di whole world dey come to Ogoniland to see how e dey restored," e tok.

But Celestine Akpobari, wey for decades don dey campaign for di removal of pollution, believe say dem need to do more.

"Dia na ongoing struggle," e tok.

"Wen dem dey permit di oil companies to go in di name of divestment, dem no dey think about di pollution wey don damage di livelihood of di pipo."
title: 30 years since Saro-Wiwa execution, Ogoniland still dey struggle wit pollution

raw_text:
Evritin bin dey waka normal for 18 years old twin Makarem and Ikram before kasala burst for dia school.

Makarem bin dey English Literature class and Ikram bin dey for science lesson wen dem hear strange sound wey come from outside di school for Sudan.

Makarem say her shoulder shift wen di strike hit her. She shout, her classmates fall for ground to hide to avoid di shellfire wey dey happun.

"We take cover beside di walls and di girl wey dey stand next to me put her hand for my shoulder say "your shoulder dey bleed."

As kasala burst di two teachers wey bin dey separate classrooms try to reach each oda, but dem no fit. Later Ikram search for her sister but no know say dem don carri am go hospital.

Like odas wey dem don injure, locals carri Makarem go hospital, dem use cars and animal drawn carts sake of say no ambulance dey di city el-Obeid wia di school.

Her teachers and classmates later convince Ikram to abandon di search and go house.

End of Di one wey oda users dey read well well

Na later wen Makarem come back home from hospital dat day, dem sabi say she still dey alive.

"I wait for her outside for front door, when I see her dey come, evribodi cry," na so Ikram tok. She bin dey di part of di school wey shelling no touch and nothing happun to am.

Dem kill Makarem and Ikram English teacher plus 13 classmates. Dozens get injury for di attack for Sitta girls school for el-Obeid, for north Kordofab state for August 2024. Di school dey normally get about 300 students.

Regional authorities dey accuse di paramilitary group Rapid Support Forces RSF wey bin dey on war wit Sudan army say na dem do di shelling.

RSF never comment on di incident and no respond to BBC request for comment. E never clear weda dem intentionally shell di schools.

Makarem say half of her friends for di school die while plenti get injury.

Apart from di shoulder injury, she also get head wound, but di hospital discharge am as she don take basic treatment.

But some days later, she develop severe headache, dem do her CT scan, na dia dem find out say she get piece of shrapnel inside her head.

"E dey pain well-well, I take plenti painkillers" she tok.

Sudan civil war start for April 2023 and don lead to di death of 150,000 pipo and displace millions.

United Nations say di kontri now dey face di worst humanitarian crisis for di world.

13 million out of 17 million school age children wey still dey for Sudan dey out of school according to di UN.

Dem close Abu Sitta school for three months after di attack as dem renovate am.

Makarem and Ikram bin say dem no fit return to di place wia dem kill dia friends and teacher.

"But wen I see my friends dey return and dey tell me say tins don dey ok, I decide to change my mind," na so Ikram tok.

Even so, as dem return to school, e bring back painful memories.

Dem bin give some students psychological support for school wen dem return, na so Headteacher Iman Ahmed tok.

Dem provide beds and nurses to help injured students take dia exams in comfort.

Even though el-Obeid dey see drone attacks, when BBC visit di area for December, we see di students dey play and laugh for courtyard.

Di Headteacher describe di girl's determination to continue dia studies despite wetin happun to dem as "form of defiance and loyalty to dose wey dem loose".

Situation of children to study for el-Obeid now dey challenging.

Di city dey under siege by di RSF for more dan one year and half until Sudan army regain control for February 2025.

Though calm don kinda return to di area, dem don convert dozens of schools into shelters for pipo wey dey run from war.

El-Obeid dey host almost one million displaced pipo across shelters according to di state humanitarian aid commissioner.

Ibtisam Ali, wey be student for secondary school wey dem don convert say she no fit leave her classroom until end of school day cos plenti displaced pipo full evriwia.

"Even to go to di bathroom na problem for us," na so she tok.

Minister of education for North Kordofan state Walid Mohamed Al-Hassan say di presence of displaced families for schools dey cause problems - including sanitation but dese na conditions of war and cost of war.

Despite di war and evritin wey happun, Makarem and Ikram wey don turn 19 dey hopeful about dia future.

Ikram don complete her studies for school and now dey study English for di University for el-Obeid.

Her inspiration na her English teacher Fathiya Khalil Ibrahim wey dem kill for di attack.

Di death of her friends make am dey more determined to complete her studies, na so she tok.

"I continue dey tell myself say say we go dey carri on di ambition to achieve wetin dem no fit achieve."

Makarem wan become doctor like di ones wey treat am after di attack injure am.

She pass her secondary school exams but she no pass di score dem require to enta university to study medicine.

Makarem say di shrapnel wey lodge inside her head wey dem no fit remove surgically bin make am hard for her to study like bifor.

"I dey only fit study for one hour, and den rest for anoda one hour. E bin dey difficult."

Dr Tarek Zobier wey be neurologist for Sudan say medical implications of having shrapnel for head dey vary from case to case.

Some pipo fit no experience symptoms and fit live without medical intervention.

But if dem begin get severe symptoms alike spasms, dem go need surgery.

For Makarem di pain no too dey again though e dey come more during cold times. She dey rely on painkillers wen e come.

She don decide to repeat her school year so she fit retake her exams.

"I believe say I go fit achieve di score wey I dey aim."

"I dey hopeful for future," na so she tok.
title: 'Dem kill half of my friends' - Twins wey witness attacks on dia school tok

raw_text:
As at Monday 26 January, 2026, big political movement don reduce di number of govnors wey still dey opposition parties for Nigeria.

Dis dey come afta Kano State Govnor Abba Yusuf officially join di All Progressives Congress (APC) from di New Nigeria People's Party (NNPP).

Nigeria political scene show say power don really move go di ruling APC, as di party dey control most of di state govments across di kontri.

But still, some govnors never defect go di ruling party.

Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) come second from far, wit govnors for small number of states. Even though PDP still get presence for some parts of Northeast, Northcentral and Southwest, di reduced number show say di party still dey struggle to regain di ground wey e lose since di last general elections.

Wit 30 govnors, APC remain di strongest political party among Nigeria 36 states. Di party control dey reach important economic centres and politically sensitive states like Lagos, Rivers, Delta, Kaduna and Kano.

PDP wey bifor dey control many states now get only four states, afta recent defections from Akwa Ibom, Delta, Enugu, Bayelsa, Taraba, Rivers and Plateau states.

Ahmadu Fintiri na di current Govnor of Adamawa State. E be strong member of PDP. E bin win di 2019 govnorship election and now dey serve second term.

E neva change political party bifor from start to now as e remain loyal member of PDP.

Govnor Fintiri don repeatedly reject rumours say e wan defect go APC. Official statements and im leadership role inside PDP don show say e be "bonafide" PDP member.

For first quarter media briefing of 2025, im Principal Special Adviser, Judge Kushi, tell di public make dem ignore claims say di govnor wan leave PDP, say Govnor "remain bonafide member of PDP and no dey leave".

Bala Mohammed na di current govnor of Bauchi State. Dem declare am govnor on March 26, 2019. For dat hot election, Bala Mohammed, as PDP candidate, beat di den sitting govnor, Muhammed Abubakar of APC.

Govnor Mohammed don react to allegations of terrorism financing wey dem link to im administration. E describe di move by Economic and Financial Crimes Commission (EFCC) as persecution and attempt to criminalise am bicos e refuse to defect to di APC.

Speaking on Wednesday for Bauchi while receiving award as Safety Ambassador from Safety Institute of Nigeria, di govnor complain say even though e get constitutional immunity, dem still mention im name for court papers related to di allegations.

E accuse EFCC and di federal govment say dem dey try intimidate am bicos e no gree join di ruling party.

"Dis na kontri wia if you work, you go becom villain. I don keep quiet for too long for peace and security. But I no be coward. I no go join dem. I refuse to join dia party [APC]" e tok.

Seyi Makinde na di current Govnor of Oyo State and e dey serve second term. E first win election for 2019 and later win landslide re-election for 2023.

E join PDP for 2010 to contest Senate seat for 2011 elections but e lose party primary. For late 2014, afta e fail to secure PDP govnorship ticket for 2015, e defect go SDP. E contest 2015 govnorship election under SDP and come third.

Later, e return go PDP and win di 2019 govnorship election.

For Thursday, 22 January 2026, Govnor Makinde meet President Bola Tinubu, as e tok say na to "discuss issues of govnance".

Makinde, wey pipo dey rumour say e dey eye PDP presidential ticket for 2027 general elections, tell State House journalists afta di meeting say e dey comfortable wit PDP and no get plan to leave di party.

Dauda Lawal na di current govnor of Zamfara State. For March 2023, e beat di sitting govnor, Bello Matawalle, to win di govnorship election for Zamfara State.

For 9 June 2025, Govnor Lawal strongly reject calls make e comot from PDP go join APC. Di govnor take dis position afta former Zamfara govnor, Bello Matawalle, wey now be Minister of State for Defence, publicly ask am make e change party.

Di govnor media aide, Mustafa Kaura, tok say Lawal no go leave di party wey bring am to power.

"Some pipo dey spread rumour say Govnor Dauda Lawal wan leave PDP go APC. No atom of truth dey inside am. Make PDP supporters ignore am," Kaura tok.

Recently again, rumours come up about Govnor Dauda and possible defection to APC. But Zamfara State chapter of APC say dem see fake report, wey claim say Govnor Dauda Lawal don send letter come ask for APC membership.

Di party say di report dey bad, false, unfounded and na example of how some pipo dey mislead odas and cause confusion inside stable and peaceful party like APC.

For one statement, APC state publicity secretary, Mallam Yusuf Idris Gusau, say di party get proper channels wia dem dey do tins in a guided way.

Ademola Adeleke na di current govnor of Osun State, southwest Nigeria.

For one major political move, e recently change party. Adeleke bin be long-time PDP member, wia e bin win Senate seat for 2017 and govnorship for 2022.

But bicos of "persistent leadership wahala" inside national PDP, e formally resign from PDP for November 2025 and join Accord (A).

Charles Soludo na di current govnor of Anambra State, and e bin recently win re-election for second term.

Soludo don change parties bifor. E first contest Anambra govnorship for 2010 under PDP. E resign from PDP for 2013 and join di All Progressives Grand Alliance (Apga), wia e don remain since, winning first term for 2021 and second term for November 2025.

Alex Otti dey serve im first term as Govnor of Abia State. Otti don move between parties. E first contest govnorship for 2015 and 2019 under Apga.

E later briefly join APC bifor e defect go Labour Party for May 2022, wia e win Abia State 2023 govnorship election.
title: Which Nigerian govnors still dey opposition parties as Kano Govnor Yusuf join APC

raw_text:
Di Super Eagles of Nigeria no go play for di 2025 Afcon final afta di hosts Atlas Lions of Morocco beat dem 4-2 on penalties for di semi-final

Di match wey hapun on Wednesday tough well-well as e get plenti action.

Morocco dominate di stats for open play but di two kontris no fit find di net afta 120 minutes as extra-time too no bring any goal, na penalties settle di mata

Morocco go face Senegal for di final while Nigeria and Egypt go jam for di third place match on Saturday.

Dis go be Morocco first final since 2004 while Nigeria bin finish second for di last edition.

Overall, Nigeria and Morocco bin don meet 11 times, di Atlas Lions bin don win six, di Super Eagles win three and dem draw two times.

For di Africa Cup of Nations, dem bin don meet five times and na still di Morocco side get di upper hand wit three wins against Nigeria two.

Dia first meeting na for di group stage of di 1976 Afcon wia Morocco beat Nigeria 3-1. And dia last meeting before dis na January 2004, also for Afcon group stage, and Morocco win 1-0.

However, di only time wey dem don meet for Afcon semi-final like dis one, na for 19 March,1980, and Nigeria bin win wit one goal by Felix Owolabi a.k.a Owo-blow, for di ninth minute.
title: Morocco defeat Nigeria 4-2 on penalties to reach Afcon 2025 final

raw_text:
Olakunle Churchill, di estranged husband of Nigerian actress Tonto Dike don confam say true-true im don settle di differences e get wit im ex-wife.

Di philanthropist for one lengthy post on im official Instagram account acknowledge say di kasala wey happun between dem don end and now dia focus na on co-parenting wit love, care plus shared commitment to raise dia son King Andre.

Oga Churchill also note say dis na di first time im go follow im son tok in nearly a decade. "I dey pleasantly surprised wen I received a call from my son, King Andre, for di first time. Hearing him call me "Daddy" bin dey deeply touching and a reminder say wetin God no fit no exist."
